trait.name: Antimagic Susceptibility
entries: The ball bearing is incapacitated while in the area of an {@spell antimagic field}. If targeted by {@spell dispel magic}, the ball bearing must succeed on a Constitution saving throw against the caster's spell save DC or fall unconscious for 1 minute.

trait.name: Constructed Nature
entries: The ball bearing doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

Additionally, the magic that animates an object is dispelled when the ball bearing drops to 0 hit points. A ball bearing reduced to 0 hit points becomes inanimate and is too damaged to be of much use or value to anyone.

trait.name: Evasion
entries: If the ball bearing is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw and only half damage if it fails, provided it isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the ball bearing remains motionless and isn't flying, it is indistinguishable from a normal ball bearing.

trait.name: Flyby
entries: The ball bearing doesn't provoke an opportunity attack when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The ball bearing makes two Slam attacks.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}1 bludgeoning damage.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The book casts one of the following spells, requiring no components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 13}, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks):

trait.name: Antimagic Susceptibility
entries: The book is incapacitated while in the area of an {@spell antimagic field}. If targeted by {@spell dispel magic}, the book must succeed on a Constitution saving throw against the caster's spell save DC or fall unconscious for 1 minute.

trait.name: Constructed Nature
entries: The book doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

Additionally, the magic that animates an object is dispelled when the book drops to 0 hit points. A book reduced to 0 hit points becomes inanimate and is too damaged to be of much use or value to anyone.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the book remains motionless and isn't flying, it is indistinguishable from a normal book.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) bludgeoning damage

reaction.name: Steal Magic (1/Day)
entries: When the book sees a creature within 60 feet of it casting a spell, the book attempts to steal that spell during its casting. If the creature is casting a spell of 3rd level or lower, its spell fails and has no effect. If it is casting a spell of 4th level or higher, the book must make an Intelligence check. The DC equals 10 + the spell's level. On a success, the creature's spell fails and has no effect.
When the book causes a spell to fail in this way, the book can immediately duplicate that spell's effects as a part of the same reaction, as if it had cast the spell using its Spellcasting.

trait.name: Antimagic Susceptibility
entries: The wagon is incapacitated while in the area of an {@spell antimagic field}. If targeted by {@spell dispel magic}, the ball bearing must succeed on a Constitution saving throw against the caster's spell save DC or fall unconscious for 1 minute.

trait.name: Beast of Burden
entries: The wagon is considered to be one size larger for the purpose of determining its carrying capacity.

trait.name: Constructed Nature
entries: The wagon doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

Additionally, the magic that animates an object is dispelled when the ball bearing drops to 0 hit points. A ball bearing reduced to 0 hit points becomes inanimate and is too damaged to be of much use or value to anyone.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the wagon remains motionless and isn't flying, it is indistinguishable from a normal wagon.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The wagon makes a Slam attack and a Wheels attack.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d10 + 3}) bludgeoning damage. If the clockwork moved at least 20 feet straight toward the target immediately before the hit, the target must make a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw. On a failure, the target takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) bludgeoning damage and is knocked {@condition prone}. On a success, a creature takes half as much damage and is not knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Wheels
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one {@condition prone} creature. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage and the wagon can immediately move up to 10 feet through the target's space without provoking opportunity attacks from it.

monster.name: Guardian Portrait
languages: plus up to two other languages

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The portrait casts one of the following spells, requiring no components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 12}, {@hit 4} to hit with spell attacks):

trait.name: Antimagic Susceptibility
entries: The portrait is incapacitated while in the area of an {@spell antimagic field}. If targeted by {@spell dispel magic}, the portrait must succeed on a Constitution saving throw against the caster's spell save DC or become unconscious for 1 minute.

trait.name: Constructed Nature
entries: The portrait doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

Additionally, the magic that animates an object is dispelled when the construct drops to 0 hit points. An animated object reduced to 0 hit points becomes inanimate and is too damaged to be of much use or value to anyone.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the figure in the portrait remains motionless, the portrait is indistinguishable from a normal painting.

reaction.name: Counterspell (3/Day)
entries: The portrait interrupts a creature that it can see that is casting a spell. If the spell is 3rd-level or lower, it fails and has no effect. If the spell is 4th-level or higher, the portrait makes an Intelligence check, the DC of which is equal to 10 + the spell's level. On a success, the spell fails and has no effect.

trait.name: Antimagic Susceptibility
entries: The swarm is incapacitated while in the area of an {@spell antimagic field}. If targeted by {@spell dispel magic}, the swarm must succeed on a Constitution saving throw against the caster's spell save DC or fall unconscious for 1 minute.

trait.name: Constructed Nature
entries: The swarm doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

Additionally, the magic that animates an object is dispelled when the ball bearing drops to 0 hit points. A swarm reduced to 0 hit points becomes inanimate and is too damaged to be of much use or value to anyone.

trait.name: Evasion
entries: If the swarm is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw and only half damage if it fails, provided it isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the swarm remains motionless and isn't flying, it is indistinguishable from a normal pile of ball bearings.

trait.name: Flyby
entries: The swarm doesn't provoke an opportunity attack when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

trait.name: Swarm
entries: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny ball bearing. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

action.name: Slams
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 0 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 4d4}) bludgeoning damage, or 5 ({@damage 2d4}) bludgeoning damage if the swarm has half its hit points or fewer.

monster.name: Bloodthrall
languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

trait.name: Amorphous
entries: The bloodthrall can move through a space as narrow as 6 inches wide without squeezing.

trait.name: Blood Drain
entries: Whenever the bloodthrall kills a creature, it regains hit points equal to that creature's maximum number of hit dice, then if the killed creature was the same size as the bloodthrall or larger, the bloodthrall's size doubles in all dimensions, and its weight is multiplied by eight. This growth increases its size by one category and lasts for 24 hours. The bloodthrall gains none of these benefits if the killed creature was Undead or a Construct.
Each time the bloodthrall's size increases in this way it gains the following cumulative benefits: Its speed increases by 5 feet.
It gains advantage on Strength checks and saving throws.
When it makes a melee attack, its reach for the attack is 5 feet greater.
When it makes a melee weapon attack, it gains a +3 bonus to the damage roll.
It recharges its Bloodlet.

trait.name: Essence Hunger
entries: Whenever the bloodthrall deals necrotic damage to a creature, it regains hit points equal to the necrotic damage dealt.

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The bloodthrall is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The bloodthrall has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Necrotic Weapons
entries: The bloodthrall's weapon attacks are magical. When the bloodthrall hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra {@damage 2d4} necrotic damage (included in the attack).

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The bloodthrall makes a Claws attack and two Bloodspike attacks.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) slashing damage plus 5 ({@damage 2d4}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Bloodspike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d12 + 3}) slashing damage plus 5 ({@damage 2d4}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Dissolve
entries: The bloodthrall transforms into a pool of blood. While in this form, the bloodthralls base walking speed is reduced to 10 feet and it has immunity to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage. The bloodthrall can return to its true form as a bonus action.

action.name: Bloodlet {@recharge}
entries: The bloodthrall stares at a creature that it can see within 30 feet of it, forcibly drawing blood from its body. The target must make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw, taking 33 ({@damage 6d10}) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

resist.note: from nonmagical attacks that aren't adamantine

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The worm regains 10 hit points at the start of each of its turns if it has at least 1 hit point.

trait.name: Tunneler
entries: The worm can burrow through solid rock at half its burrow speed and leaves a 10-foot-diameter tunnel in its wake.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: The worm deals double damage to objects and structures.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The worm makes two Slam attacks and one Grinding Jaws attacks.

action.name: Grinding Jaws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}22 ({@damage 3d8 + 9}) slashing damage.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 5 ft. one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 3d6 + 9}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Earth-Breacher Beam {@recharge}
entries: The worm fires a beam of destructive energy forming a line 300 feet long and 15 feet wide that blasts out from it in a direction it chooses. Each creature in the line must make a {@dc 19} Dexterity saving throw, taking 28 ({@damage 8d6}) force damage plus 28 ({@damage 8d6}) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A target gains no benefit from cover for this saving throw.
A nonmagical object that isn't being worn or carried also takes the damage if it's in the line.

reaction.name: Defensive Pulse (3/Day)
entries: In response to taking damage, the worm releases a defensive shockwave. Each creature within 10 feet of the worm must make a {@dc 19} Strength saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 11 ({@damage 2d10}) thunder damage and is pushed 10 feet in a straight line away from the worm and is knocked {@condition prone}. On a success, a creature takes half as much damage and is not pushed or knocked {@condition prone}.
A nonmagical object that isn't being worn or carried also takes the damage if it's in the area.

variant.name: Hellfire Bore Worm
entries: The {@creature hellfire bore worm|GOLEM} is a twisted variant of the bore worm, crafted by the warmasters of the Nine Hells to fight the endless Blood War.

resist.note: from nonmagical attacks that aren't adamantine

trait.name: Heated Body
entries: A creature that touches the worm or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) fire damage.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The worm regains 10 hit points at the start of each of its turns if it has at least 1 hit point.

trait.name: Tunneler
entries: The worm can burrow through solid rock at half its burrow speed and leaves a 10-foot-diameter tunnel in its wake.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: The worm deals double damage to objects and structures.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The worm makes two Slam attacks and one Grinding Jaws attacks.

action.name: Grinding Jaws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}22 ({@damage 3d8 + 9}) slashing damage.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 5 ft. one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 3d6 + 9}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Hellfire Beam {@recharge}
entries: The worm fires a beam of super-heated energy forming a line 300 feet long and 15 feet wide that blasts out in a direction it chooses. Each creature in the line must make a {@dc 19} Dexterity saving throw, taking 28 ({@damage 8d6}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A target gains no benefit from half cover for this saving throw. A creature that fails its saving throw ignites. Until a creature takes an action to douse the fire, the target takes 14 ({@damage 4d6}) fire damage at the start of each of its turns.
A nonmagical object that isn't being worn or carried also takes damage if it's in the line and if it's flammable, it ignites.

reaction.name: Defensive Pulse (3/Day)
entries: In response to taking damage, the worm releases a defensive shockwave. Each creature within 10 feet of the worm must make a {@dc 19} Strength saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 11 ({@damage 2d10}) thunder damage and is pushed 10 feet in a straight line away from the worm and is knocked {@condition prone}. On a success, a creature takes half as much damage and is not pushed or knocked {@condition prone}.
A nonmagical object that isn't being worn or carried also takes the damage if it's in the area.

resist.note: from nonmagical attacks that aren't adamantine

trait.name: Construct Nature
entries: The collector doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The collector is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The collector has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Necrotic Weapons
entries: The collector's weapon attacks are magical. When the collector hits with a weapon attack, it deals an extra {@damage 2d10} necrotic damage (included in the attack).

trait.name: Undead Commander
entries: Whenever the collector hits a creature with a weapon attack, it can choose to mark the target until the start of the collector's next turn. While the target remains marked, Undead creatures allied to the collector have advantage on attack rolls made against it. The mark ends early if the collector marks another creature or dies.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The collector makes three attacks: two with its Claws and one with its Slam. It can replace one attack with a use of Command Specter.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d10 + 5}) slashing damage plus 11 ({@damage 2d10}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 3d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage plus 11 ({@damage 2d10}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Command Specter
entries: The collector issues a telepathic command to up to two specters created by its Summon Specters bonus action that it can see within 60 feet of it. Each chosen specter must immediately use its reaction, if available, to move up to half its speed and make a Life Drain attack against a target of the collector's choice that it can see.

action.name: Paralyzing Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The collector releases paralyzing gas in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a successful {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition paralyzed} for 1 minute. A {@condition paralyzed} creature repeats the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself with a success.

bonus.name: Summon Specters (5/Day)
entries: The collector calls up the enslaved spirits of those it has slain; two specters arise in unoccupied spaces within 15 feet of the collector. Specters summoned this way have only 13 ({@dice 3d8}) hit points and lack the Sunlight Sensitivity trait. They act right after the collector on the same initiative count and fight until they're destroyed. They disappear after 1 minute, or when the collector is destroyed.

immune.note: from nonmagical attacks that aren't adamantine conditions immunities charmed

trait.name: Construct Nature
entries: Collector Prime doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: Collector Prime is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If Collector Prime fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: Collector Prime has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Necrotic Weapons
entries: Collector Prime's weapon attacks are magical. When Collector Prime hits with a weapon attack, it deals an extra {@damage 4d10} necrotic damage (included in the attack).

trait.name: Rejuvenation
entries: If Collector Prime is destroyed, it returns to life with all its hit points and in a new body after {@dice 2d6} days. Its old body is destroyed and the new body appears in the nearest unoccupied space.

trait.name: Undead Commander
entries: Whenever Collector Prime hits a creature with a weapon attack, it can choose to mark the target until the start of Collector Prime's next turn. While the mark persists, Undead creatures allied to Collector Prime have advantage on attack rolls made against the marked target. The mark ends early if Collector Prime marks another creature or dies.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The collector makes two Claw attacks and one Slam attack. It then uses Command Specter. It can replace its Slam attack with a use of Iron Storm.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 16} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}24 ({@damage 3d10 + 8}) slashing damage plus 22 ({@damage 4d10}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 16} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}47 ({@damage 6d12 + 8}) bludgeoning damage plus 22 ({@damage 4d10}) necrotic damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 20} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Command Specter
entries: Collector Prime issues a telepathic command to up to two specters created by its Summon Specters bonus action that it can see within 60 feet of it. Each chosen specter must immediately use its reaction, if available, to move up to half its speed and make a Life Drain attack against a target of Collector Prime's choice that it can see.

action.name: Iron Storm
entries: Collector Prime unleashes a wave of jagged iron, forming a line 30 feet long and 10 feet wide that extends out from it in a direction it chooses. Each creature in the line must make a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw, taking 28 ({@damage 8d6}) slashing damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

A creature damaged by this effect loses 14 ({@dice 4d6}) hit points at the start of each of its turns due to a bleeding wound. Each time a creature takes damage from this effect after the first, the damage dealt by the wound increases by 14 ({@dice 4d6}). Any creature can take an action to stanch the wound with a successful {@dc 16} Wisdom (Medicine) check. The wound also closes if the target receives magical healing.

action.name: Paralyzing Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: Collector Prime releases paralyzing gas in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a successful {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition paralyzed} for 1 minute. A {@condition paralyzed} creature repeats the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself with a success.

bonus.name: Summon Specters
entries: Collector Prime calls up the enslaved spirits of those it has slain; four specters arise in unoccupied spaces within 15 feet of Collector Prime. Specters summoned this way lack the Sunlight Sensitivity trait and gain a +3 bonus to attack rolls. They act right after Collector Prime on the same initiative count and fight until they're destroyed. They disappear after 1 minute, or when Collector Prime is destroyed.

legendary.name: Command Specter
entries: Collector Prime uses Command Specter.

legendary.name: Move
entries: Collector Prime moves up to its speed.

legendary.name: Iron Storm (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Collector Prime uses Iron

legendary.name: Summon Specters (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: Collector Prime uses

monster.name: Chardalyn Juggernaut
languages: the languages known by its creator

trait.name: Constructed Nature
entries: The juggernaut doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The juggernaut is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.
Magic Resistance The juggernaut has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Reckless
entries: At the start of its turn, the juggernaut can gain advantage on all melee weapon attack rolls during that turn, but attack rolls against it have advantage until the start of its next turn.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: The juggernaut deals double damage to objects and structures.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The juggernaut makes two Chardalyn Flail attacks then uses Rampaging Smash.

action.name: Chardalyn Flail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d8 + 6}) bludgeoning damage. If the juggernaut moved at least 20 feet straight toward the target immediately before the hit, the target takes an extra 9 ({@damage 2d8}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 18} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Rampaging Smash
entries: The juggernaut slams its flails down on a target within 5 feet of it. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw or take 9 ({@damage 2d8}) bludgeoning damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) thunder damage. A {@condition prone} creature makes this saving throw with disadvantage.

A shockwave then emanates from the slam and each creature within 15 feet of the target other than the juggernaut and the original target must make a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw, taking 9 ({@damage 2d8}) thunder damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one. A nonmagical object that isn't being worn or carried also takes the damage if it's in the shockwave's area.

bonus.name: Thundering Charge {@recharge 4}
entries: The juggernaut takes the Dash action.

monster.name: Chardalyn Knight
languages: the languages known by its creator

trait.name: Constructed Nature
entries: The knight doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The knight is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.
Magic Resistance The knight has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The knight makes two Chardalyn Longsword or Ice Ray attacks. It then makes a Fist attack or uses Drain Essence.

action.name: Chardalyn Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) slashing damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) cold damage.

action.name: Fist
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d4 + 5}) bludgeoning damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) cold damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 16}). Until this grapple ends, the creature is {@condition restrained}, and the knight can't make a Fist attack against another target.

action.name: Ice Ray
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 7} to hit, range 60 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d8}) cold damage. If the target is a creature, its speed is reduced by 10 feet until the start of the knight's next turn.

action.name: Drain Essence
entries: The knight draws the lifeforce from a creature it's grappling. The target must make a {@dc 16} Charisma saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 27 ({@damage 6d8}) necrotic damage, and it suffers three levels of {@condition exhaustion}. On a success, a creature takes half as much damage and it suffers only one level of {@condition exhaustion}.
Regardless, the knight gains temporary hit points equal to the necrotic damage the target takes and for the next 24 hours, it gains a flying speed equal to its walking speed and can hover.
This action can't cause a creature to exceed three levels of {@condition exhaustion} and any levels of {@condition exhaustion} caused by this action go away after the creature finishes a long rest.

monster.name: Chardalyn Parasite
languages: the languages known by its creator

trait.name: Constructed Nature
entries: The parasite doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: Damage Transfer
entries: While attached to a creature, the parasite takes only half the damage dealt to it (rounded down). and that creature takes the other half.

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The parasite is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.
Magic Resistance The parasite has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The parasite can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The parasite makes three Bite attacks. If it's attached to a creature, it can replace one Bite attack with a use of Demonic Influence.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, the parasite attaches to the target and pulls itself into the target's space. While attached, the parasite moves with the target and has advantage on attack rolls against it.

A creature can use its action to try to detach the parasite and force it to move into the nearest unoccupied space, doing so with a successful {@dc 11} Strength check. On its turn, the parasite can detach itself from the target by using 5 feet of movement. When it dies, the parasite detaches from any creature it is attached to.

action.name: Demonic Influence
entries: The parasite magically influences the mind of a creature it's attached to. The target must make a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw. On success, the target takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) psychic damage and is otherwise unaffected. On a failure, the target becomes {@condition charmed} by the parasite for 1 hour, or until the parasite is detached.

While {@condition charmed} in this way, the parasite has total and precise control over the target. The target takes only actions the parasite chooses, and doesn't do anything the parasite doesn't allow it to do. During this time the parasite can also cause the creature to use a reaction, but this requires the parasite to use its own reaction as well.

monster.name: Clockwork Battering Ram
languages: understands one language of its creator but can't speak

trait.name: Beast of Burden
entries: The clockwork is considered to be one size larger for the purpose of determining its carrying capacity.

trait.name: Constructed Nature
entries: The clockwork doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The clockwork has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: The clockwork deals double damage to objects and structures.

trait.name: Sure-Footed
entries: The clockwork has advantage on Strength and Dexterity ability checks and saving throws made against effects that would knock it {@condition prone}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The clockwork makes a Ram attack and a Hooves attack.

action.name: Hooves
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 2d4 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Ram
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage. If the clockwork moved at least 20 feet straight toward the target immediately before the hit, the target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 10 feet in a straight line away from the clockwork and knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Arcane Charge {@recharge 5}
entries: The clockwork moves up to 80 feet in a straight line, if it would collide with a creature, object, or structure, it can immediately makes a Ram attack against it or it stops. On a hit, the attack deals an extra 5 ({@damage 2d4}) force damage and the ram can keep moving through its space without provoking opportunity attacks from it.

monster.name: Clockwork Brass Butler
languages: understands one language of its creator but can't speak

trait.name: Constructed Nature
entries: The clockwork doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The clockwork has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The clockwork makes two Fist attacks.

action.name: Fist
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) bludgeoning damage.

bonus.name: Helpful
entries: The clockwork takes the Help action.

monster.name: Clockwork Tiny Terror
languages: understands one language of its creator but can't speak

trait.name: Constructed Nature
entries: The clockwork doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The clockwork has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The clockwork makes two Modular Weaponry attacks.

action.name: Modular Weaponry
entries: The clockwork has two modular weapons from the options below (choose two or roll {@dice 2d10}). It uses one of them as a part of this action.

items.name: 1–2: Drill
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage. The clockwork can move up to 5 feet before making this attack.

items.name: 3–4: Firearm
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 30/90 ft., one creature. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d4}) piercing damage.

items.name: 5–6: Harpoon
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature or object, it's pulled up to 10 feet in a straight line toward the clockwork. Otherwise, the clockwork is pulled 10 feet in a straight line toward the target.

items.name: 7–8: Mallet
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage.

items.name: 9–10: Pincer
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 12}). The clockwork has a number of pincers depending on its modular weaponry (either one or two), each of which can grapple only one target.

trait.name: Baleful Howling
entries: Haunting wails of pain issue from gloomgad's maw. Whenever a creature other than the gloomgad starts its turn within 30 feet of the gloomgad and can hear it, it must make a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, a creature becomes {@condition frightened} of the gloomgad until the start of its next turn. On a success, a creature becomes immune to the gloomgad's Frightful Howling for the next 24 hours.

trait.name: Constructed Nature
entries: The gloomgad doesn't require air, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The golem is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The gloomgad has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The gloomgad's weapon attacks are magical.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The gloomgad uses Woeful Breath, then it makes two Claw attacks. If both attacks hit a Medium or smaller target, the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 15}), and the gloomgad can then use Ravenous Abyss on it, if available.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) slashing damage plus 5 ({@damage 2d4}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Woeful Breath
entries: The gloomgad exhales pure suffering in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a {@dc 16} Charisma saving throw, or whenever it makes an attack roll or a saving throw before the spell ends, the target must roll a {@dice d4} and subtract the number rolled from the attack roll, ability check, or saving throw.

action.name: Ravenous Abyss {@recharge 5}
entries: The gloomgad devours a Large or smaller creature {@condition grappled} by it. The target is banished to a demiplane of shadow, which is a 30-foot-radius sphere filled with magical darkness. A creature with darkvision can't see through this darkness, and nonmagical light can't illuminate it. While there, a creature takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) necrotic damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) psychic damage at the start of each of its turns. A creature killed by this damage can't be returned to life by any means short of a {@spell wish} spell. Furthermore, a haunted visage of its face is added to the gloomgad's body, and its screams are added to the cacophony of its Baleful Howling feature.

At the end of each of its turns, a creature trapped in the demiplane can make a Charisma saving throw. On a success, the target escapes the demiplane, falling {@condition prone} in a space within 5 feet of the gloomgad. If the gloomgad dies, a creature in the demiplane can escape from the demiplane using 30 feet of movement, exiting {@condition prone} in a space within 5 feet of the gloomgad's corpse.

monster.name: Bone Golem

resist.note: from nonmagical attacks that aren't adamantine

languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

trait.name: Constructed Nature
entries: The golem doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: Hazardous Body
entries: A creature that touches the golem or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it suffers a bleeding wound, losing 7 ({@dice 2d6}) hit points at the start of each of its turns due to the wound. Each time a wounded creature triggers the effects of this trait thereafter, the damage dealt by the wound increases by 7 ({@dice 2d6}). Any creature can take an action to stanch the wound with a successful {@dc 11} Wisdom (Medicine) check. The wound also closes if the target receives magical healing.

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The golem is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The golem has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The golem's weapon attacks are magical.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The golem makes two Claw or Bonesplinter attacks.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) slashing damage and if the target is a creature, it suffers the effects of the golem's Hazardous Body.

action.name: Bonesplinter
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) piercing damage and if the target is a creature, it suffers the effects of the golem's Hazardous Body.

monster.name: Brain Golem

resist.note: from nonmagical attacks that aren't adamantine

languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting (Psionics)
headerEntries: The golem casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 15}):

trait.name: Constructed Nature
entries: The golem doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The golem is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The golem has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The golem's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Psychic Absorption
entries: Whenever the golem is subjected to psychic damage, it takes no damage and instead regains a number of hit points equal to the psychic damage dealt.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The golem regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The golem makes two Slam or Mindbeam attacks, then uses either Brain Blast or Spellcasting.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d10 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Mindbeam
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 7} to hit, range 90 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) psychic damage.

action.name: Brain Blast {@recharge 5}
entries: The golem releases psychic energy in a 30-foot cone. Each creature of the golem's choice that's caught in the area must make a {@dc 15} Intelligence saving throw, taking 25 ({@damage 4d10 + 3}) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

Additionally, a creature that fails its saving throw becomes slowed for 1 minute. While slowed in this way, a creature suffers a -2 penalty to AC and Dexterity saving throws, and it can't use reactions. On its turn, it can use either an action or a bonus action, not both. Regardless of the creature's abilities or magic items, it can't make more than one melee or ranged attack during its turn.
An affected creature can make another Intelligence saving throw at the end of each of its turns. On a successful save, the effect ends for it.

immune.note: from nonmagical attacks that aren't adamantine conditions immunities charmed

trait.name: Constructed Nature
entries: The golem doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: Fire Absorption
entries: Whenever the golem is subjected to fire damage, it takes no damage and instead regains a number of hit points equal to the fire damage dealt.

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The golem is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The golem has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The golem's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The golem regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point.

trait.name: Superheated Body
entries: A creature that touches the golem or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 4 ({@damage 1d8}) fire damage. Any weapon made of metal that hits the golem is superheated. Nonmagical ammunitition made of metal that hits the golem is destroyed after dealing damage.
Additionally, whenever the golem deals fire damage to a creature wearing a suit of armor made from metal or a creature made from metal, it or its armor becomes superheated.
Furthermore, whenever the golem deals fire damage to a metal object or surface, that object or surface becomes superheated.

Whenever a creature touches a superheated object or surface for the first time on a turn or starts its turn holding one, it takes 9 ({@damage 2d8}) fire damage and if it's holding a superheated object, it must succeed on a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw or drop that object.
An object remains superheated for 1 minute or until it is splashed with at least 1 gallon of liquid or submerged in at least 1 cubic foot of sediment.

trait.name: Water Susceptibility
entries: Whenever the golem starts its turn in contact with any amount of water, up to 10 gallons of that water is instantly evaporated. If any water remains, the golem is cooled for 1 minute, or until it would take any fire damage. While cooled, the golem loses its Regeneration and Superheated Body traits, and any fire damage it deals is halved.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The golem makes two Slam or Hurl Flame attacks.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d8 + 7}) bludgeoning damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) fire damage.

action.name: Hurl Flame
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 12} to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d6 + 7}) fire damage.

action.name: Fire Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The golem exhales a devastating flame in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw, taking 54 ({@damage 12d8}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

monster.name: Chain Golem

resist.note: from nonmagical attacks that aren't adamantine

languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

trait.name: Constructed Nature
entries: The golem doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The golem is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The golem has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The golem's weapon attacks are magical.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The golem makes four Chain attacks, each of which it can replace with one use of Fling. It then uses Reel and makes a Slam attack.

action.name: Chain
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d8 + 6}) bludgeoning damage and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 17}). Until the grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, it takes 15 ({@damage 2d8 + 6}) bludgeoning damage at the start of each of its turns, and the golem can't target it with another Chain attack.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}28 ({@damage 4d10 + 6}) bludgeoning damage and the target is knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Fling
entries: One Large or smaller object held or creature {@condition grappled} by the golem is thrown up to 30 feet in a direction of the golem's choice and knocked {@condition prone}. If a thrown target strikes a solid surface, the target takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) bludgeoning damage for every 10 feet it was thrown. If the target is thrown at another creature, that creature must make a {@dc 17} Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, both creatures take the same damage and are knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Reel
entries: The golem pulls each creature {@condition grappled} by it up to 15 feet straight toward it.

monster.name: Clay Golem

resist.note: from nonmagical attacks that aren't adamantine

languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

trait.name: Acid Absorption
entries: Whenever the golem is subjected to acid damage, it takes no damage and instead regains a number of hit points equal to the acid damage dealt.

trait.name: Constructed Nature
entries: The golem doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The golem is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The golem has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The golem's weapon attacks are magical.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The golem makes two Slam attacks. If both attacks hit a Medium or smaller target, the golem can then use Earthen Restraints on it.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d10 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Earthen Restraints
entries: The golem surrounds a Medium or smaller creature within 5 feet of in clay, which instantly hardens into an imprisoning trap. The target is {@condition blinded}, {@condition restrained}, unable to breathe, and has three quarters cover. Additionally, the target must make a Constitution saving throw at the start of each of its turns, taking 11 ({@damage 2d10}) bludgeoning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
The clay is a Medium object with AC 14, 10 hit points, vulnerability to bludgeoning damage, and immunity to acid, poison, and psychic damage. If the clay is destroyed, the creature inside is freed.

bonus.name: Pseudopod
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 30 ft., one target. {@h}The target is pulled up to 15 feet in a straight line towards the golem.

monster.name: Crystal Golem

resist.note: from nonmagical attacks that aren't adamantine

languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

trait.name: Blinding Refraction
entries: While the golem is in bright light, any creature that starts its turn within 30 feet of the golem and can see the golem must succeed on a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition blinded} until the start of the creature's next turn.

A creature can avert its eyes to avoid the saving throw at the start of its turn. If the creature does so, it can't see the golem until the start of its next turn, when it can avert its eyes again. If the creature looks at the golem in the meantime, it must immediately make the save.

trait.name: Constructed Nature
entries: The golem doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The golem is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The golem has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The golem's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Radiant Absorption
entries: Whenever the golem is subjected to radiant damage, it takes no damage and instead regains a number of hit points equal to the radiant damage dealt.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The golem makes two Slam attacks then uses Slow, if available.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 3d8 + 6}) bludgeoning damage or 19 ({@damage 3d8 + 6}) bludgeoning damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) radiant damage if the golem is in bright light.

action.name: Radiant Burst {@recharge 5}
entries: The golem releases a searing burst of light which fills a 30-foot radius around it. If the golem is not in bright light, it instead fills a 15-foot radius around it. Each creature caught in the area must make a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw, taking 28 ({@damage 8d6}) radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one. A creature that is averting its eyes has advantage on its saving throw.

monster.name: Flesh Golem

resist.note: from nonmagical attacks that aren't adamantine

languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

trait.name: Aversion to Fire
entries: If the golem takes fire damage, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks until the end of its next turn.

trait.name: Constructed Nature
entries: The golem doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The golem is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Lightning Absorption
entries: Whenever the golem is subjected to lightning damage, it takes no damage and instead regains a number of hit points equal to the lightning damage dealt.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The golem has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The golem's weapon attacks are magical.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The golem makes two Slam attacks, or three Slam attacks if it's raging.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage or 10 ({@damage 1d8 + 6}) bludgeoning damage if it's raging.

bonus.name: Rage (Recharges after a Short or Long rest)
entries: The golem enters a rage that lasts for 1 minute. It ends early if it's knocked {@condition unconscious} or if it ends its turn and it hasn't attacked a creature hostile to it since its last turn or taken damage since then. While raging, the golem gains the following benefits:

items: It has advantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws.
It gains 8 ({@dice 1d8 + 4}) temporary hit points at the start of each of its turns, which last until the rage ends.
It can make an additional Slam attack on its turn (included in the Multiattack action).

At the start of each of the golem's turns, roll a {@dice d6}. On a 1, the golem goes berserk until the end of its turn. While berserk, the golem attacks the nearest creature it can see. If no creature is near enough to move to and attack, the golem attacks an object, with preference for an objcet smaller than itself.

entries: When the golem's rage ends, it falls {@condition unconscious} for 10 minutes.

On a failure, a creature takes 18 ({@damage 4d8}) poison damage and becomes afflicted with lead poisoning. On a success, a creature takes half as much damage and is not afflicted. A creature with this lead poisoning is {@condition poisoned}, it has disadvantage on Dexterity saving throws, and whenever it takes a long rest, it must make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the creature gains no benefits from the rest and instead gains 1 level of {@condition exhaustion}.

immune.note: from nonmagical attacks that aren't adamantine conditions immunities charmed

trait.name: Constructed Nature
entries: The golem doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The golem is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The golem has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The golem's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Reflective Body
entries: Any time the mirror golem is targeted by a {@spell magic missile} spell, a line spell, or a spell that requires a ranged attack roll, the golem must make a Constitution saving throw against that spell. The DC equals 10 or 10 + the spell's level, whichever number is higher. On a success, the golem is unaffected, and the effect is reflected back at the caster as though it originated from the golem, turning the caster into the target.

Additionally, whenever the golem is subjected to radiant damage, it takes no damage and instead each other creature within 10 feet of it must make a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw, taking that much radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The golem makes two Slam or Reflective Ray attacks. It then uses Create Reflection, if available.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}21 ({@damage 3d10 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Reflective Ray
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 10} to hit, range 120 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d10 + 5}) radiant damage.

action.name: Create Reflection (3/Day)
entries: The golem targets a non-Construct creature that it can see within 30 feet of it that casts a reflection, creating a mirrored reflection of that creature. An unwilling creature can resist this effect with a successful {@dc 18} Charisma saving throw. The reflection appears in an unoccupied space within 10 feet of the golem. It has all of the target's current equipment, statistics, features, and traits, except it has AC 13, hit points equal to 50 or the target's current hit points, whichever is lower, and vulnerability to thunder damage.

The reflection takes its turn immediately after the golem on the same initiative count and fights to protect the golem and its allies. The reflection and everything it's wearing and carrying disappears after 1 minute or when it or the golem dies.

reaction.name: Unsettling Reflection
entries: Whenever a creature within 30 feet of the golem makes an attack roll against it, the golem can force that creature to make a {@dc 18} Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, the target suffers disadvantage on the triggering attack roll. A creature that can't see its reflection in the golem's body or is immune to the {@condition frightened} condition succeeds on this saving throw automatically.

monster.name: Mithral Golem

immune.note: from nonmagical attacks that aren't adamantine

languages: understands the languages of its creator

trait.name: Constructed Nature
entries: The golem doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The golem is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The golem has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The golem's weapon attacks are magical.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The golem makes three Molded Weapon attacks then uses Force Blast or Force Geyser.

action.name: Molded Weapon
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d10 + 5}) bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage (the golem's choice) plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) force damage.

action.name: Force Blast
entries: The golem releases a wave of magical force in a 30-foot cone. Each creature caught in the area must make a Strength saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 35 ({@damage 10d6}) force damage and is pushed 10 feet in a straight line away from the golem and knocked {@condition prone}. On a success, a creature takes half as much damage, is pushed only 5 feet, and is not knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Force Geyser
entries: The golem creates an eruption of magical force at a point that it can see within 60 feet of it. Each creature caught within 10 feet of the chosen point must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 28 ({@damage 8d6}) force damage and is pushed 30 feet up into the air. On a success, a creature takes half as much damage and is not pushed.

monster.name: Puzzle Golem

resist.note: from nonmagical attacks that aren't adamantine

languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

trait.name: Constructed Nature
entries: The golem doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The golem is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The golem has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The golem's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Puzzling Aura
entries: The golem exudes an aura of confusing magic in a 30-foot-radius around it. Whenever a creature enters the area for the first time or starts its turn there, it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Intelligence saving throw or it suffers disadvantage on attack rolls and its speed is halved until the start of its next turn.
If the golem is Medium, the aura is instead a 10-foot-radius. If the golem is Small or smaller, the aura is instead a 5-foot-radius.

action.name: Multiattack (Large or larger Only)
entries: The golem makes two Slam attacks.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 3d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage if the golem is Large or larger, 13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage if the golem is Medium, or 8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage if the golem is Small or smaller.

action.name: Disassemble
entries: If the puzzle golem is Medium or larger, it collapses into four new puzzle golems. Each new golem has hit points equal to one fourth the original golem's. New golems are one size smaller than the original golem and act on its initiative. The new golems are {@condition incapacitated} until the end of the current turn.

action.name: Reassemble
entries: The golem and three other puzzle golems of its size recompile into a single, larger puzzle golem. The new golem has hit points equal to the combined hit points of each original golem. It is one size larger than the original golems and it acts on their initiative. The new golem is {@condition incapacitated} until the end of the current turn.

monster.name: Silver Golem
languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The golem casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Constitution as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 20}):

trait.name: Constructed Nature
entries: The golem doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The golem is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Lightning Absorption
entries: Whenever the golem is subjected to lightning damage, it takes no damage and instead regains a number of hit points equal to the lightning damage dealt.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The golem has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The golem's weapon attacks are magical.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The golem makes three Slam attacks or two Arcane Blast attacks. It can replace one of these attacks with a use of Spellcasting.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}33 ({@damage 5d10 + 6}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Arcane Blast
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 12} to hit, range 150 ft., one target. {@h}38 ({@damage 5d12 + 6}) force damage. This attack deals double damage to objects and structures.

action.name: Magical Passage
entries: The golem creates a passage that appears at a point of its choice that it can see on a wooden, plaster, or stone surface within 30 feet of it. The passage is up to 10 feet wide, 15 feet tall, and 20 feet deep (the golem's choice). The passage creates no instability in a structure surrounding it and lasts for 1 hour, or until the golem uses another action to close it.
When the passage disappears, any creatures or objects still inside it are safely ejected to an unoccupied space nearest to an available exit.

monster.name: Snow Golem
languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

trait.name: Chilling Frost
entries: Whenever the golem deals cold damage to a creature, the target becomes partially frozen until the end of the golem's next turn, reducing its speed by 10 feet. Each time the golem deals cold damage to a partially frozen creature, the reduction to the target's speed increases by 10 feet. If this reduces a creature's speed to 0, it becomes {@condition restrained} by the frost for 1 minute.
A creature can try to free itself or another creature within 5 feet of it with a {@dc 12} Strength check, ending the effect on the {@condition restrained} target a success.

trait.name: Cold Absorption
entries: Whenever the golem is subjected to cold damage, it takes no damage and instead regains a number of hit points equal to the cold damage dealt.

trait.name: Constructed Nature
entries: The golem doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The golem is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The golem has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The golem's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Melt
entries: While in an area of extreme heat, the golem loses {@dice 1d6} hit points at the start of each of its turns.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The golem makes three Slam or Snowball attacks.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) bludgeoning damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) cold damage.

action.name: Snowball
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 60 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d6 + 2}) cold damage.

monster.name: Stone Golem

resist.note: from nonmagical attacks that aren't adamantine

languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

trait.name: Constructed Nature
entries: The golem doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The golem is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The golem has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The golem's weapon attacks are magical.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The golem makes two Slam attacks then uses Slow, if available.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 3d8 + 6}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Slow {@recharge 5}
entries: The golem targets one or more creatures it can see within 10 feet of it. Each target must make a {@dc 17} Wisdom saving throw against this magic. A creature immune to the {@condition petrified} condition succeeds on this saving throw automatically. On a failed save, a target can't use reactions, its speed is halved, and it can't make more than one attack on its turn. In addition, the target can take either an action or a bonus action on its turn, not both. These effects last until the start of the golem's next turn.

reaction.name: Stone's Endurance (4/Day)
entries: In response to taking damage, the golem reduces that damage by 10 ({@dice 1d10 + 5}). The golem then gains temporary hit points equal to the number rolled, which last for 1 minute.

monster.name: Wax Golem

resist.note: from nonmagical attacks that aren't adamantine

languages: understands the languages of the creature it was made to imitate

trait.name: Constructed Nature
entries: The golem doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: The wax golem is created as a clone of another creature. The golem gains the memories of the creature it represents, but none of its statistics or proficiencies. The golem is visually indistinguishable from the creature it represents until it takes fire damage, upon which it partially melts and is clearly a facsimile until it regains all its hit points.

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The golem is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The golem has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The golem's weapon attacks are magical.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 2d4}) damage.

monster.name: Grisgol

immune.note: from nonmagical attacks that aren't adamantine

languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The grisgol casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Constitution as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 18}):

trait.name: Constructed Nature
entries: The grisgol doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The grisgol is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The grisgol has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The grisgol's weapon attacks are magical.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The grisgol makes a Paralyzing Touch attack or uses Disrupt Life. It then uses Spellcasting.

action.name: Paralyzing Touch
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 3d6}) cold damage. The target must succeed on a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition paralyzed} for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Disrupt Life
entries: Each creature within 20 feet of the grisgol must make a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw, taking 21 ({@damage 6d6}) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A Construct or Undead creature is unaffected.

reaction.name: Fell Rebuke
entries: In response to being hit by an attack, the grisgol manifests fell magic, dealing 10 ({@damage 3d6}) necrotic damage to the attacker, and the grisgol teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 10 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

variant.name: Grisgol Madness
entries: After the grisgol is killed, any creature that examines the strips of scroll parchment or tome pages that comprise the creature's wrappings must succeed on a {@dc 19} Wisdom saving throw or be rendered insane by a magical curse.

A creature cursed in this way becomes convinced that the thousands of scraps of parchment contain great and lost arcane secrets, and that they must discover these secrets, always thinking that they're on the brink of a revelation.

A creature's Intelligence score is reduced by 1 when it becomes cursed in this way, decreasing by 1 again for every 7 days that pass while under the curse's effects. The target dies if this reduces its Intelligence to 0. This reduction lasts until the curse is lifted, and the curse can be lifted only by {@spell greater restoration} spell or greater magic.

monster.name: Iron Angel
languages: understands all languages but can't speak

trait.name: Aura of Decay
entries: The angel exudes an aura of desecration in a 30-foot-radius around it. Whenever a creature other than the angel enters the aura for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, that creature must make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) necrotic damage and until the start of its next turn, the target has disadvantage on attack rolls and its speed is halved. On a success, a creature takes half as much damage and is otherwise unaffected. The aura deals double damage to Constructs, Plant creatures, and magical plants.
Additionally, at the start of each of the angel's turns, each nonmagical plant within the aura that isn't a creature withers and dies.

trait.name: Constructed Nature
entries: The angel doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The angel has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The angel makes two Claw or Rusted Shard attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of Contagious Corrosion.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) slashing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Rusted Shard
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 30/90 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Contagious Corrosion
entries: The angel invokes a terrible corrosion in a creature that it can see within 60 feet of it. The target must make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw. On a failure, a creature produces the effects of the angel's Aura of Decay in a 10-foot-radius around it for 1 minute. A creature can repeat its saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Ironstorm {@recharge}
entries: The angel erupts into a swirling storm of jagged metal that fills a 30-foot-radius around it. The metal spreads around corners. Each creature caught in the area must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw, taking 21 ({@damage 6d6}) slashing damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one. Regardless, a creature loses 10 ({@dice 3d6}) hit points at the start of each of its turns due to a bleeding wound. Each time a bleeding creature takes damage from the angel's Ironstorm, the damage dealt by the wound increases by 10 ({@dice 3d6}). Any creature can take an action to stanch the wound with a successful {@dc 11} Wisdom (Medicine) check. The wound also closes if the target receives magical healing.

reaction.name: Iron Shell
entries: The angel adds 3 to its AC against one attack that would hit it. To do so, the angel must see the attacker.

trait.name: Amorphous
entries: The living spell can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

trait.name: Constructed Nature
entries: The living spell doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The living spell has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Illumination
entries: While it has four or more uses of Star Mote remaining, the living spell sheds bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light in an additional 30 feet. While it has one to three motes remaining, it sheds dim light in a 30-foot radius. While it has no motes remaining, it sheds dim light in its space.

trait.name: Recharge
entries: At the start of each of the living spells turns, roll a {@dice d6}. On a 5 or 6, the living spell regains one expended use of Star Mote.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The living spell makes two Star Mote attacks.

action.name: Star Mote (7/Day)
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 10} to hit, range 120 ft., one target. {@h}26 ({@damage 4d12}) radiant damage.

trait.name: Amorphous
entries: The living spell can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

trait.name: Constructed Nature
entries: The living spell doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The living spell has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The living spell makes two Magical Strike attacks.

action.name: Magical Strike
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}21 ({@damage 5d6 + 4}) fire damage.

action.name: Spell Mimicry {@recharge 5}
entries: The living spell blossoms with a low roar into an explosion of flame. Each creature within 20 feet of the living spell must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw, taking 28 ({@damage 8d6}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
The fire spreads around corners. It ignites flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried.

trait.name: Amorphous
entries: The living spell can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

trait.name: Constructed Nature
entries: The living spell doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The living spell has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The living spell uses Spell Mimicry, if available, then it makes a Magical Strike attack.

action.name: Magical Strike
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Spell Mimicry {@recharge 5}
entries: The living spell attaches itself to a creature within 5 feet of it and pulls itself into the target's space. The living spell then chooses an ability score. While attached, the living spell moves with the target and has advantage on attack rolls against it, and the target has disadvantage on ability checks made with the chosen ability score.

A creature can forcibly detach the living spell with a {@spell remove curse} spell or similar magic cast on the living spell or the attached target. On its turn, the living spell can detect itself from the target using 5 feet of movement. When it dies, the living spell detaches from any creature it is attached to.

trait.name: Amorphous
entries: The living spell can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

trait.name: Constructed Nature
entries: The living spell doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The living spell has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Spell Mimicry
entries: The living spell flies up to 120 feet toward a target that it can see without provoking opportunity attacks. If it ends this movement within 5 feet of the target, the living spell explodes and dies, dealing 3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) force damage to the target. The target considers this effect as being targeted by the {@spell magic missile} spell.

trait.name: Amorphous
entries: The living spell can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

trait.name: Constructed Nature
entries: The living spell doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The living spell has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The living spell makes two Magical Strike attacks.

action.name: Magical Strike
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 30 ft., one target. {@h}22 ({@damage 5d6 + 5}) force damage. Hit or Miss: The living spell can teleport to an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the target.

action.name: Spell Mimicry {@recharge 5}
entries: The living spell vanishes to strike like the wind. It chooses up to five creatures that it can see within 30 feet of it and makes a Magical Strike attack against each of them in an order of its choice.

trait.name: Amorphous
entries: The living spell can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

trait.name: Constructed Nature
entries: The living spell doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The living spell has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The living spell makes two Magical Strike attacks.

action.name: Magical Strike
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 3d6 + 4}) necrotic damage, and the living spell regains hit points equal to half the amount of necrotic damage dealt.

monster.name: Mechanical Dragon
languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

trait.name: Constructed Nature
entries: The dragon doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The dragon is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the dragon fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The dragon has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The dragon's weapon attacks are magical.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The dragon makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks then uses either Fire Jet, Magic Missile Barrage, or Oil Slick, if available.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}22 ({@damage 3d10 + 6}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d6 + 6}) slashing damage.

action.name: Fire Jet {@recharge 5}
entries: The dragon exhales fire in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 19} Dexterity saving throw, taking 28 ({@damage 8d6}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Magic Missile Barrage {@recharge 5}
entries: The mechanical dragon casts the {@spell magic missile} spell at 6th-level, requiring no spell components and using Constitution as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 20}).

action.name: Oil Slick {@recharge 5}
entries: The dragon sprays oil out from it in a 30-foot cone. Each creature caught in the area must succeed on a {@dc 19} Dexterity saving throw or become coated in oil. The oil also coats all objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried. The oil then falls to the ground, coating any further objects or surfaces that it comes into contact with that aren't being worn or carried and turning any ground it coats into difficult terrain. A creature can use its action to clean a creature, a Medium or smaller object, or a 5-foot surface of oil.

Whenever a creature attempts to move into an area covered by oil for the first time on a turn, it must succeed on a {@dc 19} Dexterity saving throw or fall {@condition prone} and become coated with oil.

The oil is flammable. Any 5-foot cube of oil or oil covering a creature exposed to fire burns away after 1 minute, dealing 7 ({@damage 2d6}) fire damage to any creature that enters the flames for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there.

legendary.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d8 + 6}) bludgeoning damage.

legendary.name: Gadget Weapons (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: uses either Fire Jet, Magic Missile Barrage, or Oil Slick, if available.

legendary.name: Wing Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The dragon beats its wings.

Each creature within 10 feet of the dragon must succeed on a {@dc 19} Dexterity saving throw or take 13 ({@damage 2d6 + 6}) bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone}. The dragon can then fly up to half its flying speed.

trait.name: Ambusher
entries: In the first round of a combat, the scratcher has advantage on attack rolls against any creature it surprised.

trait.name: Constructed Nature
entries: The scratcher doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The scratcher can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The scratcher makes two Stab attacks. If both attacks hit the same target, the slasher uses its Attach on it. If it is attached to a target, the scratcher makes four Stab attacks against that creature.

action.name: Stab
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit 4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Attach
entries: The scratcher attaches to a target within 5 feet of it and pulls itself into the target's space. While attached, the scratcher moves with the target and has advantage on attack rolls against it.

A creature can use its action to try to detach the scratcher and force it to move into the nearest unoccupied space, doing so with a successful {@dc 12} Strength check. On its turn, the scratcher can detach itself from the target by using 5 feet of movement. When it dies, the scratcher detaches from any creature it is attached to.

action.name: Flee
entries: The scratcher takes both the Dash and Disengage actions.

trait.name: Ambusher
entries: In the first round of a combat, the slasher has advantage on attack rolls against any creature it surprised.

trait.name: Constructed Nature
entries: The slasher doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: Spider Climb
