entries: The slasher can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The slasher makes two Finger Beam or Stab attacks.

action.name: Drop
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, one creature directly underneath the slasher. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d6}) bludgeoning damage for every 10 feet fallen, up to 21 ({@dice 6d6}). If the target is Large or smaller, it's {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 14}). While the grapple lasts, the target is {@condition restrained}, the slasher has advantage on attack rolls made against it, and the slasher can't grapple another target. Hit or Miss: The slasher takes half the normal falling damage for the distance fallen.

action.name: Stab
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit 14 ({@damage 2d10 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Finger Beam
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 6} to hit, range 60 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d12 + 3}) force damage.

action.name: Flee
entries: The slasher takes both the Dash and Disengage actions.

trait.name: Constructed Nature
entries: The scaladar doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: Lightning Absorption
entries: Whenever the scaladar is subjected to lightning damage, it takes no damage and instead both its sting and its Lightning Blast deal an extra 11 ({@damage 2d10}) lightning damage until the end of its next turn.

trait.name: Scaladar Link
entries: The scaladar knows the exact location of other scaladar within 100 feet of it, it can communicate with them telepathically, and it can sense when any of them take damage.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The scaladar can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The scaladar makes two Claw attacks and one Sting attack.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d12 + 4}) bludgeoning damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 15}). The scaladar has two claws, each of which can grapple one target.

action.name: Sting
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) piercing damage plus 11 ({@damage 2d10}) lightning damage.

action.name: Lightning Blast {@recharge 5}
entries: The scaladar shoots forth a bolt of lightning from its tail that forms a line 120 feet long and 5 feet wide that passes through creatures. Each creature in the line must make a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 28 ({@damage 8d6}) lightning damage. If the target is a creature, unless it's immune to the {@condition paralyzed} condition, it falls {@condition prone}. On a failure, a creature takes half as much damage and it does not fall {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Constructed Nature
entries: The scaladar doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: Lightning Absorption
entries: Whenever the scaladar is subjected to lightning damage, it takes no damage and instead both its sting and its Lightning Blast deal an extra 22 ({@damage 4d10}) lightning damage until the end of its next turn.

trait.name: Scaladar Link
entries: The scaladar knows the exact location of other scaladar within 250 feet of it, it can communicate with them telepathically, and it can sense when any of them take damage.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The scaladar can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The scaladar makes two Claw attacks and one Sting attack.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 1d12 + 6}) bludgeoning damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 18}). The scaladar has two claws, each of which can grapple one target.

action.name: Sting
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 1d10 + 6}) piercing damage plus 22 ({@damage 4d10}) lightning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 20} Charisma saving throw or become forcibly linked to the scaladar's network for 1 minute. A creature immune to psychic damage succeeds on this saving throw automatically. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, breaking its connection to the network on a success.

The first time a non-Scaladar creature linked to the network takes damage each turn, each other non-Scaladar creature that is linked to the network within 100 feet of that creature takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) lightning damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) psychic damage.

action.name: Lightning Blast
entries: The scaladar shoots forth a bolt of lightning from its tail that forms a line 120 feet long and 5 feet wide that passes through creatures. Each creature in the line must make a {@dc 20} Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 42 ({@damage 12d6}) lightning damage. If the target is a creature, unless it's immune to the {@condition paralyzed} condition, it falls {@condition prone}. On a failure, a creature takes half as much damage and it does not fall {@condition prone}.

monster.name: Corvian Caller
languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

trait.name: Ambusher
entries: In the first round of a combat, the corvian caller has advantage on attack rolls against any creature it surprised.

trait.name: Constructed Nature
entries: The corvian caller doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the corvian caller remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an ordinary, inanimate scarecrow.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The corvian caller has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The corvian caller's weapon attacks are magical.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The corvian caller makes two Claw or Dreadbolt attacks. It can replace one of these attacks with a use of Terrifying Glare.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 2d4 + 3}) slashing damage plus 14 ({@damage 4d6}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Dreadbolt
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 7} to hit, range 60 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 4d6 + 3}) necrotic damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} until the end of the corvian caller's next turn.

action.name: Terrifying Glare
entries: The corvian caller targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. If the target can see the corvian caller, the target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or be magically {@condition frightened} until the end of the corvian caller's next turn. The {@condition frightened} target is {@condition paralyzed}.

bonus.name: Summon Murder (3/Day)
entries: The corvian caller conjures hundreds of ravenous crows at a point that it can see within 60 feet of itself. The crows use the statistics of a swarm of ravens. The swarm takes its turn immediately after the corvian caller on the same initiative count and obeys the corvian caller's commands. The swarm disappears after 1 minute or when it or the corvian caller dies.
While the corvian caller has no uses of this action remaining, it loses its flying speed.

bonus.name: Unkind Step
entries: The corvian caller chooses one allied swarm of ravens that it can see within 60 feet of itself. The corvian caller and the chosen swarm both teleport, swapping places.

monster.name: Scarecrow
languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

trait.name: Ambusher
entries: In the first round of a combat, the scarecrow has advantage on attack rolls against any creature it surprised.

trait.name: Constructed Nature
entries: The scarecrow doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the scarecrow remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an ordinary, inanimate scarecrow.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The scarecrow makes two Claw attacks.

action.name: Rending Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 2d4 + 1}) slashing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 11} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} until the end of the scarecrow's next turn.

action.name: Terrifying Glare
entries: The scarecrow targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. If the target can see the scarecrow, the target must succeed on a {@dc 11} Wisdom saving throw or be magically {@condition frightened} until the end of the scarecrow's next turn. The {@condition frightened} target is {@condition paralyzed}.

monster.name: Scarecrow Stalker
languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

trait.name: Ambusher
entries: In the first round of a combat, the scarecrow has advantage on attack rolls against any creature it surprised.

trait.name: Constructed Nature
entries: The scarecrow doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the scarecrow remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an ordinary, inanimate scarecrow.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The scarecrow makes two Rending Claw attacks. It can replace one of these attacks with a use of Terrifying Glare.

action.name: Rending Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) slashing damage, or 8 ({@damage 2d4 + 3}) slashing damage if the attack was made with advantage. If the target is a creature, it suffers a lingering wound that causes it to lose 2 ({@dice 1d4}) hit points at the start of each of its turns. Each time the scarecrow hits the wounded target with this attack, the damage dealt by the wound increases by 2 ({@dice 1d4}). The wound ends if the target regains hit points or if a creature uses an action to stanch the wound, which requires a successful {@dc 11} Wisdom (Medicine) check.

action.name: Terrifying Glare
entries: The scarecrow targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. If the target can see the scarecrow, the target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw or be magically {@condition frightened} until the end of the scarecrow's next turn. The {@condition frightened} target is {@condition paralyzed}.

bonus.name: Nimble Escape
entries: The scarecrow takes the Disengage or Hide action.

monster.name: Wickerman
languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

trait.name: Constructed Nature
entries: The wickerman doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the wickerman remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an ordinary, inanimate wickerman.

trait.name: Heated Body (Ignited Only)
entries: A creature that touches the wickerman or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) fire damage.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The wickerman has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The wickerman weapon attacks are magical.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The wickerman makes two Claw attacks. If both attacks hit a Medium or smaller target, the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 16}), and the wickerman uses its Imprison on it. It then uses Soulfire, if available.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) slashing damage, or 9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) slashing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) fire damage if the wickerman is ignited.

action.name: Imprison
entries: The wickerman imprisons a Large or smaller creature {@condition grappled} by it inside its ribcage. While imprisoned, the creature is {@condition restrained}, it has three-quarters cover against attacks and other effects outside the wickerman, and if the wickerman is ignited, it takes 28 ({@damage 8d6}) fire damage at the start of each of the wickerman's turns. If the creature dies while imprisoned, its body is reduced to ash and the wickerman regains 25 hit points and immediately recharges Soulfire.

If the wickerman takes 25 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the wickerman must succeed on a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or release the imprisoned swallowed creature, which falls {@condition prone} in a space within 10 feet of the wickerman. If the wickerman dies, an imprisoned creature is no longer {@condition restrained} by it and can escape from the corpse using 15 feet of movement, exiting {@condition prone}.

action.name: Soulfire (Ignited Only; Recharge 5-6)
entries: The wickerman unleashes a wave of fire in a 30-foot cone. Each creature caught in the area must make a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 14 ({@damage 4d6}) fire damage plus 14 ({@damage 4d6}) necrotic damage and its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage dealt. This reduction lasts until the creature finishes a long rest. A creature dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0. On a success, a creature takes half as much damage and its hit point maximum is unaffected.

bonus.name: Ignite
entries: The wickerman bursts into flames, becoming ignited until it uses a bonus action on subsequent turns to extinguish the flames or until it comes into contact with 10 or more gallons of water. While ignited, the wickerman sheds bright light in a 30-foot-radius around it and dim light for an additional 30 feet and it ignites any flammable object it touches that is not being worn or carried.
Additionally, if the wickerman dies while ignited, its body burns to ash over the course of 1 hour.

trait.name: Petrified Death
entries: A tomb tapper reduced to 0 hit points turns into a lifeless stone statue. Anything it's wearing or carrying is not transformed.

trait.name: Sense Magic
entries: The tomb tapper senses magic within 30 feet of it and can use an action to pinpoint the location of any creature, object, or area in that range that bears magic. This sense penetrates all barriers but is blocked by a thin sheet of lead.

trait.name: Thunderous Slam {@recharge 5}
entries: When the tomb tapper hits a creature with a Sledgehammer attack, it can cause the sledgehammer to emit a pulse of thunderous energy in a 10-foot-radius around the target. Each creature caught in the radius other than the tomb tapper must make a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 16 ({@damage 3d10}) thunder damage and is {@condition stunned} until the start of the tomb tapper's next turn. On a success, a creature takes half as much damage and is not {@condition stunned}.

trait.name: Tunneler
entries: The tomb tapper can burrow through solid rock at half its burrowing speed and leaves a 10-foot-wide, 20-foot-tall tunnel in its wake.

trait.name: Unusual Nature
entries: The tomb tapper doesn't require air or sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The tomb tapper makes two melee attacks with its Sledgehammer or with its Claws. If it hits the same creature with both Claws, it can pull that creature into an unoccupied space within 5 feet of its mouth and make a Bite attack against it.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}22 ({@damage 3d10 + 6}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 3d6 + 6}) slashing damage.

action.name: Sledgehammer
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 15 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}20 ({@dice 4d6 + 6}) bludgeoning plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) thunder damage. If thrown, the hammer returns to the tomb tapper at the end of its turn, landing at the tomb tapper's feet if it doesn't have a hand free to catch the weapon.

trait.name: Antimagic Cone
entries: The tomb tapper's mouth creates an area of antimagic, as in the {@spell antimagic field} spell, in a 60-foot cone. At the start of its turns, the tomb tapper decides which way the cone faces and whether the cone is active.

trait.name: Magic Killer (3/Day)
entries: Whenever the tomb tapper hits a creature with a Sledgehammer attack, it can immediately cast the {@spell dispel magic} spell against the target (no action required), requiring no material components and using Constitution as the spellcasting ability.

trait.name: Petrified Death
entries: A tomb tapper reduced to 0 hit points turns into a lifeless stone statue. Anything it's wearing or carrying is not transformed.

trait.name: Sense Magic
entries: The tomb tapper senses magic within 30 feet of it and can use an action to pinpoint the location of any creature, object, or area in that range that bears magic. This sense penetrates all barriers but is blocked by a thin sheet of lead.

trait.name: Thunderous Slam {@recharge 5}
entries: When the tomb tapper hits a creature with a Sledgehammer attack, it can cause the sledgehammer to emit a pulse of thunderous energy in a 10-foot-radius around the target. Each creature caught in the radius other than the tomb tapper must make a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 16 ({@damage 3d10}) thunder damage and is {@condition stunned} until the start of the tomb tapper's next turn. On a success, a creature takes half as much damage and is not {@condition stunned}.

trait.name: Tunneler
entries: The tomb tapper can burrow through solid rock at half its burrowing speed and leaves a 10-foot-wide, 20-foot-tall tunnel in its wake.

trait.name: Unusual Nature
entries: The tomb tapper doesn't require air or sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The tomb tapper makes two melee attacks with its Sledgehammer or with its Claws. If it hits the same creature with both Claws, it can pull that creature into an unoccupied space within 5 feet of its mouth and make a Bite attack against it.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}22 ({@damage 3d10 + 6}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 3d6 + 6}) slashing damage.

action.name: Sledgehammer
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 15 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}20 ({@dice 4d6 + 6}) bludgeoning plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) thunder damage. If thrown, the hammer returns to the tomb tapper at the end of its turn, landing at the tomb tapper's feet if it doesn't have a hand free to catch the weapon.

monster.name: Tutelary Titan Hand
languages: understands the languages of its creators

trait.name: Constructed Nature
entries: The hand doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The hand is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Linked
entries: The hand is magically linked to a {@creature tutelary titan head|GOLEM}. The hand shares a telepathic link with the head and is under its total control, using its proficiency bonus. The hand has no senses of its own and must use the head's senses to see, hear, and smell. If the link is severed, the hand is {@condition blinded}, {@condition deafened}, and it dies after 1 minute.
Additionally, while the hand is more than 60 feet away from the head, it can't willing move further away from the hand.
Magic Resistance The hand has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The hand's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: The hand deals double damage to objects and structures.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The hand makes a Fist attack or uses Grasping Hand, then it uses Slam.

action.name: Fist
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 15} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}23 ({@damage 3d10 + 7}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is Huge or smaller, the hand can choose to push it up to 30 feet in a straight line away from it.

action.name: Grasping Hand
entries: The hand attempts to grapple a Huge or smaller creature within 5 feet of it. If the target is Medium or smaller, the hand has advantage on the check. While the grapple persists, the target is {@condition restrained}, it takes 20 ({@damage 3d8 + 7}) bludgeoning damage at the start of each of the hand's turns, and the hand can't grapple another creature.

action.name: Slam
entries: If the hand is airborne, it falls. On impact, if the hand fell at least 10 feet, it takes half the normal falling damage for the distance fallen and it releases a shockwave in a radius around it equal to the distance it fell. Each other creature in the area must make a {@dc 21} Dexterity saving throw, taking 22 ({@damage 4d10}) bludgeoning damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one. If the hand fell 30 feet or more, a creature that fails its saving throw is knocked {@condition prone}.

reaction.name: Interposing Hand
entries: Whenever a creature makes an attack roll against the tutelary titan head controlling the hand, the hand moves up to its speed. If it ends this movement in between the attacker and the head, the hand grants the head three-quarters cover against the attack.

The hand can take 1 legendary action, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The hand regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary.name: Fist
entries: The hand makes a Fist attack.

legendary.name: Protection
entries: If the hand has taken a reaction since the start of its previous turn, it regains that spent reaction.

monster.name: Tutelary Titan Head
languages: understands the languages of its creators

trait.name: Constructed Nature
entries: The titan doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The titan is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Legendary Resistances (3/Day)
entries: If the titan or one hand under its control fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Linked
entries: The titan is magically linked to two {@creature tutelary titan hand|GOLEM|tutelary titan hands}. The titan shares a telepathic link with the hands and has total, precise control over them, deciding how the hands act. If the titan is {@condition stunned} or dies, the link is severed until the titan is no longer {@condition stunned} or is returned to life.
Magic Resistance The titan has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The titan's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The titan regains 25 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point. If the titan has one or more tutelary titan hands under its control within 60 feet of it that also have at least 1 hit point, it can instead divide those hit points among itself and the hands.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: The titan deals double damage to objects and structures.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The titan makes two Eye Beam attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 16} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}47 ({@damage 6d12 + 8}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Eye Beam
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 16} to hit, range 240 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 2d10 + 8}) force damage.

action.name: Deconstruction Beam {@recharge}
entries: The titan fires a beam of destructive force that forms a line 150 feet long and 15 feet wide that blasts out from it in a direction it chooses. Each creature in the line must make a {@dc 22} Dexterity saving throw, taking 78 ({@damage 12d12}) force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A target is disintegrated if this damage leaves it with 0 hit points.

A disintegrated creature and everything it is wearing and carrying, except magic items, are reduced to a pile of fine gray dust. The creature can be restored to life only by means of a true resurrection or a {@spell wish} spell.
A nonmagical object that isn't being worn or carried also takes the damage if it's in the area.

action.name: Restore Hands (1/Day)
entries: Each hand under the titan's control within 60 feet of it regains 100 hit points. If a targeted hand is dead, it's first returned to life with 1 hit point.

legendary.name: Command Hand
entries: One hand under the titan's control can immediately take one of its legendary actions without expending a use.

legendary.name: Move
entries: Both the titan and any hands under its control with at least 1 hit point can immediately move up to their speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

legendary.name: Eye Beam (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The titan makes two Eye Beam attacks.

trait.name: Adamantine Form
entries: Any critical hit against the golem becomes a normal hit.

trait.name: Constructed Nature
entries: The golem doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: Greater Magic Resistance
entries: The golem has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.    Additionally, the golem has resistance against the damage of spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The golem is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the golem fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The golem's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: The golem deals double damage to objects and structures.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The golem makes one Spear attack, one Sword attack, and two Fist attacks. Alternatively, the golem makes two Rock attacks.

action.name: Fist
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 15} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d8 + 8}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 22}). The golem has two fists, each of which can grapple only one target.

action.name: Spear
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 15} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}34 ({@damage 4d12 + 8}) piercing damage.

action.name: Sword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 15} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}30 ({@damage 4d10 + 8}) slashing damage.

action.name: Rock
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 15} to hit, range 60/240 ft., one target. {@h}34 ({@damage 4d12 + 8}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 22} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Destructive Rampage {@recharge 5}
entries: The golem makes two random attacks against a single target within 10 feet of it of its choice. Roll a {@dice d4} to determine each attack.

items.name: 1–2: Fist
entries: The golem makes a Fist attack.

items.name: 3: Spear
entries: The golem makes a Spear attack.

items.name: 4: Sword
entries: The golem makes a Sword attack.
The golem can then choose any number of other targets within 10 feet of it and repeats the process for each of those targets.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The golem moves up to half its speed.

legendary.name: Fist
entries: The golem makes a Fist attack.

legendary.name: Stomp (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The golem stomps the ground, sending out a shockwave in a 20-foot-radius around it.

Each other creature caught in the area must make a {@dc 22} Dexterity saving throw, taking 19 ({@damage 3d12}) bludgeoning damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one. Additionally, the ground in that area becomes difficult terrain to Large or smaller creatures until cleared.
Each 5-foot-square portion of the area requires at least 1 minute to clear by hand.

legendary.name: Rampage (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The golem moves up to its speed then uses its Destructive Rampage.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The boggart casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 10}):

trait.name: Death Burst
entries: When the boggart dies, it explodes in a burst of energy. Each creature within 10 feet of it must make a {@dc 12} Dexterity saving throw, taking 7 ({@damage 2d6}) force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The boggart has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the boggart's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Vessel Rejuvenation
entries: When it drops to 0 hit points, the boggart's physical body is destroyed, but its spirit remains. The boggart regains all of its hit points and assumes its spiritual form.

While in spiritual form, the boggart can't take any actions except use its Fey Energy, and it can't speak or manipulate objects. It is weightless, has a flying speed of 30 feet, can hover, and can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. In addition, if air can pass through a space, the boggart can do so without squeezing, and it can't pass through water. It has advantage on Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution saving throws, and it has resistance to all nonmagical damage. If the boggart is reduced to 0 hit points while in its spiritual form, it dies.

With 8 hours of work and suitable materials, the boggart can create a new vessel for itself. Once this new vessel is complete, the boggart can use its action to enter the vessel, exiting its spiritual form and regaining all of its hit points.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The boggart makes two Claw attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of Spellcasting.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) slashing damage.

bonus.name: Fey Energy
entries: The boggart harnesses its soul to create one of the following magical effects of its choice:

items.name: Energy Pulse
entries: One creature that the boggart can see within 30 feet of it must make a {@dc 12} Strength saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) force damage and is either knocked {@condition prone} or pushed 10 feet in a straight line away from the boggart (the boggart's choice). On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and is not knocked {@condition prone} or pushed away.

items.name: Lesser Telekinesis
entries: The boggart chooses an object that it can see within 30 feet of it that weighs up to 30 pounds. If the object isn't being worn or carried, the boggart automatically moves it up to 30 feet in any direction, but not into a space more than 30 feet away from the boggart.

items.name: Restorative Soul
entries: The boggart chooses a willing creature that it can see within 30 feet of it. That creature regains 3 ({@dice 1d6}) hit points.

trait.name: Death Burst
entries: When the boggart dies, it explodes in a burst of energy. Each creature within 10 feet of it must make a {@dc 12} Dexterity saving throw, taking 7 ({@damage 2d6}) force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The boggart has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the boggart's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Vessel Rejuvenation
entries: When it drops to 0 hit points, the boggart's physical body is destroyed, but its spirit remains. The boggart regains all of its hit points and assumes its spiritual form.

While in spiritual form, the boggart can't take any actions except use its Fey Energy, and it can't speak or manipulate objects. It is weightless, has a flying speed of 30 feet, can hover, and can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. In addition, if air can pass through a space, the boggart can do so without squeezing, and it can't pass through water. It has advantage on Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution saving throws, and it has resistance to all nonmagical damage. If the boggart is reduced to 0 hit points while in its spiritual form, it dies.

With 8 hours of work and suitable materials, the boggart can create a new vessel for itself. Once this new vessel is complete, the boggart can use its action to enter the vessel, exiting its spiritual form and regaining all of its hit points.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The boggart makes two Claw attacks.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) slashing damage.

bonus.name: Fey Energy
entries: The boggart harnesses its soul to create one of the following magical effects of its choice:

items.name: Energy Pulse
entries: One creature that the boggart can see within 30 feet of it must make a {@dc 12} Strength saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) force damage and is either knocked {@condition prone} or pushed 10 feet in a straight line away from the boggart (the boggart's choice). On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and is not knocked {@condition prone} or pushed away.

items.name: Lesser Telekinesis
entries: The boggart chooses an object that it can see within 30 feet of it that weighs up to 30 pounds. If the object isn't being worn or carried, the boggart automatically moves it up to 30 feet in any direction, but not into a space more than 30 feet away from the boggart.

items.name: Restorative Soul
entries: The boggart chooses a willing creature that it can see within 30 feet of it. That creature regains 3 ({@dice 1d6}) hit points.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The dreamreaver casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 16}):

trait.name: Amphibiousness
entries: The dreamreaver can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Ethereal Sight
entries: The dreamreaver can see 60 feet into the Ethereal Plane when it is on the Material Plane, and vice versa.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The dreamreaver makes three Psionic Lash attacks, then it uses Mindrake or Siphon Dreams, if available.

action.name: Psionic Lash
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) psychic damage and if the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw or be pulled up to 15 feet in a straight line towards the dreamreaver.

action.name: Mindrake
entries: The dreamreaver releases a pulse of mind-addling psionic energy in a 20-foot-radius around it. Each creature of the dreamreaver's choice that's caught in the area must make a {@dc 16} Intelligence saving throw, taking 16 ({@damage 3d10}) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.

action.name: Siphon Dreams {@recharge 5}
entries: The dreamreaver stares into the mind of a creature that it can see within 15 feet of it, siphoning the essence of its dreams and nightmares. The target must make a {@dc 16} Intelligence saving throw, taking 28 ({@damage 8d6}) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one. On a failed saving throw, the dreamreaver can choose one of the following benefits:

items.name: Devour Dreams
entries: The dreamreaver regains hit points equal to the damage dealt to the target.

items.name: Manifest Dreams
entries: The dreamreaver immediately casts {@spell summon dream spirit} without any components (no action required). When it casts summon dream spirit in this way, the spell has a range of 10 feet and it does not require {@status concentration}.

bonus.name: Ethereal Jaunt
entries: As a bonus action, the dreamreaver can magically shift from the Material Plane to the Ethereal Plane, or vice versa.

trait.name: Decoy Appearance
entries: While more than 30 feet away from the temptress, a creature perceives the temptress as a Fey or Humanoid. A creature with a passive Perception of 15 or higher can detect its true identity from up to 60 feet away, while a creature with a passive Perception of 20 or higher can detect its true identity from any distance.

trait.name: False Telepathy
entries: While the temptress is using its Luring Pheromones action, any creature within 300 feet of the temptress begins to hallucinate. A creature hears whatever might entice it to move closer to the source. A heroic creature might hear a cry for help, a druid might hear the mewling of a wounded animal, while a creature searching for someone might hear that person's voice. A creature that is not {@condition charmed} by the temptress can use its action to make a successful {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw. On a success, the creature realizes that the sounds are hallucinations.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The temptress makes two Tendril attacks and one Bite or Grasping Roots attack. It then uses Poison Cloud, if available.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}25 ({@damage 4d10 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Grasping Roots
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature not {@condition grappled} by the temptress. {@h}The target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 13}). Until the grapple ends, the target takes 10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage at the start of each of its turns. The root has AC 15 and can be severed by dealing 6 fire or slashing damage or more to it at once. Cutting the root doesn't hurt the temptress, but ends the grapple.

action.name: Tendril
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d10 + 3}) slashing damage and the target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or be pulled up to 10 feet straight towards the temptress.

action.name: Luring Pheromones
entries: The temptress releases {@condition invisible}, sweet-smelling pheromones. Each non-Plant creature within 300 feet of the temptress that can smell the pheromones must succeed on a {@dc 11} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition charmed} until the temptress stops releasing the pheromones. The temptress must take a bonus action on its subsequent turns to continue releasing pheromones. It can stop releasing the pheromones at any time. The pheromones ends if the temptress is {@condition incapacitated}.

While {@condition charmed} by the temptress, a target is {@condition incapacitated} and ignores the pheromones of other temptresses. If the {@condition charmed} target is more than 5 feet away from the temptress, the target must move on its turn toward the temptress by the most direct route. It doesn't avoid opportunity attacks, but before moving into damaging terrain, such as lava or a pit, and whenever it takes damage from a source other than the temptress, a target can repeat the saving throw. A creature can also repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns. If a creature's saving throw is successful, the effect ends on it.

action.name: Poison Cloud {@recharge 5}
entries: The temptress spews a cloud of poison, which fills a 60-foot cone. The poison spreads around corners, and its area is heavily obscured. It lasts until the end of the temptress's next turn. Whenever a creature other than the temptress enters the area for the first time or starts its turn there, it must make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 22 ({@damage 6d6}) poison damage and becomes {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. On a success, a creature takes half as much damage and is otherwise unaffected. A creature that is {@condition poisoned} in this way can repeat its saving throw at the end of each of its turns, provided that it's not still within the area.

bonus.name: Earthen Walls (3/Day)
entries: The temptress creates up to three walls of earth bound with roots and vines, which spring up from the ground at points it chooses within 60 feet of it. Each wall is 10 feet high, 10 feet wide, and 3 inches thick.
If a wall cuts through a creature's space when it appears, the creature is pushed to one side of the wall (the temptress's choice).

Each wall is an object made of earth that can be damaged and thus breached. Each wall has AC 15, 20 hit points, vulnerability to thunder damage, and immunity to poison and psychic damage. Reducing a wall of 0 hit points destroys it and leaves behind difficult terrain in its space.

monster.name: Ashogg

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The ashogg has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the ashogg fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Paralytic Gaze
entries: Provided it's not {@condition blinded}, the ashogg's front two eyes creates an area of paralysis in a 60-foot cone. At the start of each of its front head's turns, the ashogg decides which way the cone faces and whether the cone is active. When a creature starts its turn inside the area and is able to see the ashogg's front two eyes, the ashogg can magically force it to make a {@dc 19} Wisdom saving throw, unless the ashogg is {@condition incapacitated}. On a failed saving throw, the creature is {@condition stunned} until the start of its next turn.

Unless surprised, a creature can avert its eyes to avoid the saving throw at the start of its turn. If the creature does so, it can't see the ashogg until the start of its next turn, when it can avert its eyes again. If the creature looks at the ashogg in the meantime, it must immediately make the save.
If the ashogg sees itself reflected on a polished surface within 30 feet of it and in an area of bright light, the ashogg is affected by its own gaze.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: The ashogg deals double damage to objects and structures.

trait.name: Twin Actions
entries: Both of the ashogg's heads each have different turns in the initiative order.

trait.name: Two-Headed
entries: The ashogg has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks and on saving throws against being {@condition blinded}, {@condition charmed}, {@condition deafened}, {@condition frightened}, {@condition stunned}, or knocked {@condition unconscious}.

trait.name: Wakeful
entries: While the ashogg sleeps, at least one of its heads is awake.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 1d10 + 6}) piercing damage plus 21 ({@damage 6d6}) poison damage.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d6 + 6}) bludgeoning damage. The ashogg can move up to 10 feet immediately before or after this attack.

action.name: Poison Spittle
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}21 ({@damage 6d6}) poison damage.

action.name: Telekinetic Gaze (Back Head Only)
entries: The ashogg looks towards a creature that it can see within 60 feet of it. If the target can see the ashogg's back two eyes, the target must succeed on a {@dc 19} Strength saving throw or be moved up to 30 feet in any direction, but no further than 60 feet away from the ashogg and is suspended there, {@condition restrained}. The target remains {@condition restrained} until the end of the ashogg's back head's next turn or until the target is ever more than 60 feet away from the ashogg.

bonus.name: Invisibility {@recharge}
entries: The ashogg becomes {@condition invisible} for as long as it maintains {@status concentration} (as if {@status concentration||concentrating} on a spell). This bonus action can't recharge while the invisibility lasts.

legendary.name: Slam
entries: The ashogg makes a Slam attack.

legendaryHeader: The ashogg can take 1 legendary action, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The ashogg regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: If the tree is motionless at the start of combat, it has advantage on its initiative roll. Moreover, if a creature hasn't observed the tree move or act, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 16} Intelligence (Investigation) check to discern that the tree isn't an ordinary dead tree.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The tree has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the tree fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: The tree deals double damage to objects and structures.

trait.name: Unusual Nature
entries: The tree doesn't require sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The tree makes two Branches attacks, or it uses its Blight Bolt twice. It can replace any one of these with a Grasping Roots attack. It then uses its Spawn Blights, if available.

action.name: Branches
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d8 + 7}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Grasping Roots
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 30 ft., one target not {@condition grappled} by the blight. {@h}The target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 20}). Until the grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained} and it takes 13 ({@damage 1d12 + 7}) bludgeoning damage at the start of each of its turns.

The root has AC 16 and can be severed by dealing 18 damage or more to it at once. The root has immunity to bludgeoning, piercing, poison, and psychic damage. Destroying the root doesn't hurt the tree, but ends the grapple.

action.name: Blight Bolt
entries: The tree launches a globule of necrotic energy towards a point that it can see within 120 feet of it, exploding on impact. Each creature within 10 feet of the target point must make a {@dc 20} Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes 11 ({@damage 2d10}) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.

action.name: Spawn Blights {@recharge 5}
entries: The tree spawns any Blight creatures with a combined Challenge Rating equal to or less than {@dice 1d4 + 1}, which appear in unoccupied spaces within 15 feet of it. Each spawned blight is an ally of the tree.
If the tree dies, any of its spawned blights wither and die 24 hours later.

action.name: Wrath Gulthias {@recharge}
entries: The tree releases tendrils of necrotic energy 120-foot-radius around it. Each creature caught in the area must make a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw. A creature takes 44 ({@damage 8d10}) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.

Additionally, the dark tendrils linger in the air for a moment. Whenever a creature within the area dies before the start of the tree's next turn, its soul is captured by the tree. The tree regains hit points equal to the creature's hit point maximum and until the tree is destroyed, the dead creature can't be returned to life by any means short of a {@spell wish} spell.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: The tree makes a Branches attack or it uses its Blight Bolt.

legendary.name: Grasping Roots (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The tree makes a Grasping    Roots attack.

legendary.name: Life Hunger (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The tree draws lifeforce from a creature within 60 feet of it. That creature must make a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw, taking 16 ({@damage 2d12 + 3}) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one. The tree regains hit points equal to the necrotic damage dealt.

trait.name: Unusual Nature
entries: The blight doesn't require sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The blight makes three Thorn Vine or Poison Pulse attacks. It then uses its Poison Pollen.

action.name: Thorn Vine
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Poison Pulse
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 10 ft., one {@condition poisoned} creature. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d12 + 3}) poison damage.

action.name: Poison Pollen
entries: The blight releases a spray of poison toward a creature within 15 feet of it. The target must make a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the target takes 19 ({@damage 3d12}) poison damage and becomes {@condition poisoned} 1 minute. On a success, a creature takes half as much damage and is not {@condition poisoned}. A creature {@condition poisoned} in this way can repeat its saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: If the blight is motionless at the start of combat, it has advantage on its initiative roll. Moreover, if a creature hasn't observed the tree move or act, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 16} Intelligence (Investigation) check to discern that the blight isn't an ordinary tangle of gnarled roots.

trait.name: Grappler
entries: The blight has advantage on attack rolls against any creature {@condition grappled} by it.

trait.name: Unusual Nature
entries: The blight doesn't require sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The blight makes two Slam attacks.

action.name: Thorn Vine
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) slashing damage.

bonus.name: Binding Roots
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}The target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 14}). Until this grapple ends, the blight can't use its Binding Roots on another target.

monster.name: Tree Blight
languages: understands Common and Druidic but can't speak

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: If the blight is motionless at the start of combat, it has advantage on its initiative roll. Moreover, if a creature hasn't observed the tree move or act, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 16} Intelligence (Investigation) check to discern that the blight isn't an ordinary dead tree.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: The blight deals double damage to objects and structures.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The blight makes two Branches attacks, two Grasping Roots attacks, and one Bite attack.

action.name: Branches
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 3d6 + 6}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature {@condition grappled} by the blight. {@h}19 ({@damage 3d8 + 6}) piercing damage.

action.name: Grasping Roots
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 15 ft., one creature not {@condition grappled} by the blight. {@h}The target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 15}). Until the grapple ends, the target takes 9 ({@damage 1d6 + 6}) bludgeoning damage at the start of each of its turns. The root has AC 15 and can be severed by dealing 6 slashing damage or more to it at once. Cutting the root doesn't hurt the blight, but ends the grapple.

trait.name: Blood Frenzy
entries: The bloodthorn has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all its hit points.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: If the bloodthorn is motionless at the start of combat, it has advantage on its initiative roll. Moreover, if a creature hasn't observed the bloodthorn move or act, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 18} Intelligence (Investigation) check to discern that the bloodthorn isn't an ordinary patch of vines.

trait.name: Lightning Absorption
entries: Whenever the bloodthorn is subjected to lightning damage, it takes no damage and instead regains a number of hit points equal to the lightning damage dealt. Then, if it's Large or smaller it grows in size by one category—from Medium to Large, for example. This growth lasts for 8 hours.
While Huge or larger, the bloodthorn gains a +2 bonus to AC, its speed increases to 20 feet, and it gains advantage on Strength checks and saving throws.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The bloodthorn can climb on difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Susceptibility to Fire
entries: Whenever the bloodthorn takes fire damage, it takes the maximum possible damage.

trait.name: Unusual Nature
entries: The bloodthorn doesn't require sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The bloodthorn makes two Tendril attacks. If both attacks hit a Medium or smaller target, the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 13}), and the bloodthorn uses its Engulf on it.

action.name: Tendril
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Engulf
entries: The bloodthorn engulfs a Medium or smaller creature {@condition grappled} by it. The engulfed target is pulled into the bloodthorn's space and is {@condition restrained} there. While there, the engulfed target is unable to breathe and it must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw at the start of each of the bloodthorn's turns or take 8 ({@damage 2d4 + 3}) piercing damage. If the target contains blood, the bloodthorn then regains hit points equal to the damage dealt. If the bloodthorn moves, the engulfed target moves with it. The bloodthorn can have only one creature engulfed at a time.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: If the cocoapult is motionless at the start of combat, it has advantage on its initiative roll. Moreover, if a creature hasn't observed the cocoapult move or act, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 16} Intelligence (Investigation) check to discern that the cocoapult isn't an ordinary cacao tree.

trait.name: Mindnumbing Aroma
entries: The cocoapult exudes a sweet-smelling aura of pacification in a 30-foot-radius around it. Whenever a creature starts its turn in the aura and can smell it must succeed on a {@dc 17} Wisdom saving throw or suffer the following penalties until the start of its next turn: its speed is reduced by 10 feet, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks, and it deals only half damage with weapon attacks. A Construct, Plant, or Undead automatically succeeds on the saving throw, as does any creature immune to the {@condition charmed} condition.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: The cocoapult deals double damage to objects and structures.

trait.name: Susceptibility to Fire
entries: Whenever the cocoapult takes fire damage, it takes the maximum possible damage.

trait.name: Unusual Nature
entries: The cocoapult doesn't require sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The cocoapult makes one Slam attack and one Fist or Stomp attack. It can replace one attack with a use of Fling.

action.name: Fist
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d8 + 6}) bludgeoning damage, and if the target is Large or smaller, it's {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 17}). Until the grapple ends, the creature is {@condition restrained}, it takes 15 ({@damage 2d8 + 6}) bludgeoning damage at the start of each of the cocoapult's turns, and the cocoapult can't make a Rock attack or make a Fist attack against another target.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d10 + 6}) bludgeoning damage. If the cocoapult moved at least 20 feet straight toward the target immediately before the hit, the target takes an extra 5 ({@damage 1d10}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 17} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Stomp
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one {@condition prone} creature. {@h}28 ({@damage 4d10 + 6}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Rock
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 9} to hit, range 300/1,200 ft., one target. {@h}44 ({@damage 7d10 + 6}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Fling
entries: One Large or smaller creature {@condition grappled} by the cocoapult is thrown up to 60 feet to a space that the cocoapult can see. The creature lands {@condition prone}, taking 3 ({@damage 1d6}) bludgeoning damage for every 10 feet it was thrown. A creature that obstructs the path of the hurled creature must succeed on a {@dc 17} Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, the obstructing creature takes an equal amount of damage and falls {@condition prone}, whilst the hurled creature lands in the nearest unoccupied space. On a success, the hurled creature continues through the obstructing creature's space.

trait.name: Creature Sense
entries: The cortex bloom is aware of the presence of creatures within 30 feet of it. It knows the distance and direction to each creature, as well as each creature's Intelligence score, but can't sense anything else about it. A creature protected by a {@spell mind blank} spell, a {@spell nondetection} spell, or similar magic can't be perceived in this manner.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The cortex bloom can climb on difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Unusual Nature
entries: The cortex bloom doesn't require sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The cortex bloom makes three Psychic Lash attacks.

action.name: Psychic Lash
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 15 ft., one creature. {@h}2 ({@damage 1d4}) psychic damage and it's speed is halved until the end of its next turn.

trait.name: Creature Sense
entries: The cortex bloom is aware of the presence of creatures within 30 feet of it. It knows the distance and direction to each creature, as well as each creature's Intelligence score, but can't sense anything else about it. A creature protected by a {@spell mind blank} spell, a {@spell nondetection} spell, or similar magic can't be perceived in this manner.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The cortex bloom can climb on difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Unusual Nature
entries: The cortex bloom doesn't require sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The cortex bloom makes three Psychic Lash attacks.

action.name: Psychic Lash
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 30 ft., one creature. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d4 + 2}) psychic damage and it's speed is halved until the end of its next turn.

bonus.name: Mind Spore (1/Day)
entries: The cortex bloom psychically plants a poisonous thought in the mind of a creature that it can see within 30 feet of it that it can communicate with telepathically, which survives in the target's mind for 1 hour. While the mind spore persists, the target has disadvantage on ability checks and whenever it takes psychic damage, it takes an extra 3 ({@damage 1d6}) psychic damage. A Construct, Plant, or Undead can't be implanted with a mind spore, nor can any creature immune to the {@condition charmed} condition.

A creature afflicted with a mind spore can use its action and make a {@dc 11} Wisdom saving throw, overcoming and destroying the mind spore on a success.    If a creature dies while afflicted with a mind spore, the spore remains in its dying brain and becomes a fully grown cortex sprout after {@dice 1d4} days. If the brain of the corpse is destroyed, the mind spore too is destroyed.

trait.name: Creature Sense
entries: The cortex bloom is aware of the presence of creatures within 60 feet of it. It knows the distance and direction to each creature, as well as each creature's Intelligence score, but can't sense anything else about it. A creature protected by a {@spell mind blank} spell, a {@spell nondetection} spell, or similar magic can't be perceived in this manner.

trait.name: Multiple Minds
entries: While it has at least one offshoot, the cortex bloom has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks and on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, {@condition frightened}, {@condition stunned}, and knocked {@condition unconscious}. An offshoot also gains these benefits.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The cortex bloom can climb on difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Unusual Nature
entries: The cortex bloom doesn't require sleep.

action.name: Psychic Lash
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 30 ft., one creature. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) psychic damage and the target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Intelligence saving throw or be {@condition restrained}. A creature {@condition restrained} by these psychic bonds can use its action to remake the saving throw, freeing itself on a success.

bonus.name: Rhizome Split
entries: The cortex bloom extrudes a rhizome of glowing purple energy to an unoccupied space within 30 feet of it, spawning a smaller offshoot of itself in that space.

The offshoot has the same statistics as the cortex bloom, except they're Small, they have a hit point maximum equal to half the cortex bloom's current hit points, and they lack this bonus action. The offshoot takes its turn immediately after the cortex bloom on the same initiative count and obeys the cortex bloom's commands.

The offshoot remains connected to the cortex bloom by a psychic rhizome. The rhizome is immune to damage, but it's severed if there is no opening at least 1 inch wide between the cortex bloom and the offshoot or if the offshoot is ever more than 60 feet away from the cortex bloom. The offshoot dies when it's reduced to 0 hit points, when the rhizome is severed, or when the cortex bloom dies. When the offshoot dies, the cortex bloom takes 20 psychic damage.
The cortex bloom can maintain up to three offshoots at once. If it creates a fourth, its oldest offshoot immediately dies.

trait.name: Creature Sense
entries: The cortex bloom is aware of the presence of creatures within 120 feet of it. It knows the distance and direction to each creature, as well as each creature's Intelligence score, but can't sense anything else about it. A creature protected by a {@spell mind blank} spell, a {@spell nondetection} spell, or similar magic can't be perceived in this manner.

trait.name: Hypnotic Aroma
entries: The cortex bloom exudes a sickly-sweet scent laced with psychic energy in a 120-foot-radius around it. The aroma spreads around corners. Whenever a creature enters the area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there while able to smell the aroma, it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition charmed} by the cortex bloom for 1 minute.
While {@condition charmed} in this way, a creature is {@condition incapacitated} and it uses all of its movement on each of its turns to move towards the cortex bloom by the safest possible means.

The effect ends for a creature if it takes any damage other than psychic damage or if someone else uses an action to shake the creature out of its stupor. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the cortex bloom's Hypnotic Aroma for the next 24 hours.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The cortex bloom has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Unusual Nature
entries: The cortex bloom doesn't require sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The cortex bloom makes three Psychic Lash attacks and one Swallow attack.

action.name: Psychic Lash
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 60 ft., one creature. {@h}20 ({@damage 3d10 + 4}) psychic damage and it's pulled up to 10 feet in a straight line towards the cortex bloom.

action.name: Swallow
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}The target is swallowed. While swallowed, the target is {@condition blinded} and {@condition restrained}, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the cortex bloom, and at the start of each of the behir's turns it must make a {@dc 16} Intelligence saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 21 ({@damage 6d6}) psychic damage and is {@condition stunned} until the start of its next turn. On a success, a creature takes half as much damage and is not {@condition stunned}. A cortex bloom can have only one creature swallowed at a time.

A creature that dies while swallowed by the cortex bloom has its dying mind implanted with multiple mind spores. These spores remain in its dying brain and become a fully grown cortex bloom after {@dice 1d4} days. If the brain of the corpse is destroyed, the mind spores too are destroyed. A Construct, Plant, or Undead can't be implanted with a mind spore, nor can any creature immune to the {@condition charmed} condition.

If the cortex bloom takes 30 damage or more on a single turn from the swallowed creature, the cortex bloom must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate the creature, which falls {@condition prone} in a space within 10 feet of the cortex bloom. If the cortex bloom dies, a swallowed creature is no longer {@condition restrained} by it and can escape from the corpse by using 15 feet of movement, exiting {@condition prone}.

action.name: Synaptic Blast {@recharge 5}
entries: The cortex bloom unleashes an explosion of psychic energy in a 30-foot-radius around it. Each creature other than a Cortex Bloom caught in the area must make a {@dc 16} Intelligence saving throw. A creature with an Intelligence score of 2 or lower succeeds on this saving throw automatically. A target takes 32 ({@damage 8d6 + 4}) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

Additionally, a creature that fails its saving throw has its thoughts addled for 1 minute. During that time, it rolls a {@dice d6} and subtracts the number rolled from all its attack rolls and ability checks, as well as its Constitution saving throws to maintain {@status concentration}. The target can remake its saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

trait.name: Creature Sense
entries: The cortex bloom is aware of the presence of creatures within 2 miles of it. It knows the distance and direction to each creature, as well as each creature's Intelligence score, but can't sense anything else about it. A creature protected by a {@spell mind blank} spell, a {@spell nondetection} spell, or similar magic can't be perceived in this manner.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The cortex bloom has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the cortex bloom fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Psychic Shield
entries: Each allied Cortex Bloom within 2 miles of the cortex bloom gains immunity to psychic damage, any effect that would sense its emotions or read its thoughts, divination spells, and the {@condition charmed} condition.

trait.name: Telepathic Hub
entries: The cortex bloom can use its telepathy to initiate and maintain telepathic conversations with up to ten creatures at a time. The cortex bloom can let those creatures telepathically hear each other while connected in this way.

trait.name: Unusual Nature
entries: The cortex bloom doesn't require sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The cortex bloom makes three Psychic Lash or Psionic Bolt attacks and uses Mind Blast, if available.

action.name: Psychic Lash
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 60 ft., one creature. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d10 + 6}) psychic damage. Additionally, whenever the target makes an attack roll, ability check, or saving throw before the start of the cortex bloom's next turn, it rolls a {@dice d4} and subtracts the number rolled from the attack roll, ability check, or saving throw due to its addled mind. Each time the cortex bloom hits a mind-addled target with this attack, the size of the die rolled increases by one size, up to a maximum of a {@dice d12}.

action.name: Psionic Bolt
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 12} to hit (this attack ignores cover), range 120 ft., one creature. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d6 + 6}) psychic damage.

action.name: Thought Telepathy
entries: The cortex bloom focuses its mind on a creature that it can telepathically communicate with. Until the cortex bloom stops {@status concentration||concentrating} (as if {@status concentration||concentrating} on a spell) or uses this feature again, the cortex bloom can read that creature's surface thoughts as per the {@spell detect thoughts} spell.

action.name: Mind Blast {@recharge 5}
entries: The cortex medulla unleashes a blast of psychic energy in a 60-foot cone. Each creature other than a Cortex Bloom caught in the area must make a {@dc 20} Intelligence saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 33 ({@damage 5d10 + 6}) psychic damage and it suffers the effects of the {@spell slow} spell until the start of the cortex bloom's next turn. On a success, a creature takes half as much damage and suffers no other effects.

bonus.name: Brain Domination
entries: The cortex bloom casts {@spell dominate monster}, requiring no components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 20}). When it casts {@spell dominate monster} in this way, it has a range of 2 miles, it doesn't require {@status concentration}, and the target doesn't have advantage on this saving throw if it or creatures friendly to it are fighting the cortex bloom. The cortex bloom must target a creature that the cortex bloom can telepathically communicate with and that is under the effect of its Mind Spore bonus action.

bonus.name: Mind Spore (3/Day)
entries: The cortex bloom psychically plants a poisonous thought in the mind of a creature that it can see within 2 miles of it that it can communicate with telepathically, which survives in the target's mind for 8 hours. While the mind spore persists, whenever the target takes psychic damage, it takes an extra 5 ({@damage 1d10}) psychic damage. Only a {@spell detect magic} spell or similar magic can reveal the mind spore as a supernaturally-implanted thought. A Construct, Plant, or Undead can't be implanted with a mind spore, nor can any creature immune to the {@condition charmed} condition.
A creature afflicted with a mind spore that is aware of it can use its action and make a {@dc 20} Wisdom saving throw, overcoming and destroying the mind spore on a success.

If a creature dies while afflicted with a mind spore, the spore remains in its dying brain and becomes a fully grown cortex sprout after {@dice 1d4} days. If the brain of the corpse is destroyed, the mind spore too is destroyed.

legendary.name: Psionic Bolt
entries: The cortex bloom makes a Psionic Bolt attack.

legendary.name: Teleport
entries: The cortex bloom magically teleports, along with anything it's carrying, up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

legendary.name: Psychic Command (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The cortex bloom speaks a telepathic command to one creature under the effects of its {@spell dominate monster} spell. The cortex bloom takes total and precise control of that creature, as per the {@spell dominate monster} spell.

trait.name: Dandelion Resilience
entries: The dandeling has advantage on saving throws against poison and disease.

trait.name: Featherweight
entries: When the dandeling falls, its rate of descent is 60 feet per round. When it lands, it takes no falling damage and can land on its feet.

trait.name: Speak with Beasts and Plants
entries: The dandeling can speak with Beasts and Plants as if it shared a language with them.

action.name: Rapier
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Seed Sling
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) bludgeoning damage.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The dandeling adds 2 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the dandeling must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The dandeling casts one of the following spells, using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 13}, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks):

trait.name: Dandelion Resilience
entries: The dandeling has advantage on saving throws against poison and disease.

trait.name: Featherweight
entries: When the dandeling falls, its rate of descent is 60 feet per round. When it lands, it takes no falling damage and can land on its feet.

trait.name: Land's Stride
entries: Moving through nonmagical difficult terrain costs the dandeling no extra movement. It can also pass through nonmagical plants without being slowed by them and without taking damage from them if they have thorns, spines, or a similar hazard.
In addition, the dandeling has advantage on saving throws against plants that are magically created or manipulated to impede movement, such as those created by the {@spell entangle} spell.

trait.name: Speak with Beasts and Plants
entries: The dandeling can speak with Beasts and Plants as if it shared a language with them.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The dandeling makes two Pollencast attacks.

action.name: Pollencast
entries: {@atk ms,rs} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 60 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d12 + 3}) poison damage.

trait.name: Evasion
entries: If the swarm is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw and only half damage if it fails, provided it isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: If the swarm is motionless at the start of combat, it has advantage on its initiative roll. Moreover, if a creature hasn't observed the swarm move or act, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 18} Intelligence (Investigation) check to discern that the swarm isn't an ordinary patch of flowers.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The swarm regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point. If the swarm takes cold or fire damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the swarm's next turn.

trait.name: Swarm
entries: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny plant. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points except via its Regeneration trait.

trait.name: Unusual Nature
entries: The swarm doesn't require sleep.

action.name: Blood Drain
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 0 ft., one creature in the swarm's space. {@h}18 ({@damage 4d8}) necrotic damage, or 9 ({@damage 2d8}) necrotic damage if the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer, and the target's Constitution score is reduced by {@dice 1d4}. The target dies if this reduces its Constitution to 0. Otherwise, the reduction lasts until the target finishes a short or long rest.

If a Beast, Dragon, Giant, Monstrosity, or Humanoid is killed by this attack, its body is infested with dread blossom seeds. The seeds remain in the corpse and survive to become a fully grown swarm of dread blossoms in 7 days. If the corpse is frozen or burnt, the seeds die.

action.name: Paralyzing Pollen {@recharge 5}
entries: The swarm releases a burst of paralytic pollen in a 10-foot-radius around it. Each non-Plant creature in the area must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. A creature {@condition poisoned} in this way is {@condition paralyzed}. A creature {@condition poisoned} in this way can repeat its saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

trait.name: Limited Mimicry
entries: The scorpion bloom's screech is similar to that of a human woman's scream. A creature that hears the sounds can tell it's an imitations with a successful {@dc 12} Wisdom (Insight) check.

trait.name: Poisonous Body
entries: A creature that touches the scorpion bloom or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) poison damage.

trait.name: Unusual Nature
entries: The scorpion bloom doesn't require sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The scorpion bloom makes one Bite attack or one Spear Tongue attack. It then makes two Tentacle attacks, each of which it can replace with one use of Fling.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, 5 ft., one target. {@h}21 ({@damage 3d10 + 5}) piercing damage plus 18 ({@damage 4d8}) acid damage.

action.name: Spear Tongue
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d10 + 5}) piercing damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) acid damage and, if the target is Huge or smaller, it's pulled into the nearest unoccupied space to the scorpion bloom.

action.name: Tentacle
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, 15 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) poison damage and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 15}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained} and it takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) poison damage at the start of each of its turns. The scorpion bloom has ten tentacles, each of which can grapple one target.

action.name: Fling
entries: One Medium or smaller object held or creature {@condition grappled} by the scorpion bloom is thrown up to 30 feet in a direction of the scorpion bloom's choice and knocked {@condition prone}. If a thrown target strikes a solid surface, the target takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) bludgeoning damage for every 10 feet it was thrown. If the target is thrown at another creature, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw or take the same damage and be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Acid Spray {@recharge 5}
entries: The scorpion bloom spits acid that forms a line 60 feet long and 5 feet wide. Each creature in the line must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 35 ({@damage 10d6}) acid damage and its speed is reduced by half until the start of the scorpion bloom's next turn. On a success, a creature takes half as much damage and its speed is unaffected.

trait.name: Adhesive Blossoms
entries: The thorn slinger adheres to anything that touches it. A Medium or smaller creature adhered to the thorn slinger is also {@condition grappled} by it (escape {@dc 11}). Ability checks made to escape this grapple have disadvantage. The thorn slinger detaches from whatever it adheres to if it dies, or it uses a bonus action to detach itself.
At the end of each of the thorn slinger's turns, anything it's adhered to takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) acid damage.

trait.name: Aversion to Fire
entries: If the thorn slinger takes fire damage, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks until the end of its next turn.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: If the thorn slinger is motionless at the start of combat, it has advantage on its initiative roll. Moreover, if a creature hasn't observed the thorn slinger move or act, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 18} Intelligence (Investigation) check to discern that the creeper isn't an ordinary bush.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The thorn slinger can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Unusual Nature
entries: The thorn slinger doesn't require sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The thorn slinger makes {@dice 1d4} Thorns attacks.

action.name: Thorns
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@dice 1d6 + 2}) piercing (Ranged) or slashing (Melee) damage.

trait.name: Multiple Heads
entries: The frond has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks and on saving throws against being {@condition frightened}, {@condition stunned}, or knocked {@condition unconscious}.

trait.name: Unusual Nature
entries: The frond doesn't require sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The frond uses its Yellow Blossom and its Orange Blossom, and its Red Blossom.

action.name: Red Blossom
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 12}).
