Until this grapple ends, the target takes 5 ({@damage 2d4}) poison damage at the start of each of its turns. The red blossom can grapple only one target at a time.

action.name: Orange Blossom
entries: The frond chooses one creature it can see within 10 feet of it. The target must succeed on a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} for 1 hour. While {@condition poisoned} in this way, the target is {@condition unconscious}. At the end of each minute, whenever it takes damage, or whenever another creature uses its action to shake or slap it awake, the {@condition poisoned} target can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Yellow Blossom
entries: The frond chooses one creature it can see within 10 feet of it. The target must succeed on a {@dc 12} Dexterity saving throw or become covered with corrosive sap; until someone uses an action to douse the creature with liquid to wash off the sap, the creature takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) acid damage at the start of each of its turns.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: If the shade is motionless at the start of combat, it has advantage on its initiative roll. Moreover, if a creature hasn't observed the shade move or act, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 18} Intelligence (Investigation) check to discern that the creeper isn't an ordinary flower.

trait.name: Slime Font
entries: Whenever a non-Insect creature touches the shade or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it, they become covered in weeping shade slime.

While coated in slime, a creature's speed is halved, Insect creatures have advantage on attack rolls against it, and it conveys the effects of the shade's Stench trait in a 10-foot-radius around it. A creature can be cleaned of slime by immersing itself in liquid or when it or another creature uses an action to clean the creature of slime.

trait.name: Stench
entries: Any non-Insect creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of the shade must succeed on a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} until the start of its next turn. On a successful saving throw, the creature is immune to the shade's Stench for 24 hours.

trait.name: Unusual Nature
entries: The shade doesn't require sleep.

action.name: Slime Spray
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 2} to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 2d4}) acid damage and the target becomes coated with weeping shade slime, as per the shade's Slime Font trait.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: If the creeper is motionless at the start of combat, it has advantage on its initiative roll. Moreover, if a creature hasn't observed the creeper move or act, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 18} Intelligence (Investigation) check to discern that the creeper isn't an ordinary flowering vine.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The creeper regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn. If the creeper takes fire, necrotic, or radiant damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of its next turn. The creeper dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

trait.name: Unusual Nature
entries: The creeper doesn't require sleep.

action.name: Touch
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}13 ({@damage 3d8}) psychic damage. If the target is a Humanoid that drops to 0 hit points as a result of this damage, it dies and is implanted with a yellow musk creeper bulb. Unless the bulb is destroyed, the corpse animates as a zombie after being dead for 24 hours. The bulb is destroyed if the creature is raised from the dead before it can transform into a yellow musk zombie, or if the corpse is targeted by a {@spell remove curse} spell or similar magic before it animates.

action.name: Yellow Musk (3/Day)
entries: The creeper's flowers release a strong musk that targets all Humanoids within 30 feet of it. Each target must succeed on a {@dc 11} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition charmed} by the creeper for 1 minute. A creature {@condition charmed} in this way does nothing on its turn except move as close as it can to the creeper. A creature {@condition charmed} by the creeper can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

trait.name: Cold Lethargy
entries: Whenever the basidirond is subjected to cold damage, it takes no damage and instead its speed is reduced by 10 feet and its Hallucinogenic Spores trait doesn't function until the end of its next turn.

trait.name: Hallucinogenic Spores
entries: As long as it's not {@condition incapacitated}, the basidirond emanates a cloud of microscopic spores in a 20-foot-radius around it. The spores spread around corners. Whenever a creature starts its turn breathing in the spores, it must make a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, the creature can't take reactions until the start of its next turn and rolls a {@dice d8} to determine what it does during that turn. On a 1 to 4, the creature does nothing. On a 5 or 6, the creature takes no action but uses all its movement to move in a random direction. On a 7 or 8, the creature makes one melee attack against a random creature, or it does nothing if no creature is within reach. A creature that doesn't breathe, is immune to poison damage, or is a Construct, Elemental, Plant, or Undead, automatically succeeds on this saving throw.

trait.name: Unusual Nature
entries: The basidirond doesn't require sleep.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the target becomes {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. While {@condition poisoned} in this way, the target's speed is halved and it takes 14 ({@damage 4d6}) poison damage at the start of each of its turns. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

trait.name: Corrosive Spores
entries: As long as it's not {@condition incapacitated}, the killer emanates a cloud of microscopic spores in a 30-foot-radius around it. The spores spread around corners. Whenever a creature starts its turn breathing in the spores, it must make a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw, taking 10 ({@damage 3d6}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: If the killer is motionless at the start of combat, it has advantage on its initiative roll. Moreover, if a creature hasn't observed the killer move or act, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 15} Intelligence (Investigation) check to discern that the killer isn't an ordinary fungus.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The killer can climb on difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Unusual Nature
entries: The killer doesn't require sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The killer makes {@dice 1d4} Acidic Touch attacks.

action.name: Acidic Touch
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) acid damage.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: If the skunkshroom is motionless at the start of combat, it has advantage on its initiative roll. Moreover, if a creature hasn't observed the skunkshroom move or act, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 18} Intelligence (Investigation) check to discern that the skunkshroom isn't an ordinary fungus.

trait.name: Unusual Nature
entries: The skunkshroom doesn't require sleep.

action.name: Stench Spray
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}2 ({@damage 1d4}) poison damage. The target and whatever it's wearing and carrying is then covered with foul-smelling spores. While the stench persists, the target exudes a foul-smelling aura in a 10-foot-radius around it. Whenever a non-Plant creature starts its turn in the area, if it can smell the aura, it must succeed on a {@dc 10} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition poisoned} until the start of its next turn. While {@condition poisoned} in this way, the target spends its action that turn retching and reeling. Additionally, the stench makes it so that the affected creature can't become hidden from any creature within 30 feet of it that can smell the aura.
The spores remain for 24 hours, or until an affected creature or object bathes for at least 1 hour.

monster.name: Spinefondler
languages: understands the languages of its host

trait.name: Aversion to Poison
entries: If the spinefondler takes poison damage, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks until the end of its next turn.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: If the spinefondler is motionless with its legs retracted at the start of combat, it has advantage on its initiative roll. Moreover, if a creature hasn't observed the spinefondler move or act, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 18} Intelligence (Investigation) check to discern that the spinefondler isn't an ordinary decomposing corpse.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The spinefondler regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point. If the spinefondler takes poison damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the spinefondler's next turn.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The spinefondler can climb on difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Sun Sickness
entries: While in sunlight, the spinefondler has disadvantage on ability checks, attack rolls, and saving throws. The spinefondler dies if it spends more than 1 hour in direct sunlight.

trait.name: Unusual Nature
entries: The spinefondler doesn't require sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The spinefondler makes two Foreleg attacks and one Grab attack. It can replace its Grab attack with a Bite attack or a use of Shriek.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target {@condition grappled} by the spinefondler. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must make a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw, taking 22 ({@damage 4d10}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A Humanoid that fails its saving throw becomes afflicted with spinefondler spores.

A creature afflicted with spinefondler spores has its hit point maximum reduced by 3 ({@dice 1d6}) every 24 hours. If this effect reduces the target's hit point maximum to half or less, it becomes {@condition paralyzed} until its hit point maximum returns to normal. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0. Any effect that cures disease or removes the {@condition poisoned} condition instantly kills the spores in the creature, ending the effect on it.

Unless it's corpse is destroyed, a Humanoid slain by this effect rises 7 days later as a new spinefondler. Additionally, any effect that cures diseases or removes the {@condition poisoned} condition that targets the corpse instantly kills the spores.

action.name: Foreleg
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d10 + 4}) piercing damage and the target is pushed up to 5 feet in a direction the spinefondler chooses that is horizontal to it.

action.name: Grab
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target the spinefondler has hit with an attack this turn. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 15}). Until this grapple ends, the creature is {@condition restrained}, and the spinefondler can't Grab another target.

action.name: Shriek {@recharge 5}
entries: The spinefondler's host lets out a bloodcurdling scream that is audible up to 300 feet. Each other creature within 120 feet of the spinefondler that hears the shriek must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} of the spinefondler until the start of the spinefondler's next turn. A creature {@condition frightened} in this way is {@condition paralyzed}.

reaction.name: Deadly Reach
entries: In response to a creature entering a space within 10 feet of it, the spinefondler makes one Foreleg attack against that creature.

trait.name: Evasion
entries: If the toadstool is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw and only half damage if it fails, provided it isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Featherweight
entries: When the toadstool falls, its rate of descent is 60 feet per round. When it lands, it takes no falling damage and can land on its feet.

trait.name: Unusual Nature
entries: The toadstool doesn't require sleep.

action.name: Touch
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}2 ({@damage 1d4}) poison damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. While {@condition poisoned} in this way, a creature takes 2 ({@damage 1d4}) poison damage at the start of each of its turns. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

bonus.name: Leap
entries: The toadstool jumps up to 30 feet without provoking opportunity attacks. The toadstool can't take this bonus action if its speed is 0.

trait.name: Evasion
entries: If the swarm is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw and only half damage if it fails, provided it isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Featherweight
entries: When the swarm falls, its rate of descent is 60 feet per round. When it lands, it takes no falling damage and can land on its feet.

trait.name: Swarm
entries: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny bat. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

trait.name: Unusual Nature
entries: The swarm doesn't require sleep.

action.name: Touches
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}10 ({@damage 4d4}) poison damage, or 5 ({@damage 2d4}) poison damage if the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer. The target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. While {@condition poisoned} in this way, a creature takes 5 ({@damage 2d4}) poison damage at the start of each of its turns. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

bonus.name: Leap
entries: The swarm jumps up to 30 feet without provoking opportunity attacks. The swarm can't take this bonus action if its speed is 0.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The gaia titan casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 19}, {@hit 11} to hit with spell attacks):

trait.name: Land's Stride
entries: Moving through nonmagical difficult terrain costs the gaia titan no extra movement. It can also pass through nonmagical plants without being slowed by them and without taking damage from them if they have thorns, spines, or a similar hazard.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The gaia titan has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Nature's Rage
entries: The gaia titan exudes a magical aura that rouses the spirits of nature in a 60-foot-radius around it. The aura's area is perpetually filled with the effects of the {@spell wrath of nature|XGE} spell ({@dc 19}).

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the gaia titan fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The gaia titan regains 30 hit points at the start of each of its turns. If the gaia titan takes fire damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the gaia titan's next turn. The gaia titan dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: The gaia titan deals double damage to objects and structures.

trait.name: Speak with Beasts and Plants
entries: The gaia titan can speak with Beasts, Plants, and noncreature plants as if they shared a language.

trait.name: Unusual Nature
entries: The gaia titan doesn't require sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The gaia titan makes three Slam or Razorblast attacks, one of which it can replace with a use of Spellcasting.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 16} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}27 ({@damage 3d12 + 8}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Razorblast
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 16} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 2d10 + 8}) piercing damage

bonus.name: Thorn Barrage
entries: The gaia titan launches a volley of thorns in a 60-foot cone. Each creature caught in the area must make a {@dc 19} Dexterity saving throw, taking 18 ({@damage 4d8}) piercing damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

bonus.name: Entangling Vines {@recharge 5}
entries: The gaia titan conjures a writhing tangle of vines that fill a 20-foot-radius sphere centered at a point on the ground that it can see within 120 feet of it. Each creature in the area must make a {@dc 19} Strength saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 21 ({@damage 6d6}) bludgeoning damage and is {@condition restrained} by the vines until the start of the gaia titan's next turn. On a success, a creature takes half as much damage and is not {@condition restrained}.

bonus.name: Summon Plant {@recharge}
entries: The gaia titan uses Spellcasting to cast the summon plant spell (see Player Options) at 4th level. When it casts summon plant in this way, it must choose Treant, the spell doesn't require {@status concentration} and ends early if the gaia titan uses this feature again.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: The gaia titan makes a Slam or Razorblast attack.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The gaia titan moves up to its speed.

legendary.name: Nature Magic (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The gaia titan uses Spellcasting or Thorn Barrage, or it uses Entangling Vines, if available.

trait.name: Adhesive (Plant Form Only)
entries: The mimic adheres to anything that touches it. A Huge or smaller creature adhered to the mimic is also {@condition grappled} by it (escape {@dc 14}). Ability checks made to escape this grapple have disadvantage. Until the grapple ends, the creature takes 9 ({@damage 2d8}) acid damage at the start of each of its turns.

trait.name: Amorphous (Amorphous Form Only)
entries: The mimic can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

trait.name: Grappler
entries: The mimic has advantage on attack rolls against any creature {@condition grappled} by it.

trait.name: False Appearance (Plant Form Only)
entries: If the mimic is motionless at the start of combat, it has advantage on its initiative roll. Moreover, if a creature hasn't observed the mimic move or act, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 20} Intelligence (Investigation) check to discern that the mimic isn't an ordinary object.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The mimic can climb on difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The mimic makes one Pseudopod attack and one Bite attack. It can replace its Bite attack with a use of Poison Burst.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) acid damage.

action.name: Pseudopod
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage and the target is pulled up to 5 feet towards the mimic. If the mimic is in plant form, the target is subjected to its Adhesive trait.

action.name: Poison Burst {@recharge 5}
entries: The mimic releases a burst of toxic gas in a 10-foot-radius around it. Each creature in the area must make a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw, taking 10 ({@damage 3d6}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

bonus.name: Change Shape
entries: The mimic polymorphs into a plant-based object or back into its true, amorphous form. Its statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

trait.name: Corrosive Acid
entries: The greenvise's acid damage is doubled against objects and structures.

trait.name: Mask of the Wild
entries: The greenvise can attempt to hide even when it is only lightly obscured by foliage.

trait.name: Stench Cloud
entries: The greenvise emits an {@condition invisible}, noxious gas in a 30-foot-radius around it. The gas spreads around corners. Whenever a creature starts its turn in the area, it must succeed on a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw or spend its action that turn retching and reeling. Creatures that don't need to breathe or are immune to poison automatically succeed on this saving throw. If a creature succeeds on its saving throw, the creature is immune to the Stench Cloud of all greenvises for 24 hours.

trait.name: Unusual Nature
entries: The greenvise doesn't require sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The greenvise makes either two Slam attacks and one Bite attack or two Acid Spittle attacks. It then uses Death Cloud, if available.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 2d10 + 7}) piercing damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) acid damage.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d6 + 7}) bludgeoning damage. Instead of dealing damage, the greenvise can grapple the target (escape {@dc 19}).

action.name: Acid Spittle
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 11} to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d8 + 7}) acid damage.

action.name: Swallow
entries: The greenvise makes one Bite attack against a Large or smaller target it is grappling. If the attack hits, the target is also swallowed, and the grapple ends. While swallowed, the target is {@condition blinded} and {@condition restrained}, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the greenvise, and it takes 21 ({@damage 6d6}) acid damage at the start of each of the greenvise's turns. A greenvise can have only one creature swallowed at a time.

If the greenvise takes 30 damage or more on a single turn from the swallowed creature, the greenvise must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate the creature, which falls {@condition prone} in a space within 10 feet of the greenvise. If the greenvise dies, a swallowed creature is no longer {@condition restrained} by it and can escape from the corpse by using 15 feet of movement, exiting {@condition prone}.

action.name: Death Cloud {@recharge 5}
entries: The greenvise exhales an acidic fog in a 30-foot cube. The fog spreads around corners and its area is heavily obscured. The vapors, being heavier than air, sink to the lowest level of the land, even pouring down openings. Whenever a creature enters the area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, it must make a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 21 ({@damage 6d6}) acid damage and becomes {@condition poisoned} until the start of its next turn. On a success, a creature takes half as much damage and is not {@condition poisoned}. The fog lasts until the end of the greenvise's next turn, whereupon it settles into harmless powder.

monster.name: Green Warder
languages: understands Common and Elvish but can't speak

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The green warder casts one of the following spells, using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 12}):

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: The green warder has advantage on saving throws to avoid or end the {@condition charmed} condition on itself.

trait.name: Mask of the Wild
entries: The green warder can attempt to hide even when they are only lightly obscured by foliage, heavy rain, falling snow, mist, and other natural phenomena.

trait.name: Unusual Nature
entries: The green warder doesn't require sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The green warder makes two Claw or Thorn Volley attacks.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Thorn Volley
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 2d4 + 3}) piercing damage.

bonus.name: Deafening Shriek {@recharge 5}
entries: The green warder lets out an earsplitting shriek that is audible out to 1 mile. Each other creature within 30 feet of the green warder that can hear the shriek must succeed on a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition deafened} until the start of the green warder's next turn.

monster.name: Guarian
languages: understands Common and Druidic but can't speak

trait.name: Aversion to Fire
entries: If the guarian takes fire damage, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks until the end of its next turn.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: If the guarian is motionless at the start of combat, it has advantage on its initiative roll. Moreover, if a creature hasn't observed the guarian move or act, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 15} Intelligence (Investigation) check to discern that the guarian isn't an ordinary cactus.

trait.name: Hazardous Body
entries: A creature that touches the guarian or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Silent Movement
entries: While moving, the guarian makes no sound unless it chooses to and it automatically succeeds on Dexterity (Stealth) checks that rely on moving silently.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The guarian makes two Slam attacks.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) piercing damage.

action.name: Syphon Moisture {@recharge 5}
entries: The guarian touches a creature or noncreature plant within 5 feet of it and attempts to draw the moisture out of its body. The target must make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw, taking 28 ({@damage 8d6}) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The guarian regains hit points equal to the damage dealt.
A Plant creature or nonliving plant makes the saving throw with disadvantage, and it takes the maximum possible damage.

monster.name: Guarian Hulk
languages: understands Common and Druidic but can't speak

trait.name: Aversion to Fire
entries: If the guarian takes fire damage, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks until the end of its next turn.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: If the guarian is motionless at the start of combat, it has advantage on its initiative roll. Moreover, if a creature hasn't observed the guarian move or act, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 15} Intelligence (Investigation) check to discern that the guarian isn't an ordinary cactus.

trait.name: Hazardous Body
entries: A creature that touches the guarian or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the guarian fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Silent Movement
entries: While moving, the guarian makes no sound unless it chooses to and it automatically succeeds on Dexterity (Stealth) checks that rely on moving silently.

trait.name: Thorny Wake
entries: Whenever the guarian walks through a space on the ground, it leaves behind a trail of thorns that last for 1 hour. While the thorns persist, their area is difficult terrain and when a creature other than a Guarian moves into or within the area, it takes 5 ({@damage 2d4}) piercing damage for every 5 feet it travels.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The guarian makes two Slam attacks or it uses Thorncast twice.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d8 + 7}) bludgeoning damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) piercing damage.

action.name: Thorncast
entries: The guarian sprays thorns in a 30-foot cone. Each creature caught in the area must make a {@dc 19} Dexterity saving throw, taking 17 ({@damage 3d6 + 7}) piercing damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Syphon Moisture {@recharge 5}
entries: The guarian draws the moisture from each creature and noncreature plant in a 30-foot cone. The target must make a {@dc 19} Constitution saving throw, taking 42 ({@damage 12d6}) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The guarian regains hit points equal to the damage rolled.
A Plant creature or nonliving plant makes the saving throw with disadvantage, and it takes the maximum possible damage.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The guarian moves up to half its speed.

legendary.name: Slam (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The guarian makes a Slam attack.

legendary.name: Thorncast (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The guarian uses Thorncast.

trait.name: Fire Ignition
entries: If a creature deals fire damage to the jabillo, it can immediately use its Spike Burst (no action required). If it's Spike Burst isn't recharged, it instead immediately recharges its Spike Burst.

trait.name: Fruit Regrowth
entries: The jabillo has twelve fruits to throw with its Hurl Fruit action. The jabillo regrows {@dice 1d4 + 2} fruits each time it finishes a long rest, up to a maximum of twelve.

trait.name: Hazardous Body
entries: A creature that touches the jabillo or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) piercing damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) poison damage.

trait.name: Sure-Footed
entries: The jabillo has advantage on Strength and Dexterity ability checks and saving throws made against effects that would push it or knock it {@condition prone}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The jabillo makes four Whip attacks or it uses Hurl Fruit twice.

action.name: Whip
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 2d4 + 3}) piercing damage plus 2 ({@damage 1d4}) poison damage. If the attack scores a critical hit, the target becomes {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. A creature {@condition poisoned} in this way becomes vulnerable to poison damage dealt by the jabillo. The creature can make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Hurl Fruit
entries: The jabillo launches an explosive fruit to a point that it can see within 120 feet of it. On impact, the fruit explodes, forcing each creature within 10 feet of it to make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw, taking 9 ({@damage 2d8}) piercing damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) thunder damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The explosion also emits a thunderous boom audible out to 300 feet.

action.name: Spike Burst {@recharge 5}
entries: The jabillo launches dozens of spikes from its body in a 30-foot-radius around it. Each other creature caught in the area must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw, taking 21 ({@damage 6d6}) piercing damage plus 21 ({@damage 6d6}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The explosion also emits a thunderous boom audible out to 500 feet.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: If the mantrap is motionless at the start of combat, it has advantage on its initiative roll. Moreover, if a creature hasn't observed the mantrap move or act, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 16} Intelligence (Investigation) check to discern that the mantrap isn't an ordinary tropical plant.

trait.name: Unusual Nature
entries: The mantrap doesn't require sleep.

action.name: Engulf
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one Medium or smaller target. {@h}The target is trapped inside the mantrap's leafy jaws. While trapped in this way, the target is {@condition blinded} and {@condition restrained}, has total cover from attacks and other effects outside the mantrap, and takes 14 ({@damage 4d6}) acid damage at the start of each of the target's turns. If the mantrap dies, the creature inside it is no longer {@condition restrained} by it. A mantrap can engulf only one creature at a time.

reaction.name: Hypnotising Pollen (1/Day)
entries: In response to a creature entering a space within 30 feet of the mantrap, if the mantrap can see that creature, it releases translucent pollen in a 30-foot-radius around it. Each Beast or Humanoid within the area that breathes in the pollen must succeed on a {@dc 12} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition charmed} by the mantrap for 1 minute. While {@condition charmed} in this way, a creature uses all its movement on each of its turns to get as close to the mantrap as possible. An affected target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: If the mantrap is motionless at the start of combat, it has advantage on its initiative roll. Moreover, if a creature hasn't observed the mantrap move or act, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 16} Intelligence (Investigation) check to discern that the mantrap isn't an ordinary tropical plant.

trait.name: Unusual Nature
entries: The mantrap doesn't require sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The mantrap makes three Tendril attacks, one of which it can replace with an Engulf attack.

action.name: Engulf
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one Large or smaller target. {@h}The target is trapped inside the mantrap's leafy jaws. While trapped in this way, the target is {@condition blinded} and {@condition restrained}, has total cover from attacks and other effects outside the mantrap, and takes 28 ({@damage 8d6}) acid damage at the start of each of the target's turns. If the mantrap dies, the creature inside it is no longer {@condition restrained} by it. A mantrap can Engulf only one creature at a time.

action.name: Tendril
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 30 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) slashing damage and the target is pulled 10 feet in a straight line towards the mantrap.

action.name: Shriek
entries: The mantrap lets off an uncannily human shrieking sound. Each creature within 60 feet of the mantrap that isn't {@condition charmed} by it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} of the mantrap for 1 minute. A creature has disadvantage on this saving throw if the mantrap is currently Engulfing a creature. An affected target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the mantraps's Shriek for the next 24 hours.

reaction.name: Hypnotising Pollen (Recharge 6)
entries: In response to a creature entering a space within 60 feet of the mantrap, if the mantrap can see that creature, it releases translucent pollen in a 60-foot-radius around it. Each Beast or Humanoid within the area that breathes in the pollen must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition charmed} by the mantrap for 1 minute. While {@condition charmed} in this way, a creature uses all its movement on each of its turns to get as close to the mantrap as possible. An affected target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

trait.name: Antilife Cone
entries: The witness' mouth creates an area of death magic that destroys all nonplants in a 150-foot cone. Whenever a non-Plant creature enters the cone for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, it must make a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw, taking 22 ({@damage 4d10}) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature killed by this damage has its body reduced to harmless vegetation.

At the start of each of its turns, the witness decides which way the cone faces and whether the cone is active. Any nonmagical object not made from living plant matter in the area that's not being worn or carried then takes 40 necrotic damage. An object reduced to 0 hit points by this damage is destroyed, its component parts transformed into harmless vegetation.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The witness makes three Tentacle attacks, each of which it can replace with one use of Fling, or it uses Eye Ray three times.

action.name: Tentacle
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 3d6 + 7}) bludgeoning damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 16}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}. The witness has ten tentacles, each of which can grapple one target.

action.name: Fling
entries: One Large or smaller object held or creature {@condition grappled} by the witness is thrown up to 30 feet in a direction of the witness' choice and knocked {@condition prone}. If a thrown target strikes a solid surface, the target takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) bludgeoning damage for every 10 feet it was thrown. If the target is thrown at another creature, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw or take the same damage and be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Eye Ray
entries: The witness shoots one of the following magical eye rays at random, choosing one target it can see within 120 feet of it. Once the witness has used one of its eye rays, it can't use that eye ray again until the end of the turn and if it rolls that eye ray again, it rerolls.

items.name: 1: Elemental Ray
entries: The target must succeed on a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw or take 36 ({@damage 8d8}) damage. Roll a {@dice d6} to determine the type of the damage dealt: 1, acid; 2, cold; 3, fire; 4, lightning; 5, poison; 6, thunder.

items.name: 2: Blooming Ray
entries: The witness replicates the effects of the {@spell entangle} spell ({@dc 16}) in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered around the target.

items.name: 3: Fear Ray
entries: The targeted creature must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

items.name: 4: Slowing Ray
entries: The targeted creature must succeed on a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the target's speed is halved for 1 minute. In addition, the creature can't take reactions, and it can take either an action or a bonus action on its turn, not both. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

items.name: 5: Withering Ray
entries: The targeted creature must make a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw, taking 28 ({@damage 8d6}) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Additionally, a creature that fails its saving throw gains one level of {@condition exhaustion}, which lasts for 1 minute.

items.name: 6: Radiant Ray
entries: The target must succeed on a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw or take 28 ({@damage 8d6}) radiant damage and become {@condition blinded} until the end of its next turn.

items.name: 7: Wretched Ray
entries: The targeted creature must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition poisoned} until the end of its next turn. A creature {@condition poisoned} in this way must spend its action on its turn retching and reeling.

items.name: 8: Petrification Ray
entries: The targeted creature must make a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature begins to turn to plant matter and is {@condition restrained}. It must repeat the saving throw at the end of its next turn. On a success, the effect ends. On a failure, the creature is {@condition petrified} until freed by the {@spell greater restoration} spell or other magic. When {@condition petrified} in this way, a creature's weight doesn't increase, it doesn't gain resistance to fire damage, and it doesn't gain immunity to poison.

legendary.name: Eye Ray
entries: The witness uses one random eye ray.

trait.name: Empathetic Link
entries: The defender can sense whenever a creature or a noncreature plant within 900 feet of the defender takes damage. If the defender is familiar with the creature that took the damage, the defender recognizes it.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: If the defender is motionless at the start of combat, it has advantage on its initiative roll. Moreover, if a creature hasn't observed the defender move or act, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 18} Intelligence (Investigation) check to discern that the defender isn't an ordinary clump of plant matter.

trait.name: Land's Stride
entries: Moving through nonmagical difficult terrain costs the defender no extra movement. It can also pass through nonmagical plants without being slowed by them and without taking damage from them if they have thorns, spines, or a similar hazard.
In addition, the defender has advantage on saving throws against plants that are magically created or manipulated to impede movement, such as those created by the {@spell entangle} spell.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The defender has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The defender regains 20 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point. If the defender takes fire damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the defender's next turn.

trait.name: Unusual Nature
entries: The defender doesn't require sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The defender makes two Slam attacks, and it uses Upheaval.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}24 ({@damage 3d10 + 8}) bludgeoning damage and the target must succeed on a {@dc 20} Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 10 feet away from the defender.

action.name: Upheaval
entries: The oaken defender creates a localized earthquake in a 30-foot-radius around it. Each creature on the ground in the area must make a {@dc 20} Strength saving throw or be pushed 20 feet into the air. Additionally, the ground in that area becomes difficult terrain until cleared. Each 5-foot-square portion of the area requires at least 1 minute to clear by hand.

trait.name: Creature Sense
entries: The obliviax is aware of the presence of creatures within 60 feet of it that have an Intelligence score of 4 or higher. It knows the distance and direction to each creature, as well as each creature's intelligence score, but can't sense anything else about it. A creature protected by a {@spell mind blank} spell, a {@spell nondetection} spell, or similar magic can't be perceived in this manner.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: If the obliviax is motionless on a floor, wall, or ceiling at the start of combat, it has advantage on its initiative roll. Moreover, if a creature hasn't observed the killer move or act, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 20} Intelligence (Investigation) check to discern that the killer isn't an ordinary patch of moss.

trait.name: Mossling Link
entries: The obliviax can see through the eyes of any of its mosslings within 100 feet of it and hear what they hear. It can also communicate telepathically with any or all of them within the same range.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The obliviax can climb on difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Unusual Nature
entries: The obliviax doesn't require sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The obliviax makes two Corroding Touch attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of Scour Mind.

action.name: Corroding Touch
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) acid damage. If the target is a creature or an object, it becomes coated with acid. Until a creature takes an action to wash off the acid, the target takes 9 ({@damage 2d8}) acid damage at the start of each of its turns.

action.name: Scour the Mind
entries: The obliviax psychically scrubs the mind of a creature that it can see within 60 feet of it. The target must make a {@dc 18} Intelligence saving throw. A creature protected by a {@spell mind blank} spell, a {@spell nondetection} spell, or similar magic succeeds on its saving throw automatically. On a failure, the target takes 28 ({@damage 8d6}) psychic damage and the obliviax can choose up to six creatures that it can see within 60 feet of it. Until the start of the obliviax's turn, each of those creatures are considered to be {@condition invisible} to the target. On a success, a creature takes half as much damage and is otherwise unaffected.

bonus.name: Steal Memories
entries: The obliviax attempts to steal the memories of a creature that it can see within 60 feet of it. The target must succeed on a {@dc 18} Wisdom saving throw or have part of its memory stolen. The obliviax can then choose one of the following options to affect the target with.

bonus.name: Steal Past
entries: The target forgets everything that has occurred within the last 24 hours.

bonus.name: Steal Spell
entries: The oblviax can choose one spell of 3rd level or lower that the target knows or has prepared. The target is considered to not know the chosen spell or have it prepared until it next finishes a long rest.

Regardless of the chosen option, the target becomes momentarily dazed. Until the start of the obliviax's next turn, the target's speed is halved, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks, and attack rolls made against it are made with advantage.

The obliviax then immediately creates a mossling duplicate of the target, which appears in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the obliviax. The mossling takes its turn immediately after the obliviax on the same initiative count and obeys the obliviax's commands.

reaction.name: Absorb Damage
entries: If a mossling under the obliviax's control within 60 feet of the obliviax would take damage, the obliviax can choose for the mossling to take no damage and for it to take psychic damage equal to the damage the mossling would have taken.

trait.name: Multiple Heads
entries: The hydra has five heads. While it has more than one head, the hydra has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, {@condition frightened}, {@condition stunned}, and knocked {@condition unconscious}.

Whenever the hydra takes 25 or more damage in a single turn, one of its heads dies. If all its heads die, the hydra dies. At the end of its turn, it grows two heads for each of its heads that died since its last turn, unless it has taken fire damage since its last turn. The hydra regains 10 hit points for each head regrown in this way.

trait.name: Reactive Heads
entries: For each head the hydra has beyond one, it gets an extra reaction that can be used only for opportunity attacks or using its Reaction Pollenation reaction.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The hydra can climb on difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Unusual Nature
entries: The hydra doesn't require sleep.

trait.name: Wakeful
entries: While the hydra sleeps, at least one of its heads is awake.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The hydra makes as many Bite attacks as it has heads, each of which it can replace with one use of Pollen Breath.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d10 + 5}) piercing damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) poison damage.

action.name: Pollen Breath
entries: The hydra exhales pollen from one of its heads in a 10-foot cone. The cone originates in a space the hydra can reach with its Bite. Each creature caught in the area must succeed on a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw or take 3 ({@damage 1d6}) poison damage at the start of each of its turns. Each time the target fails a saving throw against this action, the damage dealt increases by 3 ({@dice 1d6}). Any creature can take an action to touch the afflicted creature and neutralize the poison with a successful {@dc 12} Wisdom (Medicine) check. Any effect that cures a disease or neutralizes a poison also ends the effect.

reaction.name: Reactive Pollination
entries: Whenever a creature provokes an opportunity attack from the hydra, it can immediately use its Pollen Breath. When it uses Pollen Breath in this way, the phytohydra must target at least that creature.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The pumpkin casts one of the following spells, requiring no material using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 10}, {@hit 2} to hit with spell attacks):

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: If the pump-kin is motionless at the start of combat, it has advantage on its initiative roll. Moreover, if a creature hasn't observed the pump-kin move or act, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 18} Intelligence (Investigation) check to discern that the pump-kin isn't an ordinary pumpkin.

trait.name: Variable Illumination
entries: The pump-kin sheds bright light in a 5 to 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional number of ft. equal to the chosen radius. The pump-kin can alter the radius as a bonus action, snuffing or reigniting it.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The pump-kin makes two Vine attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of Spellcasting.

action.name: Vine
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Vine
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: If the pump-kin is motionless at the start of combat, it has advantage on its initiative roll. Moreover, if a creature hasn't observed the pump-kin move or act, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 18} Intelligence (Investigation) check to discern that the pump-kin isn't an ordinary pumpkin.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (1/Day)
entries: If the pump-king fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Variable Illumination
entries: The pump-king sheds bright light in a 5 to 30-foot radius and dim light for an additional number of ft. equal to the chosen radius. The pump-king can alter the radius as a bonus action, snuffing or reigniting it.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The pump-king makes two Vine attacks and one Bite attack. It can replace one attack with a use of Spellcasting.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d10 + 4}) piercing damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 15}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the pump-king can't Bite another target.

action.name: Vine
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The pump-king moves up to half its speed.

legendary.name: Thorn Whip
entries: The pump-king uses Spellcasting to cast {@spell thorn whip}.

legendary.name: Spit-Up (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: If the pump-king is grappling a creature with its Bite, it spits that creature up, hurling it in a straight line up to 30 feet in a direction of the pump- king's choice that is horizontal to it. The creature lands {@condition prone}, taking 3 ({@damage 1d6}) bludgeoning damage for every 10 feet it was thrown. A creature that obstructs the path of the hurled creature must succeed on a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, the obstructing creature takes an equal amount of damage and falls {@condition prone}, whilst the hurled creature lands in the nearest unoccupied space.
On a success, the hurled creature continues through the obstructing creature's space.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: If the tendriculos is motionless at the start of combat, it has advantage on its initiative roll. Moreover, if a creature hasn't observed the tendriculos move or act, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 18} Intelligence (Investigation) check to discern that the tendriculos isn't an ordinary bush.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The tendriculos regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn. If the tendriculos takes acid, this trait doesn't function at the start of the tendriculos's next turn. The tendriculos dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The tendriculos can climb on difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Unusual Nature
entries: The tendriculos doesn't require sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The tendriculos makes two Tendril attacks. It then either makes a Bite attack or it uses Grapple Smash twice.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d10 + 6}) piercing damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature {@condition grappled} by the tendriculos, that creature is swallowed, and the grapple ends. While swallowed, the creature is {@condition blinded} and {@condition restrained}, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the tendriculos, and it takes 14 ({@damage 4d6}) slashing damage at the start of each of the tendriculos's turns.

If the tendriculos takes 25 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the tendriculos must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall {@condition prone} in a space within 10 feet of the tendriculos. If the tendriculos dies, a swallowed creature is no longer {@condition restrained} by it and can escape from the corpse using 10 feet of movement, exiting {@condition prone}.

action.name: Tendril
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d6 + 6}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it is pulled up to 15 feet in a straight line towards the tendriculous and is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 17}). The tendriculos has two tendrils, each of which can grapple only one target.

action.name: Grapple Smash
entries: The tendriculos chooses one creature its grappling and pulls it high into the air, before smashing it back down into the ground in an unoccupied space the tendriculous can see within 15 feet of it. The target must make a {@dc 17} Strength saving throw, taking 10 ({@damage 3d6}) bludgeoning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Paralyzing Spores {@recharge 5}
entries: The tendriculous releases a burst of paralytic spores in a 15-foot-radius around it. The spores spread around corners. Each creature caught in the area other than the tendriculos must succeed on a {@dc 11} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. A creature {@condition poisoned} this way is {@condition paralyzed}. A target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

trait.name: Featherweight
entries: When the thistling falls, its rate of descent is 60 feet per round. When it lands, it takes no falling damage and can land on its feet.

trait.name: Hazardous Body
entries: A creature that touches the thistling or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 2 ({@damage 1d4}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Speak with Beasts and Plants
entries: The thistling can speak with Beasts and Plants as if it shared a language with them.

entries: The treant magically animates one or two trees it can see within 60 feet of it. These trees use the treant statblock, except they have Intelligence and Charisma scores of 1, they can't speak, and they have only the Slam action option. An animated tree takes its turn immediately after the silvertongue on the same initiative count and acts as an ally of the treant. The tree remains animate for 1 day or until it dies; until the treant dies or is more than 120 feet from the tree; or until the treant takes a bonus action to turn it back into an inanimate tree. The tree then takes root if possible.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: If the treant is motionless at the start of combat, it has advantage on its initiative roll. Moreover, if a creature hasn't observed the treant move or act, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 18} Intelligence (Investigation) check to discern that the treant isn't an ordinary tree.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: The treant deals double damage to objects and structures.

trait.name: Speak with Animals
entries: The treant can speak with Beasts as if they shared a language.

trait.name: Susceptibility to Fire
entries: Whenever the treant takes fire damage, it takes the maximum possible damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The treant makes two Grasping Roots or Slam attacks.

action.name: Grasping Roots
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 20 ft., one creature not {@condition grappled} by the treant. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 18}). Until the grapple ends, the target takes 16 ({@damage 3d6 + 6}) bludgeoning damage at the start of each of its turns. The root has AC 16 and 15 hit points. Cutting the root doesn't hurt the treant, but ends the grapple.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}20 ({@damage 4d6 + 6}) bludgeoning damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage and the target is pushed up to 10 feet in a straight line away from the treant.

action.name: Rock
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 10} to hit, range 60/180 ft., one target. {@h}33 ({@damage 5d10 + 6}) bludgeoning damage.

bonus.name: Spawn Swarm (5/Day)
entries: The treant commands a swarm of wasps inside its body to attack, which appear in a space within 10 feet of itself. The swarm takes its turn immediately after the treant on the same initiative count and obeys the treant's commands. The swarm disperses when the treant dies.

reaction.name: Stinging Protection
entries: In response to being dealt damage by a creature within 10 feet of it, the insects inside the treant lash out at the attacker. Melee Weapon Attack: {@hit 10} to hit, reach 10 ft., the attacking creature. {@h}10 ({@damage 4d4}) piercing damage, or 5 ({@damage 2d4}) piercing damage if the treant has half of its hit points or fewer.

trait.name: Featherweight
entries: The tumblethorn is immune to falling damage.

trait.name: Flammable
entries: If the tumblethorn takes fire damage, it ignites, taking 3 ({@damage 1d6}) fire damage at the start of each of its turns. An ignited tumblethorn ignites any flammable object it touches that isn't being worn or carried and a creature that touches the tumblethorn or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) fire damage

trait.name: Standing Leap
entries: The tumblethorn's long jump is up to 30 feet and its high jump is up to 20 feet, without a running start.

trait.name: Unusual Nature
entries: The tumblethorn doesn't require sleep.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d4 + 5}) slashing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned}. A {@condition poisoned} creature takes 2 ({@damage 1d4}) poison damage at the start of each of its turns as tumblethorn seeds infest its body. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. Any effect that cures disease or removes the {@condition poisoned} condition instantly kills the seeds in the creature, ending the effect on it.

If the creature dies while infested, the seeds remain in the corpse, with {@dice 1d4} of them surviving and becoming fully grown tumblethorns in {@dice 1d6} days. Any effect that cures disease or removes the {@condition poisoned} condition that targets the corpse instantly kills the seeds in the creature.

trait.name: Featherweight
entries: The tumblethorn is immune to falling damage.

trait.name: Fire Absorption
entries: Whenever the tumblethorn is subjected to fire damage, it takes no damage and instead regains a number of hit points equal to the fire damage dealt.

trait.name: Flammable
entries: If the tumblethorn takes fire damage, it ignites, taking 3 ({@damage 1d6}) fire damage at the start of each of its turns. An ignited tumblethorn ignites any flammable object it touches that isn't being worn or carried and a creature that touches the tumblethorn or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) fire damage

trait.name: Standing Leap
entries: The tumblethorn's long jump is up to 30 feet and its high jump is up to 20 feet, without a running start.

trait.name: Unusual Nature
entries: The tumblethorn doesn't require sleep.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d4 + 5}) slashing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned}. A {@condition poisoned} creature takes 2 ({@damage 1d4}) poison damage at the start of each of its turns as tumblethorn seeds infest its body. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. Any effect that cures disease or removes the {@condition poisoned} condition instantly kills the seeds in the creature, ending the effect on it.

If the creature dies while infested, the seeds remain in the corpse, with {@dice 1d4} of them surviving and becoming fully grown tumblethorns in {@dice 1d6} days. Any effect that cures disease or removes the {@condition poisoned} condition that targets the corpse instantly kills the seeds in the creature.

trait.name: Forest Camouflage
entries: The vinespawn has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in forested terrain.

trait.name: Susceptibility to Fire
entries: Whenever the vinespawn takes fire damage, it takes the maximum possible damage.

trait.name: Unusual Nature
entries: The vinespawn doesn't require sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The vinespawn makes two Vine attacks. If both attacks hit a Medium or smaller target, the target is pulled up to 5 feet towards the vinespawn, it's {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 14}), and the vinespawn can use its Engulf on it. The vinespawn can replace one Vine attack with a Vine Net attack.

action.name: Vine
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Vine Net
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 10/30 ft., one target. {@h}The target is {@condition restrained} by vines. As an action, the {@condition restrained} target can make a {@dc 14} Strength check, bursting the vines on a success. The vines can also be attacked and destroyed (AC 13; 10 hit points; vulnerability to fire damage; immunity to bludgeoning, poison, and psychic damage).

action.name: Engulf
entries: The vinespawn engulfs a Medium or smaller creature {@condition grappled} by it. The engulfed target is {@condition blinded}, {@condition restrained}, and unable to breathe, and at the start of each of the vinespawn's turns, the vinespawn can force the target to make a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw. The creature takes 8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage on a failed save. If the vinespawn moves, the engulfed target moves with it. The vinespawn can have only one creature engulfed at a time.

bonus.name: Spawning Root
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 0 ft., one creature engulfed by the vinespawn. {@h}The vinespawn inserts a spawning root through the mouth and into the stomach of the target. While the target has a spawning root inside of it, it doesn't need air, food, or drink, and for every 24 hours it spends with a spawning root inside of it, it gains 1 level of {@condition exhaustion}, as vines sprout throughout its body. If a creature dies from {@condition exhaustion} gained this way, it rises as a new vinespawn after 1 day. Exhaustion gained this way can't be lost until the target is freed from the spawning root and it comes under an effect that cures diseases.

trait.name: Land's Stride
entries: Moving through nonmagical difficult terrain costs the wood woad no extra movement. It can also pass through nonmagical plants without being slowed by them and without taking damage from them if they have thorns, spines, or a similar hazard.
In addition, the wood woad has advantage on saving throws against plants that are magically created or manipulated to impede movement, such as those created by the {@spell entangle} spell.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The wood woad's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Plant Camouflage
entries: The wood woad has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks it makes in any terrain with ample obscuring vegetation.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The wood woad regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn if it is in contact with the ground. If the wood woad takes fire damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the wood woad's next turn. The wood woad dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

trait.name: Susceptibility to Fire
entries: Whenever the wood woad takes fire damage, it takes the maximum possible damage.

trait.name: Tree Stride
entries: Once on each of its turns, the wood woad can use 10 feet of its movement to step magically into one living tree within 5 feet of it and emerge from a second living tree within 60 feet of it that it can see, appearing in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the second tree. Both trees must be Large or bigger.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The wood woad makes two Club attacks.

action.name: Club
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) bludgeoning damage plus 7 ({@damage 3d4}) force damage.

action.name: Naturalizing Curse (1/Day)
entries: The wood woad stares at a creature that it can see within 30 feet of it, magically willing nature to overtake its body. If the target is able to see the wood woad's eyes, it must make a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw against being magically {@condition petrified}. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the creature is instantly {@condition petrified}. Otherwise, the creature begins to turn to plant matter and is {@condition restrained}. It must repeat the saving throw at the end of its next turn, becoming {@condition petrified} on a failure or ending the effect on a success.
The petrification lasts for 1 hour, though a {@spell remove curse} spell ends it early.
When {@condition petrified} in this way, a creature's weight doesn't increase, it doesn't gain resistance to fire damage, and it doesn't gain immunity to poison.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The wood woad casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 12}, {@hit 4} to hit with spell attacks):

trait.name: Land's Stride
entries: Moving through nonmagical difficult terrain costs the wood woad no extra movement. It can also pass through nonmagical plants without being slowed by them and without taking damage from them if they have thorns, spines, or a similar hazard.
In addition, the wood woad has advantage on saving throws against plants that are magically created or manipulated to impede movement, such as those created by the {@spell entangle} spell.

If the wood woad takes fire damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the wood woad's next turn. The wood woad dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

entries: Whenever the wood woad takes fire damage, it takes the maximum possible damage.

Both trees must be Large or bigger.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The wood woad makes two Club attacks. It can replace one attack with a single use of Spellcasting.

action.name: Club
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) bludgeoning damage plus 7 ({@damage 3d4}) force damage.

entries: The wood woad stares at a creature that it can see within 30 feet of it, magically willing nature to overtake its body. If the target is able to see the wood woad's eyes, it must make a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw against being magically {@condition petrified}. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the creature is instantly {@condition petrified}. Otherwise, the creature begins to turn to plant matter and is {@condition restrained}. It must repeat the saving throw at the end of its next turn, becoming {@condition petrified} on a failure or ending the effect on a success.
The petrification lasts for 1 hour, though a {@spell remove curse} spell ends it early.
When {@condition petrified} in this way, a creature's weight doesn't increase, it doesn't gain resistance to fire damage, and it doesn't gain immunity to poison.

trait.name: Climber
entries: The ape has advantage on Strength (Athletics) checks made to climb difficult surfaces.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The ape makes two Fist attacks.

action.name: Fist
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Bodily Rejuvenation
entries: If the axolotl loses any body parts (including organs), those missing body parts regrow and are restored after 40 days.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The axolotl has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Limited Amphibiousness
entries: The axolotl can breathe air and water, but needs to be submerged in the fresh water at least once an hour for 1 minute to avoid suffocating.

trait.name: Climber
entries: The baboon has advantage on Strength (Athletics) checks made to climb difficult surfaces.

trait.name: Running Leap
entries: With a 10-foot running start, the baboon can long jump up to 20 feet and high jump up to 10 feet.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 1} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}1 ({@damage 1d4 - 1}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Charge
entries: If the boar moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a tusk attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 3 ({@damage 1d6}) slashing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 11} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The boar has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Relentless (Recharges after a Short or Long rest)
entries: If the boar takes 7 damage or less that would reduce it to 0 hit points, it is reduced to 1 hit point instead.

action.name: Tusk
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) slashing damage.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The bear has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The bear makes two attacks: one with its Bite and one with its Claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) slashing damage.

trait.name: Environmental Adaptation
entries: The camel is naturally adapted to hot climates.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}2 ({@damage 1d4}) bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Ambusher
entries: In the first round of a combat, the cat has advantage on attack rolls against any creature it surprised.

trait.name: Cat's Grace
entries: When the cat falls, if it falls 20 feet or less and is not {@condition incapacitated}, it takes no falling damage and can land on its feet.

trait.name: Keen Sight & Smell
entries: The cat has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight or smell.

trait.name: Standing Leap
entries: The cat's long jump is up to 10 feet and its high jump is up to 5 feet, with or without a running start.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}1 slashing damage.

trait.name: Dextrous Climber
entries: The chameleon uses Dexterity (Acrobatics), rather than Strength (Athletics), to climb difficult surfaces.

trait.name: Keen Sight
entries: The chameleon has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

action.name: Tongue
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}If the target is Tiny, it must succeed on a {@dc 8} Strength saving throw or be {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 8}).

action.name: Camouflage
entries: The chameleon camouflages itself with its surroundings, becoming {@condition invisible}. The invisibility ends for the chameleon after it leaves its space or attacks.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The chicken has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Limited Flight
entries: If the chicken ends its turn flying, it stops flying and it falls. When the chicken falls in this way, its flying speed is 0 until it lands, its rate of descent is 60 feet per round, and when it lands, it takes no falling damage and can land on its feet.

entries: The crab can breathe air and water, but needs to be submerged in water at least once a day for 1 minute to avoid suffocating.

trait.name: Hold Breath

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
entries: The crocodile has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

action.name: Death Roll
entries: The crocodile rolls in place, dealing 13 ({@damage 2d10 + 2}) piercing damage to any creature it's grappling. The crocodile can't take this action if its speed is 0.

entries: The dog has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the dog's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

action.name: Bite

trait.name: Hold Breath
entries: The dolphin can hold its breath for 20 minutes.

trait.name: Keen Hearing
entries: The dolphin has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing.

trait.name: Wakeful
entries: While the dolphin sleeps, it is aware of its surroundings and can move at half speed.

trait.name: Water-Based Echolocation
entries: The dolphin can't use its blindsight while {@condition deafened} or outside of water.
Additionally, the dolphin can't use its blindsight to see into a space not submersed in water.

On a failed save, a creature takes 2 ({@damage 1d4}) lightning damage and becomes {@condition paralyzed} until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and is not {@condition paralyzed}.

trait.name: Grappler
entries: The crocodile has advantage on attack rolls against any creature {@condition grappled} by it.

trait.name: Hold Breath
entries: The crocodile can hold its breath for 30 minutes.

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
entries: The crocodile has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The crocodile makes two attacks: one with its Bite and one with its Tail. It can replace one attack with a use of Death Roll.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}21 ({@damage 3d10 + 5}) piercing damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 16}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the crocodile can't bite another target.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target not {@condition grappled} by the crocodile. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Death Roll
entries: The crocodile rolls in place, dealing 27 ({@damage 4d10 + 5}) piercing damage to any creature it's grappling. The crocodile can't take this action if its speed is 0.

trait.name: Ambusher
entries: In the first round of a combat, the eel has advantage on attack rolls against any creature it surprised.

trait.name: Hazardous Body
entries: A creature that touches the eel or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) lightning damage.

trait.name: Water Breathing
entries: The eel can breathe only water.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The eel makes two attacks: one with its Constrict and one with its Bite. It then uses Shock, if available.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Constrict
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 13}). Until this grapple ends, the creature is {@condition restrained}, and the eel can't constrict another target.

action.name: Shock {@recharge}
entries: The eel electrocutes a creature within 10 feet of it. The target must make a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 10 ({@damage 4d4}) lightning damage and becomes {@condition paralyzed} until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and is not {@condition paralyzed}.

entries: The frog can breathe air and water, but needs to be submerged in the fresh water at least once a day for 1 minute to avoid suffocating.

entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) piercing damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 11}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the frog can't bite another target.

action.name: Swallow
entries: The frog makes one bite attack against a Small or smaller target it is grappling. If the attack hits, the target is swallowed, and the grapple ends. The swallowed target is {@condition blinded} and {@condition restrained}, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the frog, and it takes 5 ({@damage 2d4}) acid damage at the start of each of the frog's turns. The frog can have only one target swallowed at a time.
If the frog dies, a swallowed creature is no longer {@condition restrained} by it and can escape from the corpse using 5 feet of movement, exiting {@condition prone}.

If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw or be swallowed by the turtle. A swallowed creature has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the turtle, and it takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) acid damage at the start of each of the turtle's turns.
