action.name: Shell Defence
entries: The tortoise withdraws into its shell. Until it emerges, it gains a +4 bonus to AC and has advantage on Strength and Constitution saving throws. While in its shell, the tortoise is {@condition prone}, its speed is 0 and can't increase, it has disadvantage on Dexterity saving throws, it can't take reactions, and the only action it can take is a bonus action to emerge.

If the rhinoceros moved at least 20 feet straight toward the target immediately before the hit, the target takes an extra 9 ({@damage 2d8}) bludgeoning damage, then if it's a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

If the target is {@condition prone}, the tiger can make one bite attack against it as a bonus action.

trait.name: Environmental Adaptation
entries: The whale is naturally adapted to cold climates.

trait.name: Hold Breath
entries: The whale can hold its breath for 90 minutes.

trait.name: Keen Hearing
entries: The whale has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing.

trait.name: Water-Based Echolocation
entries: The whale can't use its blindsight while {@condition deafened} or outside of water.
Additionally, the whale can't use its blindsight to see into a space not submersed in water.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The whale makes two attacks: one with its Bite and one with its Tail.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}21 ({@damage 3d8 + 8}) piercing damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw or be swallowed by the whale. A swallowed creature has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the whale, and it takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) acid damage at the start of each of the whale's turns. If the whale takes 30 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the whale must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall {@condition prone} in a space within 10 feet of the whale. If the whale dies, a swallowed creature can escape from the corpse by using 20 feet of movement, exiting {@condition prone}.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 3d6 + 8}) bludgeoning damage, or 37 ({@damage 6d6 + 16}) bludgeoning damage if the target is an object.

entries: The tortoise has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Prone Deficiency
entries: If the tortoise is knocked {@condition prone}, roll a die. On an odd result, the tortoise lands upside-down and is {@condition incapacitated}. At the end of each of its turns, the tortoise can make a {@dc 10} Dexterity saving throw, righting itself and ending the {@condition incapacitated} condition if it succeeds.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 1} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}1 piercing damage.

action.name: Shell Defence
entries: The tortoise withdraws into its shell. Until it emerges, it gains a +4 bonus to AC and has advantage on Strength and Constitution saving throws. While in its shell, the tortoise is {@condition prone}, its speed is 0 and can't increase, it has disadvantage on Dexterity saving throws, it can't take reactions, and the only action it can take is a bonus action to emerge.

resist.note: from nonmagical attacks that aren't silvered

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The angel has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The angel regains 25 hit points at the start of its turn. If the angel takes radiant damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the angel's next turn. The angel dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

trait.name: Rotting Aura
entries: The angel constantly exudes rivulets of vile corruption in a 15-foot-radius around it. The area spreads around corners. Whenever a creature other than a Construct or an Undead starts its turn in the area, it must make a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 14 ({@damage 4d6}) necrotic damage and is {@condition poisoned} until the start of its next turn. On a success, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't {@condition poisoned}.

trait.name: Turn Resistance
entries: The angel has advantage on saving throws against any effect that turns undead.

trait.name: Unholy Weapons
entries: The angel's weapon attacks are magical. When the angel hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra {@damage 2d8} radiant damage (included in the attack).

trait.name: Undead Nature
entries: The angel doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The angel makes two Claw or Necrotic Bolt attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of Enfeebling Gaze or Wings.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d8 + 7}) slashing damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) necrotic damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw or begin to rot.

A rotting creature has disadvantage on saving throws made against the angel's Rotting Aura and takes 9 ({@damage 2d8}) necrotic damage at the start of each of its turns. It can repeat its saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. Any effect that cures disease also ends the rot. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature succeeds on all further saving throws against this effect for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Necrotic Bolt
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 12} to hit, range 60 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d8 + 7}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Enfeebling Gaze
entries: The angel sends out body-sapping energy from its eyes in a 15-foot cone. Each creature caught in the area that can see the angel's eyes must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or become enfeebled until the start of the angel's next turn. During this time, the creature has disadvantage on attack rolls and deals only half damage with weapon attacks that use Strength or Dexterity until the spell ends.

action.name: Wings
entries: The angel beats its wings, sending out a wave of necrotic energy in a 10-foot-radius around it. Each creature in the area must make a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 9 ({@damage 2d8}) necrotic damage and is knocked {@condition prone}. On a success, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't knocked {@condition prone}. Provided it's flying speed isn't 0, the angel can fly up to 10 feet either immediately before or after making this attack.

monster.name: Atropal
languages: understands Celestial but can speak only falteringly

trait.name: Aversion to Radiant
entries: If the atropal takes radiant damage, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks until the end of its next turn.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the atropal fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The atropal has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Negative Energy Aura
entries: Other creatures within 30 feet of the atropal can't regain hit points, and any creature that starts its turn within 30 feet of the atropal takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) necrotic damage. If the atropal is struck by a vorpal sword or a critical hit from a weapon attack that deals slashing damage, the wielder can cut the atropal's umbilical cord instead of dealing damage. If its umbilical cord is cut, the atropal loses this feature.

trait.name: Turn Defiance
entries: The atropal and any other undead creature within 30 feet of it has advantage on saving throws against any effect that turns undead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The atropal makes two Necrotic Touch or Ray of Cold attacks and it then uses Life Drain.

action.name: Necrotic Touch
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 1d10 + 7}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Ray of Cold
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 120 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d6 + 7}) cold damage.

action.name: Life Drain
entries: The atropal targets one creature it can see within 120 feet of it. The target must make a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw, taking 36 ({@damage 8d8}) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The atropal regains a number of hit points equal to the damage dealt.

bonus.name: Summon Wraith {@recharge}
entries: The atropal magically summons a wraith, which appears in an unoccupied space the atropal can see within 60 feet of itself. The wraith takes its turn immediately after the atropal on the same initiative count and obeys the wraith's commands. The earth elemental disappears after 1 minute or when it or the atropal dies.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: The atropal makes a Necrotic Touch or Ray of Cold attack.

legendary.name: Encroaching Death (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The atropal releases a wave of life-draining energy in a 30-foot-radius around it.

Each non-Undead creature caught in the area that's missing hit points must make a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw. A creature takes 11 ({@damage 2d10}) necrotic damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the target's hit point maximum is then reduced to an amount equal to its current hit points. This reduction lasts until cured by a {@spell remove curse} spell or similar magic. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

legendary.name: Wail (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The atropal lets out a withering wail.
Any creature within 120 feet of the atropal that can hear the wail must succeed on a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw or gain 1 level of {@condition exhaustion}.

trait.name: Detect Life
entries: The banshee can magically sense the presence of living creatures up to 5 miles away that aren't Undead or Constructs. She knows the general direction they're in but not their exact locations.

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The banshee can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. She takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if she ends her turn inside an object.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (2/Day)
entries: If the banshee fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Turn Defiance
entries: The banshee and any other Apparitions within 30 feet of her have advantage on saving throws against effects that turn Undead.

trait.name: Undead Nature
entries: The banshee doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The banshee can use her Horrifying Visage. She then makes two Corrupting Touch attacks.

action.name: Corrupting Touch
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Horrifying Visage
entries: Each non-Undead creature within 60 feet of the banshee that can see her must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A {@condition frightened} target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, with disadvantage if the banshee is within line of sight, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a target's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the target is immune to the banshee's Horrifying Visage for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Wail (1/Day)
entries: The banshee releases a mournful wail, provided that she isn't in sunlight. This wail has no effect on constructs and undead. All other creatures within 30 feet of her that can hear her must make a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw. On a failure, a creature drops to 0 hit points. On a success, a creature takes 28 ({@damage 8d6}) psychic damage.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: The banshee makes a Corrupting Touch attack.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The banshee moves up to her speed, without provoking opportunity attacks.

trait.name: Blood Scent
entries: The blackskate can automatically smell creatures within 1,000 feet of it that doesn't have all its hit points and that has blood. It knows the distance and direction to each creature, as well as each creature's current hit points, but can't sense anything else about it. A creature protected by a {@spell pass without trace} spell or similar magic can't be perceived in this manner.

trait.name: Blood Frenzy
entries: The blackskate has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all its hit points.

trait.name: Undead Nature
entries: The blackskate doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The blackskate makes a Bite attack and a Sting attack. It can't make both attacks against the same target.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 14}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the blackskate can't Bite another target.

action.name: Sting
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) piercing damage, and the target must make a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw, taking 16 ({@damage 3d10}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

A creature protected by a {@spell pass without trace} spell or similar magic can't be perceived in this manner.

entries: The blackskate has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all its hit points.

trait.name: Undead Nature
entries: The blackskate doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The blackskate can use Deathly Darkness, if available. It then makes a Bite attack and a Sting attack. It can't make both attacks against the same target.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 1d10 + 6}) piercing damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 18}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the blackskate can't Bite another target.

action.name: Sting
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 1d12 + 6}) piercing damage, and the target must make a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw, taking 22 ({@damage 4d10}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Deathly Darkness {@recharge 5}
entries: The blackskate exhales magical darkness in a 60-foot cone. The darkness spreads around corners and lasts until the start of the blackskate's next turn. A creature with darkvision, except a blackskate, can't see through this darkness, and nonmagical light can't illuminate it. Whenever a creature enters the darkness for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, it must make a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw, taking 11 ({@damage 2d10}) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Merciless Critical
entries: The bonedrinker's Bite and Claw attacks score a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The bonedrinker can climb on difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Undead Fortitude
entries: If damage reduces the bonedrinker to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the bonedrinker drops to 1 hit point instead.

trait.name: Undead Nature
entries: The bonedrinker doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The bonedrinker makes two Claw attacks and one Bite attack.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature other than an Undead or Construct, the target loses 2 ({@dice 1d4}) hit points at the start of each of its turns due to a bleeding wound. Each time the bonedrinker hits the target with another Bite attack thereafter, the damage dealt by the wound increases by 2 ({@dice 1d4}). Any creature can take an action to stanch the wound with a successful {@dc 10} Wisdom (Medicine) check. The wound also closes if the target receives magical healing.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) slashing damage. Instead of dealing damage, the bonedrinker can grapple the target (escape {@dc 13}). If the bonedrinker moved at least 20 feet straight toward the target immediately before the hit, the target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If the target is {@condition prone}, the bonedrinker can immediately use Drink Bones on it as a bonus action.

action.name: Drink Bones
entries: The bonedrinker makes a Bite attack against a creature it's grappling. On a hit, the bonedrinker sucks out some of the target's bone marrow, reducing its Constitution score by {@dice 1d4}. The target dies if this reduces its Constitution to 0. Otherwise, the reduction lasts for 7 days. A greater restoration or {@spell regenerate} spell ends the reduction early. The bonedrinker then regains hit points equal to the damage dealt by the attack.

monster.name: Burning Memory
languages: understands all languages it knew in life but can't speak

trait.name: Fire Form
entries: A creature that touches the memory or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) fire damage. In addition, the first time the memory enters a creature's space on a turn, that creature takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) fire damage and catches fire; until someone takes an action to douse the fire, the creature takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) fire damage at the start of each of its turns.

trait.name: Illumination
entries: The memory sheds bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light in an additional 30 feet.

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The memory can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Weakness to the Past
entries: If the memory starts its turn able to see an important creature, image, or object from its past within 30 feet of it, such as a noteworthy personal item, a loved one, or an illusion depicting an notable moment from its life, it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} of the creature, image, or object until the start of its next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The memory makes two Touch attacks and uses Searing Remembrance.

action.name: Touch
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) fire damage. If the target is a creature or a flammable object, it ignites. Until a creature takes an action to douse the fire, the target takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) fire damage at the start of each of its turns.

action.name: Searing Remembrance
entries: The memory forces its agony onto each ignited creature within 60 feet of it. Each target must make a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw, taking 5 ({@damage 1d10}) fire damage plus 5 ({@damage 1d10}) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

monster.name: Caller in Darkness
languages: understands all languages it knew in life but speaks only unintelligible gibberish

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting (Psionics)
headerEntries: The caller in darkness casts one of the following spells, requiring no components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 15}, {@hit 7} to hit with spell attacks):

trait.name: Incorporation Movement
entries: The caller in darkness can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, the caller in darkness has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Undead Nature
entries: The caller in darkness doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The caller in darkness makes two Maddening Touch attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of Steal Essence, Spellcasting, or Mindshriek, if available.

action.name: Maddening Touch
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 4d6 + 3}) psychic damage.

action.name: Steal Essence
entries: The caller in darkness drains the mind of a creature within 10 feet of it. If the target is dead and has been dead no longer than 1 minute, the last vestiges of its dying consciousness are absorbed. If the target is alive, it must make a {@dc 15} Intelligence saving throw. An {@condition incapacitated} creature fails this saving throw automatically. On a failure, the creature takes 28 ({@damage 8d6}) psychic damage and its Intelligence score is reduced by {@dice 1d4}. The target dies if this reduces its Intelligence to 0, as the caller in darkness devours its consciousness. Otherwise, the reduction lasts until the target finishes a short or long rest. On a success, the creature takes half as much damage and its Intelligence is unaffected.

If the caller in darkness absorbs a creature's consciousness, it gains 20 temporary hit points and the face of the creature whose consciousness was absorbed appears somewhere on the caller in darkness' body. A creature whose consciousness has been absorbed by the caller in darkness can't be resurrected by any means short of the {@spell wish} spell for as long as the caller in darkness lives.

action.name: Mindshriek {@recharge 5}
entries: The caller in darkness unleashes a nightmarish scream of pain audible up to 300 feet. Each creature within 60 feet of the caller in darkness that hears the scream must make a {@dc 15} Intelligence saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 27 ({@damage 6d8}) psychic damage and becomes {@condition stunned} until the end of the caller in darkness' next turn. On a success, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't {@condition stunned}.

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
entries: The charnel hound has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, the charnel hound has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Undead Fortitude
entries: If damage reduces the charnel hound to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the charnel hound drops to 1 hit point instead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The charnel hound can use Frightful Presence. It then makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks. If both Claw attacks hit the same target, the charnel hound can use Rend on that creature.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}23 ({@damage 3d10 + 7}) piercing damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature {@condition grappled} by the charnel hound, that creature is swallowed, and the grapple ends. While swallowed, the creature is {@condition blinded} and {@condition restrained}, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the charnel hound, and it takes 35 ({@damage 10d6}) necrotic damage at the start of each of the charnel hound's turns. If the charnel hound takes 50 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the kraken must succeed on a {@dc 25} Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall {@condition prone} in a space within 10 feet of the charnel hound. If the charnel hound dies, a swallowed creature is no longer {@condition restrained} by it and can escape from the corpse using 15 feet of movement, exiting {@condition prone}.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d8 + 7}) slashing damage.

action.name: Horrifying Visage (1/Day)
entries: Each non-Undead creature within 60 feet of the charnel hound that can see it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A {@condition frightened} target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, with disadvantage if the charnel hound is within line of sight, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a target's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the target is immune to the charnel hound's Horrifying Visage for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Rend
entries: The charnel hound rips into a creature within 10 feet of it. The target must make a {@dc 20} Dexterity saving throw, taking 27 ({@dice 5d8 + 5}) slashing on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one. Unless the target is a Construct or Undead, the charnel hound then regains hit points equal to the damage dealt.

bonus.name: Animate Corpses
entries: The charnel hound loses 50 hit points as it drops chunks of flesh from its body. It then animates that flesh as either fifteen decrepit zombies, seven zombies or three dire zombies (its choice). The Zombies rise from the flesh in unoccupied spaces within 15 feet of the charnel hound. The Zombies take their turns immediately after the charnel hound on the same initiative count and obeys the charnel hound's commands.

trait.name: Death Rattle
entries: When the deathshrieker dies, it lets out a bloodcurdling scream that is audible out to 1 mile. Each non-Construct, non-Undead creature within 300 feet of the deathshrieker that hears its scream must make a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 28 ({@damage 8d6}) psychic damage and is {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn. On a success, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't {@condition stunned}.

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The deathshrieker can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Mimicry
entries: The deathshrieker can mimic the voices of creature's its heard, particularly their screams. A creature that hears the sounds can tell they are imitations with a successful {@dc 16} Wisdom (Insight) check.

trait.name: Weakness to Silence
entries: To enter an area affected by the {@spell silence} spell, the deathshrieker must first make a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw. On a success, it can enter the area unimpeded. On a failure, it can't enter the spell's area and it can't attempt to do so again until the start of its next turn.
Additionally, whenever the deathshrieker enters the area of a {@spell silence} spell for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, it takes 33 ({@damage 6d10}) psychic damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The deathshrieker can use Horrifying Visage, if available. It then makes two Touch of Death attacks.

action.name: Touch of Death
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}23 ({@damage 4d8 + 5}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Horrifying Visage (1/Day)
entries: Each non-Undead creature within 60 feet of the deathshrieker that can see it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A {@condition frightened} target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, with disadvantage if the deathshrieker is within line of sight, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a target's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the target is immune to the deathshrieker's Horrifying Visage for the next 24 hours.

bonus.name: Screams of the Dying
entries: The deathshrieker begins emitting the screams of the damned that's audible out to 300 feet. Whenever a non-Construct, non-Undead creature starts its turn able to hear the screaming, it must make a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 14 ({@damage 4d6}) psychic damage plus 14 ({@damage 4d6}) thunder damage and it suffers disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks until the start of its next turn. On a success, a creature takes half as much damage and suffers no disadvantage.

If the target succeeds on three saving throws within 1 minute, it's immune to the deathshrieker's Screams of the Dying for the next 24 hours. If the target fails on three saving throws within 1 minute, it instantly dies.
The deathshrieker must take a bonus action on its subsequent turns to continue screaming. It can stop screaming at any time. The song ends if the deathshrieker is {@condition incapacitated}.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The death shepherd casts one of the following spells, using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 14}):

trait.name: Aura of Undeath
entries: While it's not {@condition incapacitated}, the death shepherd emits an aura of undead power in a 30-foot-radius around it. Other Undead creatures in the area that are allied to the death shepherd have resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.

trait.name: Fell Weapons
entries: The death shepherd's weapon attacks are magical and deal an extra 3 ({@damage 1d6}) necrotic damage on a hit (included in the attack).

trait.name: Necrotic Veil
entries: Whenever the death shepherd finishes a short or long rest, it gains 25 temporary hit points. While it has these temporary hit points, it has resistance to all damage except radiant damage and it's immune to effects that turn Undead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The death shepherd makes two Scythe attacks.

action.name: Scythe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) slashing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Command Undead
entries: The death shepherd chooses one Undead that it can see within 60 feet of it. That creature must succeed on a {@dc 14} Charisma saving throw or it becomes friendly to the death shepherd and obeys its commands for 24 hours. If the target has an Intelligence score of 8 or higher, it succeeds on its saving throw automatically. If the saving throw is successful, the creature is immune to the death shepherd's Command Undead for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Restless Undeath {@recharge 5}
entries: The death shepherd chooses an allied Undead creature that it can see within 10 feet of it that died within the last 10 minutes. The target returns to life with 14 ({@dice 2d10 + 3}) hit points and immediately rises to its feet.

trait.name: Haunting Chorus
entries: The chorus emits a ghostly chatter in a 30-foot radius around it. Whenever a non-undead creature that can hear the chorus starts its turn in the area, that creature must make a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) psychic damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) thunder damage and is {@condition deafened} until the start of their next turn. On a success, a creature takes half damage and is not {@condition deafened}.

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The chorus can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Swarm
entries: The chorus can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Small humanoid. The chorus can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

trait.name: Undead Nature
entries: The chorus doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The chorus uses Babbling Remark twice.

action.name: Babbling Remark
entries: The chorus's maddening chatter assaults the mind of a creature that the chorus can see within 15 feet of it. The target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw or take 10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) psychic damage.

reaction.name: Scathing Retort
entries: Whenever a creature within 30 feet of the chorus deals damage to it, if the creature can hear the chorus, the chorus can use its reaction to force that creature to make a saving throw against its Haunting Chorus feature.

monster.name: Drowned
languages: understands the languages it knew in life but can't speak

trait.name: Bottom Treader
entries: The drowned can't swim, and it sinks to the bottom of any body of water. It takes no penalties to its movement or attacks underwater. Additionally, it's immune to the effects of being underwater at a depth greater than 100 feet.

trait.name: Mental Bond
entries: The drowned shares its mind with every other Drowned within 1 mile of it, and can communicate its thoughts and observations to them instantaneously and without limitation.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, the drowned has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Undead Fortitude
entries: If damage reduces the drowned blade to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the drowned blade drops to 1 hit point instead.

trait.name: Undead Nature
entries: The drowned doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The drowned makes two Longsword attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of Scum Spray, if available.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Scum Spray {@recharge 5}
entries: The drown sprays fetid, infected water from its boils in a 15-foot cone. Each creature caught in the area must make a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw, taking 13 ({@damage 3d8}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A Humanoid that fails its saving throw contracts the disease, bluerot.

monster.name: Drowned Brute
languages: understands the languages it knew in life but can't speak

trait.name: Bottom Treader
entries: The drowned can't swim, and it sinks to the bottom of any body of water. It takes no penalties to its movement or attacks underwater. Additionally, it's immune to the effects of being underwater at a depth greater than 100 feet.

trait.name: Mental Bond
entries: The drowned shares its mind with every other Drowned within 1 mile of it, and can communicate its thoughts and observations to them instantaneously and without limitation.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, the drowned has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Undead Fortitude
entries: If damage reduces the drowned blade to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the drowned blade drops to 1 hit point instead.

trait.name: Undead Nature
entries: The drowned doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The drowned makes one Slam attack and one Tentacles attack. It can replace one attack with a use of Scum Spray, if available.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Tentacles
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 14}). Until this grapple ends, the creature is {@condition restrained}, and the drowned can't make a Tentacles attack against another target.

action.name: Scum Spray {@recharge 5}
entries: The drown sprays fetid, infected water from its boils in a 15-foot cone. Each creature caught in the area must make a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw, taking 18 ({@damage 4d8}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A Humanoid that fails its saving throw contracts the disease, bluerot.

monster.name: Drowned Wavemaster
languages: understands the languages it knew in life but can't speak

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The drowned casts one of the following spells, using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 13}, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks):

trait.name: Bottom Treader
entries: The drowned can't swim, and it sinks to the bottom of any body of water. It takes no penalties to its movement or attacks underwater. Additionally, it's immune to the effects of being underwater at a depth greater than 100 feet.

trait.name: Mental Bond
entries: The drowned shares its mind with every other Drowned within 1 mile of it, and can communicate its thoughts and observations to them instantaneously and without limitation.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, the drowned has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Undead Fortitude
entries: If damage reduces the drowned blade to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the drowned blade drops to 1 hit point instead.

trait.name: Undead Nature
entries: The drowned doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The drowned makes two Water Pulse attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of Spellcasting or Scum Spray, if available.

action.name: Water Pulse
entries: {@atk ms,rs} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) bludgeoning damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) poison damage. If the target is a Humanoid, it must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or contract the disease, bluerot.

action.name: Scum Spray {@recharge 5}
entries: The drown sprays fetid, infected water from its boils in a 15-foot cone. Each creature caught in the area must make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw, taking 27 ({@damage 6d8}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A Humanoid that fails its saving throw contracts the disease, bluerot.

monster.name: Drowned Juggernaut
languages: understands the languages it knew in life but can't speak

trait.name: Bottom Treader
entries: The drowned can't swim, and it sinks to the bottom of any body of water. It takes no penalties to its movement or attacks underwater. Additionally, it's immune to the effects of being underwater at a depth greater than 100 feet.

trait.name: Cold Aura
entries: At the start of each of the drowned's turns, each creature within 5 feet of it takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) cold damage. A creature that touches the drowned or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) cold damage.

trait.name: Mental Bond
entries: The drowned shares its mind with every other Drowned within 1 mile of it, and can communicate its thoughts and observations to them instantaneously and without limitation.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, the drowned has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Undead Fortitude
entries: If damage reduces the drowned blade to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the drowned blade drops to 1 hit point instead.

trait.name: Undead Nature
entries: The drowned doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The drowned makes one Greatsword attack and one Tentacles attack. It can replace one attack with a use of Necrotic Scum, if available.

action.name: Greatsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) slashing damage plus 14 ({@damage 4d6}) cold damage.

action.name: Tentacle
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) necrotic damage and the drowned regains hit points equal to the necrotic damage dealt. The target must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or have its hit point maximum reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. A Humanoid that fails its saving throw contracts the disease, bluerot.

action.name: Necrotic Scum {@recharge 5}
entries: The drown sprays fetid, inky black water from its boils in a 30-foot cone. Each creature caught in the area must make a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw, taking 27 ({@damage 6d8}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature that fails this saving throw is {@condition blinded} until the end of its next turn and, if it's a Humanoid, it contracts the disease, bluerot.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The flameskull casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 14}, {@hit 6} to hit with spell attacks):

trait.name: Illumination
entries: The flameskull sheds either dim light in a 15-foot radius, or bright light in a 15-foot radius and dim light for an additional 15 feet. It can switch between the options as an action.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The flameskull has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Rejuvenation
entries: If the flameskull is destroyed, it regains all its hit points in 1 hour unless holy water is sprinkled on its remains or a {@spell dispel magic} or {@spell remove curse} spell is cast on them.

trait.name: Undead Nature
entries: The flameskull doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The flameskull makes two Fire Ray attacks.

action.name: Fire Ray
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 6} to hit, range 30 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 3d6}) fire damage.

reaction.name: Magic Barrier (3/Day)
entries: Whenever a creature would hit the flameskull with an attack roll, the flameskull gains a +5 bonus to AC against the triggered attack.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The flameskeleton casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 15}, {@hit 7} to hit with spell attacks):

trait.name: Heated Body
entries: A creature that touches the flameskeleton or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) fire damage.

trait.name: Illumination
entries: The flameskeleton sheds either dim light in a 20-foot radius, or bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet. It can switch between the options as an action.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The flameskeleton has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Rejuvenation
entries: If the flameskeleton is destroyed, it regains all its hit points in 1 hour unless holy water is sprinkled on its remains or a {@spell dispel magic} or {@spell remove curse} spell is cast on them.

trait.name: Undead Nature
entries: The flameskeleton doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The flameskeleton makes three Fire Claw or Fire Ray attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of Spellcasting.

action.name: Fire Claw
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) slashing damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) fire damage.

action.name: Fire Ray
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 7} to hit, range 30 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 3d6}) fire damage.

reaction.name: Flame Barrier (3/Day)
entries: Whenever a creature would hit the flameskeleton with an attack roll, the flameskeleton gains a +5 bonus to AC against the triggered attack. The flameskeleton can then make a Fire Ray attack against the target.

monster.name: Frostbitten
languages: understands the languages it knew it life but can't speak

trait.name: Frozen Joints
entries: The frostbitten can't take the Dash action. If the frostbitten takes fire damage, this trait doesn't function until the end of the frostbitten's next turn.

trait.name: Thaw Out
entries: When the frostbitten drops to 0 hit points, the ice on its body breaks open and it transforms into a zombie. Additionally, if the frostbitten takes 20 or more fire damage in a single turn, it immediately drops to 0 hit points.

trait.name: Undead Nature
entries: The frostbitten doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The frostbitten makes one Bite attack and one Claw attack.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) cold damage, and the target has disadvantage on the next weapon attack it makes before the start of the frostbitten's next turn.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 2d4 + 3}) slashing damage plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) cold damage, and the target's speed is reduced by 10 feet until the start of the frostbitten's next turn.

monster.name: Frostbitten Knight
languages: understands the languages it knew it life but can't speak

trait.name: Thaw Out
entries: When the frostbitten drops to 0 hit points, the ice on its body breaks open and it transforms into a zombie. Additionally, if the frostbitten takes 40 or more fire damage in a single turn, it immediately drops to 0 hit points.

trait.name: Undead Nature
entries: The frostbitten doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The frostbitten makes one Longsword attack, one Bite attack, and one Claw attack.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) cold damage, and the target has disadvantage on the next weapon attack it makes before the start of the frostbitten's next turn.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) slashing damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) cold damage, and the target's speed is reduced by 10 feet until the start of the frostbitten's next turn.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) slashing damage plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) cold damage.

monster.name: Gallows Speaker
languages: any languages its component spirits knew in life

trait.name: Ethereal Sight
entries: The gallows speaker can see 60 feet into the Ethereal Plane when it is on the Material Plane and vice versa.

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The gallows speaker can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Undead Nature
entries: The gallows speaker doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The gallows speaker makes two Foretelling Touch attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of Suffering Echoes, if available.

action.name: Foretelling Touch
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d10 + 4}) psychic damage, and the target must roll a {@dice d4} and subtract the number rolled from the next attack roll or saving throw it makes before the start of the gallows speaker's next turn.

action.name: Suffering Echoes {@recharge 5}
entries: The gallows speaker whispers into the mind of a creature it can see within 30 feet of it. If the target can hear the gallows speaker, it must make a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 19 ({@damage 3d12}) psychic damage, and waves of painful memories leap from the target to up to three other creatures of the gallows speaker's choice that are within 30 feet of the target, each of which takes 13 ({@damage 3d8}) psychic damage. On a success, a creature takes half as much damage and no other creatures are affected.

monster.name: Gravekeeper
languages: understands the languages it knew in life but can't speak

trait.name: Aura of Demise
entries: The gravekeeper emits an aura of death in a 20-foot-radius around it. Creatures in the area have disadvantage on death saving throws.

Additionally, whenever a creature starts its turn within the aura, the gravekeeper can magically force it to make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the creature's hit point maximum is reduced by 14 ({@dice 4d6}). This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The gravekeeper regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn. If the gravekeeper takes fire or radiant damage, this trait doesn't function until the start of its next turn. The gravekeeper dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

trait.name: Turn Immunity
entries: The gravekeeper is immune to effects that turn Undead.

trait.name: Undead Killer
entries: Whenever the gravekeeper hits another Undead with a weapon attack, the target takes an extra 7 ({@damage 2d6}) force damage from the attack.

trait.name: Unusual Nature
entries: The gravekeeper doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The gravekeeper makes three Claw attacks, one of which it can replace with a use of Drain life force.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) slashing damage. Instead of dealing damage, the gravekeeper can grapple the target (escape {@dc 15}).

Drain life force. The gravekeeper drains the life from a creature it's grappling. The target must make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the creature takes 18 ({@damage 4d8}) necrotic damage and its Constitution score is reduced by {@dice 1d4}. The target dies if this reduces its Constitution to 0. Otherwise, the reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. On a success, the creature takes half as much damage and its Constitution score is unaffected.

trait.name: Favored Foe
entries: The grim's weapon attacks deal an extra two dice of their damage when it hits a Fiend or Undead (included in the attack).

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The grim can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The grim has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Sunlight Weakness
entries: While in bright light created by sunlight, the grim has disadvantage on attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws.

trait.name: True Loyalty
entries: The grim can't be compelled to act in a manner contrary to its nature or its instructions.

trait.name: Turn Immunity
entries: The grim is immune to effects that turn Undead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The grim makes two Claw attacks and a Bite attack. It can replace its Bite attack with a use of Grim Bark or Dreadful Baying, if available.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d10 + 2}) force damage, or 24 ({@damage 4d10 + 2}) force damage if the target is a Fiend or Undead.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) force damage, or 12 ({@damage 3d6 + 2}) force damage if the target is a Fiend or Undead. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 13} Charisma saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone} by a weight on its spirit.

action.name: Grim Bark
entries: The grim lets out a bark that can be heard from up to 300 feet away. Each creature that's hostile to the grim within 60 feet of it can't become {@condition invisible} or enter the Ethereal Plane for 1 minute and immediately becomes visible if it's {@condition invisible}. Additionally, each creature within 60 feet of the grim's space in the Ethereal Plane is immediately forced into the nearest unoccupied space on the grim's current plane and can't enter the Ethereal Plane again for 1 minute.

action.name: Dreadful Baying {@recharge 5}
entries: The grim lets out a haunting baying sound that can be heard from up to 300 feet away. Whenever a creature that's hostile to the grim starts its turn within 60 feet of it and can hear the baying, that creature must make a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 11 ({@damage 2d10}) psychic damage and it becomes {@condition frightened} of the grim until the start of its next turn. On a success, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't {@condition frightened}. The baying lasts until the grim loses {@status concentration} (as if {@status concentration||concentrating} on a spell).

bonus.name: Shadow Stealth
entries: If it's in dim light or darkness, the grim takes the Hide action.

trait.name: Amorphous
entries: The leukocyst can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

trait.name: Aversion to Cold
entries: If the leukocyst takes cold damage, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks until the end of its next turn.
Additionally, whenever the leukocyst starts its turn in an area of extreme cold (at or below 0 degrees farenheit), it takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) cold damage.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The leukocyst can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Undead Nature
entries: The leukocyst doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The leukocyst makes two Claw attacks.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) slashing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or lose 2 ({@dice 1d4}) hit points at the start of each of its turns due to a bleeding wound. A creature that lacks blood succeeds on this saving throw automatically. Each time thereafter that a Leukocyst hits the target with this attack, the damage dealt by the wound increases by 2 ({@dice 1d4}). Any creature can take an action to stanch the wound with a successful {@dc 10} Wisdom (Medicine) check. The wound also closes if the target receives magical healing.

Whenever a creature loses hit points from this wound, another leukocyst appears in a random unoccupied space within 5 feet of it. The new leukocyst takes its turn immediately after the creature that caused the wound on the same initiative count and fights alongside its creator.

trait.name: Amorphous
entries: The leukocyst can move through a space as narrow as 6-inches wide without squeezing.

trait.name: Aversion to Cold
entries: If the leukocyst takes cold damage, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks until the end of its next turn.
Additionally, whenever the leukocyst starts its turn in an area of extreme cold (at or below 0 degrees farenheit), it takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) cold damage.

trait.name: Collapse
entries: If the leukocyst is reduced to 0 hit points, four leukocysts rise from its remains.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The leukocyst can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Undead Nature
entries: The leukocyst doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The leukocyst makes two Claw attacks.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d12 + 4}) slashing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or lose 5 ({@dice 2d4}) hit points at the start of each of its turns due to a bleeding wound. A creature that lacks blood succeeds on this saving throw automatically. Each time thereafter that a Leukocyst hits the target with this attack, the damage dealt by the wound increases by 5 ({@dice 2d4}). Any creature can take an action to stanch the wound with a successful {@dc 10} Wisdom (Medicine) check. The wound also closes if the target receives magical healing.

Whenever a creature loses hit points from this wound, another leukocyst appears in a random unoccupied space within 5 feet of it. The new leukocyst takes its turn immediately after the creature that caused the wound on the same initiative count and fights alongside its creator.

trait.name: Amorphous
entries: The leukocyst can move through a space as narrow as 1-foot wide without squeezing.

trait.name: Aversion to Cold
entries: If the leukocyst takes cold damage, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks until the end of its next turn.
Additionally, whenever the leukocyst starts its turn in an area of extreme cold (at or below 0 degrees farenheit), it takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) cold damage.

trait.name: Collapse
entries: If the leukocyst is reduced to 0 hit points, ten leukocysts rise from its remains.

trait.name: Sickening Presence
entries: The leukocyst emits a sickening aura in a 20-foot-radius around it. Creatures in the area with a bleeding wound caused by a Leukocyst are {@condition poisoned}.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The leukocyst can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Undead Nature
entries: The leukocyst doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The leukocyst makes two Claw attacks and uses Septic Shock.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 2d12 + 6}) slashing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw or lose 7 ({@dice 3d4}) hit points at the start of each of its turns due to a bleeding wound. A creature that lacks blood succeeds on this saving throw automatically. Each time thereafter that a Leukocyst hits the target with this attack, the damage dealt by the wound increases by 7 ({@dice 3d4}). Any creature can take an action to stanch the wound with a successful {@dc 10} Wisdom (Medicine) check. The wound also closes if the target receives magical healing.

Whenever a creature loses hit points from this wound, another leukocyst appears in a random unoccupied space within 5 feet of it. The new leukocyst takes its turn immediately after the creature that caused the wound on the same initiative count and fights alongside its creator.

action.name: Septic Shock
entries: Each creature within 20 feet of the leukocyst that has a bleeding wound caused by a Leukocyst must make a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw, taking 11 ({@damage 2d10}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

monster.name: Lich
languages: Common plus up to five other languages

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The lich casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 20}, {@hit 12} to hit with spell attacks):

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the lich fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Phylactery
entries: The lich's soul is stored inside a phylactery, a Small or Tiny magic object created by it as a part of becoming a lich. Whenever the lich sends a creature's soul to the phylactery as a part of its Soul Drain action, the phylactery devours the soul over the course of 24 hours, fuelling the lich's undeath. A lich must consume a soul this way once every {@dice 4d6 + 10} days, else its hit point maximum is reduced by 10. The reduction lasts until the lich devours another soul with its phylactery. A lich whose hit point maximum is reduced to 0 this way loses dies and is reborn as a demilich, assuming its phylactery is intact.

A soul trapped inside a lich's phylactery can be freed by touching the phylactery and casting the {@spell dispel evil and good} spell or similar magic. A creature whose soul is devoured by a lich's phylactery can't be revived by any means short of a {@spell wish} spell.

When the lich dies, if it's phylactery is intact, it gains a new body in {@dice 1d10} days, regaining all its hit points and becoming active again. The new body appears within 5 feet of the phylactery.
The phylactery has AC 20, 50 hit points, and immunity to all damage except radiant damage. It regains all its hit points at the end of each turn.

trait.name: Turn Resistance
entries: The lich has advantage on saving throws against any effect that turns Undead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The lich makes two Soul Drain attacks. It can replace one attack with a Paralyzing Touch attack or a use of Spellcasting.

action.name: Paralyzing Touch
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 3d6}) cold damage. The target must succeed on a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition paralyzed} for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Soul Drain
entries: {@atk ms,rs} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 60 ft., one creature. {@h}21 ({@damage 3d10 + 5}) necrotic damage and the lich regains hit points equal to the damage dealt. The target must then succeed on a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0 and the lich magically sends the soul to its phylactery, if it's phylactery doesn't already contain a soul.

legendary.name: Cast an At Will Spell
entries: The lich uses Spellcasting to cast an At Will spell.

legendary.name: Soul Drain
entries: The lich makes a Soul Drain attack.

legendary.name: Paralyzing Touch (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The lich makes a Paralyzing Touch attack.

languages: Common plus up to five other languages
