monster.name: Hierossa
languages: plus up to four other languages

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The hierossa casts one of the following spells, using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 20}, {@hit 12} to hit with spell attacks):

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the hierossa fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Phylactery
entries: The hierossa's soul is stored inside a phylactery, a Small or Tiny magic object granted to it by its deity as a part of becoming a hierossa. Whenever the hierossa sends a creature's soul to the tree as a part of its Commit Soul action, the phylactery the soul over the course of 24 hours, fuelling the hierossa's undeath. A hierossa must consume a soul this way once every {@dice 1d4 + 1} months, else its hit point maximum is reduced by 10. The reduction lasts until the hierossa devours another soul with its phylactery. A hierossa whose hit point maximum is reduced to 0 this way dies.

A soul trapped inside a hierossa's phylactery can be freed by touching the hierossa and casting the {@spell dispel evil and good} spell or similar magic. A creature whose soul is devoured by a hierossa's phylactery can't be revived by any means short of a {@spell wish} spell.

When the hierossa dies, if it's phylactery is intact, it gains a new body in {@dice 1d10} days, regaining all its hit points and becoming active again. The new body appears within 5 feet of the phylactery.
The phylactery has AC 20, 50 hit points, and immunity to all damage except necrotic damage. It regains all its hit points at the end of each turn.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The hierossa regains 20 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point. If the hierossa takes necrotic damage, this trait doesn't function until the start of its next turn.

trait.name: Turn Resistance
entries: The hierossa has advantage on saving throws against any effect that turns Undead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The hierossa makes two Sacred Fire attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of Spellcasting or Divine Intervention, if available.

action.name: Sacred Fire
entries: {@atk ms,rs} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5 ft., or range 120 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) radiant damage. This attack ignores half and three-quarters cover.

action.name: Commit Soul
entries: The hierossa touches a willing creature with whom it shares a faith. The target dies and its soul is magically sent to its phylactery, if its phylactery doesn't already contain a soul.

action.name: Divine Intervention (1/Day)
entries: The hierossa entreats the higher powers of its faith to aid it. It immediately uses Spellcasting to cast the {@spell wish} spell, requiring no components. When it casts {@spell wish} in this way, it must use the spell to replicate a spell on the cleric spell list of 8th level or lower.

reaction.name: Holy Retribution
entries: In response to being dealt damage by a creature within 60 feet of it, the hierossa forces that creature to make a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the target takes 16 ({@damage 3d10}) radiant damage and is pushed up to 10 feet in a straight line away from the hierossa and knocked {@condition prone}. On a success, the target takes half as much damage and is otherwise unaffected.

legendary.name: Cast an At Will Spell
entries: The hierossa uses Spellcasting to cast an At Will spell.

legendary.name: Divine Abjudication
entries: The hierossa releases a pulse of radiant energy in a 10-foot-radius around it. Each creature the hierossa choices in the affected area must make a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw, taking 14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The hierossa gains temporary hit points equal to the damage rolled, which lasts until the start of its next turn.

legendary.name: Turn Foe (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The hierossa presents its holy symbol towards a creature that it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must succeed on a {@dc 20} Wisdom saving throw or become turned until the end of its next turn or until it takes damage. A turned creature must spend its turns trying to move as far away from the hierossa as it can, and it can't willingly move to a space within 30 feet of the hierossa. It also can't take reactions. For its action, it can use only the Dash action or try to escape from an effect that prevents it from moving. If there's nowhere to move, the creature can use the Dodge action.

monster.name: Thraze
languages: plus up to two other languages

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The thraze casts one of the following spells, using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 20}, {@hit 12} to hit with spell attacks):

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the thraze fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Phylactery Tree
entries: The thraze's soul is stored inside a phylactery tree, a tree bound to it as a part of becoming a thraze. Whenever the thraze sends a creature's soul to the tree as a part of its Soul Drain action, the tree devours the soul over the course of 24 hours, fuelling the thraze's undeath. A thraze must consume a soul this way once every {@dice 4d6 + 10} days, else its hit point maximum is reduced by 10. The reduction lasts until the thraze devours another soul with its phylactery. A thraze whose hit point maximum is reduced to 0 this way dies.

A soul trapped inside a thraze's tree can be freed by touching the tree and casting the {@spell dispel evil and good} spell or similar magic. A creature whose soul is devoured by a thraze's tree can't be revived by any means short of a {@spell wish} spell.

When the thraze dies, if it's phylactery is intact, it gains a new body in {@dice 1d10} days, regaining all its hit points and becoming active again. The new body appears within 5 feet of the phylactery.

The phylactery is a Gargantuan object with AC 20, 100 hit points, and immunity to all damage except radiant damage and slashing damage from magical attacks, the latter of which it's resistant to. It regains all its hit points at the end of each turn.

trait.name: Turn Resistance
entries: The thraze has advantage on saving throws against any effect that turns Undead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The thraze makes two Soul Drain attacks. It can replace one attack with a Blighted Touch attack or a use of Spellcasting or Grim Plague, if available.

action.name: Blighted Touch
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}21 ({@damage 3d10 + 5}) necrotic damage. If the target is a creature or an object made of plant matter (i.e., hemp or wood), it begins to decay, taking 21 ({@damage 3d10 + 5}) necrotic damage at the start of each of its turns for 1 minute. A creature afflicted this way can make a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the decay on a success.

action.name: Soul Drain
entries: {@atk ms,rs} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 60 ft., one creature. {@h}21 ({@damage 3d10 + 5}) necrotic damage and the thraze regains hit points equal to the damage dealt. The target must then succeed on a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0 and the thraze magically sends the soul to its phylactery tree, if it's tree doesn't already contain a soul.

action.name: Grim Plague {@recharge 5}
entries: The thraze chooses a creature that it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must succeed on a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw or suffer the effects of a random disease incurred by the {@spell contagion} spell for 1 minute. A diseased creature can repeat its saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the disease on itself on a success.

reaction.name: Capture Elements (Recharge 5-6)
entries: In response to being dealt acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder damage, the thraze instead takes no damage and chooses a point that it can see within 60 feet of it. Erupting from the chosen point is a flurry of the negated element in a 20-foot-radius sphere. Each creature caught in the area must make a {@dc 20} Dexterity saving throw, taking the acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder damage rolled against the thraze on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

legendary.name: Cast an At Will Spell
entries: The thraze uses Spellcasting to cast an At Will spell.

legendary.name: Soul Drain
entries: The thraze makes a Soul Drain attack.

legendary.name: Summon Blights (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The thraze conjures Blight creatures whose combed average hit points don't exceed 30. These creatures magically rise up from the ground or otherwise form in unoccupied spaces within 30 feet of the thraze. The Blights take their turn immediately after the thraze on the same initiative count and obey the thraze's commands.

trait.name: Amorphous
entries: The curse can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

trait.name: Remove Curse Vulnerability
entries: If a living curse comes under the effects of the {@spell remove curse} spell, it takes 28 ({@damage 8d6}) radiant damage and, if it's possessing a creature, it must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw against the caster's spell save DC or end its possession.

trait.name: Sunlight Weakness
entries: While in sunlight, the curse has disadvantage on attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws.

trait.name: Undead Nature
entries: The curse doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The curse makes three Blackened Touch attacks.

action.name: Blackened Touch
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) necrotic damage. If the damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, the target is stable.

action.name: Cursed Possession
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one {@condition incapacitated} or {@condition restrained} creature. {@h}The target is possessed by the curse; the curse then disappears. For as long as the living curse possesses the creature, the creature suffers the effects of the associated curse.

Each time the inhabited creature completes a long rest, it must make a {@dc 14} Charisma saving throw, recording the result. After three failures, the living curse is fully absorbed and fades from existence, leaving the target creature affected by the curse until it's removed by a {@spell remove curse} spell or similar magic. The possession ends if the living curse is turned or forced out by an effect like the {@spell dispel evil and good} spell. When the possession ends, the living curse reappears in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the body. The target is immune to this curse's Cursed Possession for 24 hours after the possession ends.

monster.name: Mohrg
languages: understands the languages it knew in life

trait.name: Stench
entries: Any creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of the mohrg must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} until the start of its next turn. On a successful saving throw, the creature is immune the Stench of all morhgs for 24 hours.

trait.name: Undead Fortitude
entries: If damage reduces the mohrg to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the mohrg drops to 1 hit point instead.

trait.name: Undead Nature
entries: The mohrg doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: Undead Thralls
entries: A Humanoid slain by the mohrg rises 24 hours later as a zombie under the mohrg's control, unless the Humanoid is restored to life or its body is destroyed.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The mohrg makes two Claw attacks and one Tongue attack.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) slashing damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) necrotic damage and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 16}). While the grapple persists, the target is {@condition restrained} and the mohrg can't grapple another target.

action.name: Tongue
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 5d6}) necrotic damage. If the target is a creature, it must make a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw. On a failure, a creature is {@condition paralyzed} until the end of the mohrg's next turn. On a success, a creature is unaffected and gains advantage on all subsequent saving throws it makes against the mohrg's tongue for 24 hours.

monster.name: Mummy
languages: the languages it knew in life

trait.name: Aversion to Fire
entries: If the mummy takes fire damage, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks until the end of its next turn.

trait.name: Undead Nature
entries: The mummy doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The mummy can use Dreadful Glare. It then makes a Rotting Fist attack.

action.name: Rotting Fist
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) necrotic damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 11} Constitution saving throw or be cursed with mummy rot. The cursed target can't regain hit points, and its hit point maximum decreases by 10 ({@dice 3d6}) for every 24 hours that elapse. If the curse reduces the target's hit point maximum to 0, the target dies, and its body turns to dust. The curse lasts until removed by the {@spell remove curse} spell or other magic, which also restores the target's hit point maximum.

action.name: Dreadful Glare
entries: The mummy targets one creature it can see within 60 feet of it. If the target can see the mummy, it must succeed on a {@dc 11} Wisdom saving throw against this magic or become {@condition frightened} until the end of the mummy's next turn. If the target fails the saving throw by 5 or more, it is also {@condition paralyzed} for the same duration. A target that succeeds on the saving throw is immune to the Dreadful Glare of all non-legendary Mummies for the next 24 hours.

monster.name: Mummy Tombguard
languages: the languages it knew in life

trait.name: Aversion to Fire
entries: If the mummy takes fire damage, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks until the end of its next turn.

trait.name: Undead Nature
entries: The mummy doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The mummy can use Dreadful Glare. It then makes two Scimitars attacks and one Rotting Fist attack.

action.name: Rotting Fist
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) necrotic damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or be cursed with mummy rot. The cursed target can't regain hit points, and its hit point maximum decreases by 10 ({@dice 3d6}) for every 24 hours that elapse. If the curse reduces the target's hit point maximum to 0, the target dies, and its body turns to dust. The curse lasts until removed by the {@spell remove curse} spell or other magic, which also restores the target's hit point maximum.

action.name: Tomb Lid
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 5 feet in a straight line away from the mummy and knocked {@condition prone}. The mummy can move up to 5 feet towards its target immediately before this attack.

action.name: Dreadful Glare
entries: The mummy targets one creature it can see within 60 feet of it. If the target can see the mummy, it must succeed on a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw against this magic or become {@condition frightened} until the end of the mummy's next turn. If the target fails the saving throw by 5 or more, it is also {@condition paralyzed} for the same duration. A target that succeeds on the saving throw is immune to the Dreadful Glare of all non-legendary Mummies for the next 24 hours.

monster.name: Mummy Lord
languages: the languages it knew in life

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The mummy lord casts one of the following spells, using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 17}, {@hit 9} to hit with spell attacks):

trait.name: Aversion to Fire
entries: If the mummy lord takes fire damage, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks until the end of its next turn.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The mummy lord has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Rejuvenation
entries: A destroyed mummy lord gains a new body in 24 hours if its heart is intact, regaining all its hit points and becoming active again. The new body appears within 5 feet of the mummy lord's heart.
The mummy lord's heart is a Tiny object with AC 5, 25 hit points, and immunity to all damage except fire damage.

trait.name: Undead Nature
entries: The mummy lord doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The mummy can use Dreadful Glare, Spellcasting, or Blasphemous Word, if available. It then makes a Rotting Fist attack.

action.name: Rotting Fist
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) necrotic damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw or be cursed with mummy rot. The cursed target can't regain hit points, and its hit point maximum decreases by 10 ({@dice 3d6}) for every 24 hours that elapse. If the curse reduces the target's hit point maximum to 0, the target dies, and its body turns to dust. The curse lasts until removed by the {@spell remove curse} spell or other magic, which also restores the target's hit point maximum.

action.name: Dreadful Glare
entries: The mummy lord targets one creature it can see within 60 feet of it. If the target can see the mummy, it must succeed on a {@dc 17} Wisdom saving throw against this magic or become {@condition frightened} until the end of the mummy lord's next turn. If the target fails the saving throw by 5 or more, it is also {@condition paralyzed} for the same duration. A target that succeeds on the saving throw is immune to the Dreadful Glare of all Mummies for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Blasphemous Word {@recharge 5}
entries: The mummy lord utters a blasphemous word. Each non-Undead creature within 10 feet of the mummy lord that can hear the magical utterance must succeed on a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until the end of the mummy lord's next turn.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: The mummy lord uses Dreadful Glare or makes a Rotting Fist attack.

legendary.name: Blinding Dust
entries: Blinding dust and sand swirls magically around the mummy lord. Each creature within 5 feet of the mummy lord must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition blinded} until the end of the creature's next turn.

legendary.name: Channel Negative Energy (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The mummy lord magically unleashes negative energy. Creatures within 60 feet of the mummy lord, including ones behind barriers and around corners, can't regain hit points until the end of the mummy lord's next turn.

legendary.name: Whirlwind of Sand (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The mummy lord magically transforms into a whirlwind of sand, moves up to 60 feet, and reverts to its normal form. While in whirlwind form, the mummy lord is immune to all damage, and it can't be {@condition grappled}, {@condition petrified}, knocked {@condition prone}, {@condition restrained}, or {@condition stunned}. Equipment worn or carried by the mummy lord remains in its possession.

trait.name: Amorphous
entries: The necronaut can move through a space as narrow as 10 feet wide without squeezing.

trait.name: Corpses
entries: When first encountered, a necronaut contains the corpses of {@dice 2d6 + 9} Humanoids. A necronaut can hold the remains of up to thirty Humanoids. These remains have total cover against attacks and other effects outside the necronaut. If the necronaut dies, the corpses within it can be pulled free.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The necronaut can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Stench
entries: Any creature that starts its turn within 30 feet of the necronaut must succeed on a {@dc 21} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} until the start of its next turn. On a successful saving throw, the creature is immune to the necronaut's Stench for 24 hours.

trait.name: Undead Nature
entries: The necronaut doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The necronaut makes four Piercer attacks.

action.name: Piercer
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d4 + 8}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it's {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 21}). Until the grapple ends, the creature is {@condition restrained} and it takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) piercing damage at the start of each of its turns.

action.name: Engulf
entries: The cube necronaut up to its speed. While doing so, it can enter Huge or smaller creatures' spaces. Whenever the necronaut enters a creature's space, the creature must make a {@dc 21} Dexterity saving throw.
On a successful save, the creature can choose to be pushed 5 feet back or to the side of the necronaut. A creature that chooses not to be pushed suffers the consequences of a failed saving throw.

On a failed save, the necronaut enters the creature's space, and the creature is engulfed. The engulfed creature can't breathe, is {@condition restrained}, and takes 42 ({@damage 12d6}) necrotic damage at the start of each of the necronaut's turns. When the necronaut moves, the engulfed creature moves with it.
An engulfed creature can try to escape by taking an action to make a {@dc 21} Strength check. On a success, the creature escapes and enters a space of its choice within 5 feet of the necronaut.

action.name: Harvest the Dead
entries: The necronaut engulfs one unsecured Humanoid corpse within 20 feet of it, along with any equipment the corpse is wearing or carrying.

bonus.name: Digest
entries: The necronaut digests one corpse in its body and instantly regains 11 ({@dice 2d10}) hit points. Nothing of the digested corpse remains. Any equipment on the corpse is expelled from the necronaut in its space.

bonus.name: Reanimate
entries: The necronaut animates up to five corpses in its body, turning them into zombies. The zombies appear in unoccupied spaces within 5 feet of the necronaut and act immediately after it in the initiative order. The zombies act as allies of the necronaut but aren't under its control.

monster.name: Phantom Archer
languages: any languages it knew in life

trait.name: Archer's Eye (1/Turn)
entries: Immediately after making an attack roll or a damage roll with a ranged weapon, the phantom can roll a {@dice d8} and add the number rolled to the total.

trait.name: Ethereal Sight
entries: The phantom can see 60 feet into the Ethereal Plane when it is on the Material Plane, and vice versa.

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The phantom can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Spectral Equipment
entries: The phantom's armor and equipment vanish when it dies.

trait.name: Undead Nature
entries: The phantom doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The phantom makes two Dagger or Longbow attacks.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) force damage.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) force damage.

action.name: Etherealness
entries: The phantom enters the Ethereal Plane from the Material Plane, or vice versa. It is visible on the Material Plane while it is in the Border Ethereal, and vice versa, yet it can't affect or be affected by anything on the other plane.

monster.name: Phantom Warrior
languages: any languages it knew in life

trait.name: Ethereal Sight
entries: The phantom can see 60 feet into the Ethereal Plane when it is on the Material Plane, and vice versa.

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The phantom can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Spectral Equipment
entries: The phantom's armor and equipment vanish when it dies.

trait.name: Undead Nature
entries: The phantom doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The phantom makes two Longsword or Javelin attacks.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) force damage or 8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) force damage if wielded with two hands.

action.name: Javelin
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) force damage.

action.name: Etherealness
entries: The phantom enters the Ethereal Plane from the Material Plane, or vice versa. It is visible on the Material Plane while it is in the Border Ethereal, and vice versa, yet it can't affect or be affected by anything on the other plane.

monster.name: Phantom Tactician
languages: any languages it knew in life

trait.name: Ethereal Sight
entries: The phantom can see 60 feet into the Ethereal Plane when it is on the Material Plane, and vice versa.

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The phantom can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Spectral Equipment
entries: The phantom's armor and equipment vanish when it dies.

trait.name: Undead Nature
entries: The phantom doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The phantom makes two Morningstar attacks. The phantom can replace one attack with a use of Ghostly Retreat.

action.name: Morningstar
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) force damage.

action.name: Etherealness
entries: The phantom enters the Ethereal Plane from the Material Plane, or vice versa. It is visible on the Material Plane while it is in the Border Ethereal, and vice versa, yet it can't affect or be affected by anything on the other plane.

action.name: Ghostly Retreat
entries: Another Apparition allied to the phantom that it can see within 60 feet of it enters the Ethereal Plane from the Material Plane. It is visible on the Material Plane while it is in the Border Ethereal, yet it can't affect or be affected by anything on the other plane. It returns to the Material Plane at the end of its next turn, but can do so beforehand as a bonus action.

bonus.name: Phantom Mark
entries: The phantom points to a creature that it can see within 60 feet of it, branding the target with a ghostly mark that's visible only on the Ethereal Plane and by the marked creature.

While the mark lasts, any creature allied to the phantom that can see the mark has advantage on attack rolls it makes against the marked creature. The mark lasts until the phantom loses its {@status concentration} (as if {@status concentration||concentrating} on a spell), ends its turn unable to see the mark, or it or the marked creature dies.

monster.name: Phantom Wizard
languages: any languages it knew in life

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The phantom casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 14}, {@hit 6} to hit with spell attacks):

trait.name: Ethereal Sight
entries: The phantom can see 60 feet into the Ethereal Plane when it is on the Material Plane, and vice versa.

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The phantom can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Undead Nature
entries: The phantom doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The phantom makes three Phantom Lance attacks.

action.name: Phantom Lance
entries: {@atk ms,rs} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 10 ft. or range 60 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d12 + 3}) force damage.

action.name: Etherealness
entries: The phantom enters the Ethereal Plane from the Material Plane, or vice versa. It is visible on the Material Plane while it is in the Border Ethereal, and vice versa, yet it can't affect or be affected by anything on the other plane.

action.name: Ghostfire Blast {@recharge 5}
entries: The phantom unleashes a wave of ghostly flame in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on a point that it can see within 120 feet of it. Each non-Apparition creature caught in the area must make a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw, taking 10 ({@damage 3d6}) fire damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

reaction.name: Phantom Barrier
entries: The phantom adds 3 to the AC of itself or an allied Apparition within 60 feet of it against an attack that would hit. To do so, the phantom must see the attacker and the target.

monster.name: Putrid Spirit
languages: the languages it knew in life

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The spirit casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 13}, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks):

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The spirit can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Toxic Aura
entries: The spirit exudes an aura of poisonous gas in a 20-foot-radius around it. Whenever a creature enters the area for the first time one a turn or starts its turn there, that creature must make a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage and becomes {@condition poisoned} until the start of its next turn. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and is not {@condition poisoned}.

trait.name: Undead Nature
entries: The spirit doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The spirit makes two Toxic Touch attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of Spellcasting.

action.name: Toxic Touch
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) poison damage. The spirit has advantage on this attack if the target is {@condition poisoned}.

monster.name: Quell
languages: the languages it knew in life

trait.name: Incorporation Movement
entries: The quell can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The quell has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, the quell has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Undead Nature
entries: The quell doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The quell makes two Abjuring Touch attacks.

action.name: Abjuring Touch
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 4d6 + 3}) force damage. The quell can then immediately use Dispel on the target, if available.

action.name: Dispel (1/Turn)
entries: The quell casts the {@spell dispel magic} spell, using Intelligence as its spellcasting ability.

action.name: Arcane Intercession {@recharge}
entries: The quell points towards a creature that it can see within 120 feet of it. The target must succeed on a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or become cursed for 1 minute or until the quell loses {@status concentration} (as if {@status concentration||concentrating} on a spell). While cursed in this way, a creature can't cast spells. If the quell concentrates on this effect for the full duration, the curse persists until removed with a {@spell remove curse} spell or similar magic.

monster.name: Bonespur
languages: understands the languages of its creator

trait.name: Hazardous Body
entries: A creature that touches the bonespur or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 2 ({@damage 1d4}) slashing damage.

trait.name: Sure-Footed
entries: The bonespur has advantage on Strength and Dexterity ability checks and saving throws made against effects that would push it or knock it {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Undead Nature
entries: The bonespur doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The bonespur makes two Scythe attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of Boneshard Blast, if available.

action.name: Scythe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d12 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Cresting Cadavers
entries: The bonespur moves up to twice its speed in a straight line. While doing so, it can enter Large or smaller creatures' spaces. Whenever the bonespur enters a creature's space, the creature must make a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw.
On a successful save, a creature can choose to be pushed 5 feet back or to the side of the bonespour. A creature that chooses not to be pushed suffers the consequences of a failed saving throw.

On a failed save, a creature takes 14 ({@damage 4d6}) bludgeoning damage and is knocked {@condition prone}. The bonespur then pushes that creature into the nearest unoccupied space to where it stops moving.

action.name: Boneshard Blast {@recharge 5}
entries: The bonespur unleashes a burst of jagged bone fragments in a 10-foot-radius around it. Each creature caught in the area must make a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 14 ({@damage 4d6}) slashing damage and it suffers a -5 penalty to AC until the end of the bonespur's next turn. On a success, a creature takes half as much damage and its AC is unaffected.

trait.name: Flexile
entries: The boneyard can move through a space as narrow as 1-foot-wide without squeezing.

trait.name: Hazardous Body
entries: A creature that touches the boneyard or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) slashing damage.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The boneyard has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Undead Nature
entries: The boneyard doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The boneyard makes two Slam attacks and a Bite attack. It can replace one attack with a use of Crush.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}26 ({@damage 3d12 + 7}) piercing damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) necrotic damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or have parts of its skeletal structure torn from its body, reducing its Constitution score by {@dice 1d4}. The target dies if this reduces its Constitution to 0, whereupon all of its bones are torn from its body and shredding its organs to pulp. Otherwise, the reduction lasts until the target is affected by a {@spell greater restoration} spell, a {@spell regenerate} spell, or greater magic. A creature succeeds on this saving throw automatically if it lacks a skeletal structure.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d8 + 7}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Crush
entries: The boneyard crushes a Large or smaller creature or object within 5 feet of it against a surface that can support their combined weight within 5 feet of the target. If the target is a creature, it must make a {@dc 20} Dexterity saving throw.
On a successful save, the creature can choose to be pushed 5 feet to the side of the boneyard. A creature that chooses not to be pushed suffers the consequences of a failed saving throw.

On a failure saving throw, the creature takes 40 ({@damage 6d10 + 7}) bludgeoning damage and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 20}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition prone}. The grapple ends early if the boneyard is ever more than 10 feet away from the surface.

bonus.name: Skeleton Swarming {@recharge}
entries: The boneyard loses 20 hit points to detach {@dice 2d6} skeletons and {@dice 1d4} mortemaluses from its body, which appear in unoccupied spaces within 10 feet of the boneyard. They take their turns immediately after the boneyard on the same initiative count and obeys the boneyard's commands. They die if the boneyard dies.

monster.name: Mortemalus
languages: the languages it knew in life

trait.name: Evasion
entries: If The mortemalus is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, The mortemalus instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

trait.name: Undead Nature
entries: The mortemalus doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}1 piercing damage.

action.name: Jeer
entries: The mortemallus unleashes a magically-charged insult towards a creature that it can see within 60 feet of it. If the target can hear the mortemalus, it must make a {@dc 12} Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 5 ({@damage 2d4}) psychic damage and suffers disadvantage on its next attack roll. On a success, a creature takes half as much damage and is otherwise unaffected.

trait.name: Disassemble
entries: If the juggernaut is reduced to 0 hit points, twelve skeletons rise from its remains.

trait.name: Falling Apart
entries: If the juggernaut does not have all of its hit points at the start of its turn, it loses 10 hit points.

trait.name: Undead Nature
entries: The juggernaut doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The juggernaut makes two Claws attacks.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Avalanche of Bones {@recharge 5}
entries: The juggernaut collapses into a large heap before quickly reforming. Each creature within 10 feet of the juggernaut must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 18 ({@damage 4d8}) bludgeoning damage and is knocked {@condition prone}. On a success, a creature takes half as much damage and is not knocked {@condition prone}.

monster.name: Skeleton
languages: understands all languages it spoke in life but can't speak

trait.name: Undead Nature
entries: The skeleton doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Shortbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

monster.name: Skeleton Commander
languages: understands all languages it spoke in life but can't speak

trait.name: Tenacity of Bones
entries: In combat, as long as the skeleton isn't {@condition incapacitated} or surprised, it exudes an aura of resilience in a 30-foot-radius around it. Whenever the skeleton or another Skeleton starts its turn in the aura, it gains 3 ({@dice 1d6}) temporary hit points, which last until the start of its next turn.

trait.name: Undead Nature
entries: The skeleton doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The skeleton makes two Shortsword or Longbow attacks.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage.

bonus.name: Command Ally
entries: The wight targets one allied Skeleton it can see within 30 feet of it. If the target can see and hear the skeleton, the target can make one weapon attack as a reaction against a creature the skeleton chooses that it can see.

monster.name: Skulking Cyst
languages: understands all languages it spoke in life but can't speak

trait.name: Compression
entries: The cyst can move through any opening at least 1-foot wide without squeezing.

trait.name: Poison Splash
entries: When the cyst takes damage of any type but psychic, each creature within 5 feet of the cyst takes 4 ({@damage 1d8}) poison damage.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The cyst regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn. If the cyst takes acid or fire damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the cyst's next turn.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The cyst can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The cyst makes two Intestine attacks. If both attacks hit the same creature, the cyst uses Attach on it.

action.name: Intestine
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) bludgeoning damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) poison damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition poisoned} until the start of the cyst's next turn.

action.name: Attach
entries: The cyst attaches to a creature within 5 feet of it and pulls itself into the target's space. While attached, the cyst moves with the target and has advantage on attack rolls against it.

A creature can use its action to try to detach the cyst and force it to move into the nearest unoccupied space, doing so with a successful {@dc 13} Strength check. On its turn, the cyst can detach itself from the target by using 5 feet of movement. When it dies, the cyst detaches from any creature it is attached to.

action.name: Necrotic Cyst {@recharge 5}
entries: The cyst forces a creature it's attached to to make a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw, unless that creature is a Construct, Elemental, Ooze, or Plant. A creature takes 27 ({@damage 6d8}) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Additionally, on a failed saving throw, the cyst implants a cancerous disease into the target's body. The disease takes the form of a cyst-like growth that forms around one of the target's bones or organs. While the cyst lasts, the target has vulnerability to necrotic and poison damage and every 24 hours, its Constitution score is reduced by 1. The target dies if this reduces its Constitution score to 0. Until the cyst is removed, the reduction can't be ended by any means short of a {@spell wish} spell.

The cyst can be destroyed by any effect that cures a disease or via a surgery that takes 8 hours and requires a surgeon to succeed on a {@dc 20} Wisdom (Medicine) check. If the check fails, the creature with the cyst must succeed on a death saving throw or die.

If the target dies while the cyst remains, the cyst remains in the corpse and grows to overtake it after {@dice 1d4} days, becoming a new skulking cyst. Any effect that cures disease or removes the {@condition poisoned} condition that targets the corpse instantly kills the cyst.

trait.name: Evasion
entries: If the skin kite is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, the skin kite instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

trait.name: Undead Nature
entries: The skin kite doesn't require air, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: Wasting
entries: The skin kite regains no hit points from a long rest or from expending Hit Dice.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The skin kite either makes a Meld attack and a Flense attack or two Flense attacks.

action.name: Meld
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) piercing damage, and if the target has skin, the skin kite attaches to the target and pulls itself into the target's space. While attached, the skin kite moves with the target and has advantage on attack rolls against it.

A creature can use its action to try to detach the skin kite and force it to move into the nearest unoccupied space, doing so with a successful {@dc 14} Strength check. On its turn, the skin kite can detach itself from the target by using 5 feet of movement. When it dies, the skin kite detaches from any creature it is attached to. Regardless of how, when the skin kite detaches from a creature, the creature takes 13 ({@damage 4d4 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Flense
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 0 ft., one creature the skin kite is attached to. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) necrotic damage and the target's hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage dealt. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0. The skin kite then regains hit points equal to the necrotic damage dealt. If this healing restores the skin kite to its hit point maximum, it adds the excess to a special pool of hit points that the skin kite can tap into to fuel its Launch Kite action.

action.name: Launch Kite (1/Day)
entries: The skin kite takes 100 damage. If the skin kite has any hit points in the pool granted by its Flense action, it can spend any number of points from that pool to gain that many temporary hit points immediately before taking this damage. If the skin kite has at least 1 hit point after taking this damage, it creates another skin kite in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of it. The second skin kite is allied to its creator.

monster.name: Sluagh
languages: the languages it knew in life

trait.name: Death Sense
entries: The sluagh is aware of the presence of creatures within 5 miles of it that has half its hit points or less, is afflicted with a deadly curse, disease, or poison, or that has been dead for less than a minute. It knows the approximate distance and direction to the target as well as its current hit points, but can't sense anything else about it.

trait.name: Flyby
entries: The sluagh doesn't provoke an opportunity attack when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The sluagh can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, the sluagh has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.
Weakness to the Western Winds The sluagh can't use its Incorporeal Movement to pass through solid surfaces or sides of objects that are facing west.
Additionally, whenever the sluagh moves to the west, it must spend 2 feet of movement for every 1 foot it moves.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The sluagh makes two Claw attacks.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Expunge Soul
entries: The sluagh chooses a creature it can see that's dying or is {@condition frightened} of the sluagh. The target must make a {@dc 15} Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 36 ({@damage 8d8}) necrotic damage and if it's dying, it loses any of its current death saving throw successes. On a success, a creature takes half as much damage and is otherwise unaffected. A creature that is reduced to 0 hit points by this damage automatically fails a death saving throw.

If a creature is killed by this action, its soul is drained from its body and the sluagh regains 26 ({@dice 4d12}) hit points. A new sluagh rises from the corpse at the next midnight. A creature who is killed in this manner can't be resurrected by any means short of the {@spell wish} spell, unless the sluagh that killed it is killed before the next midnight.

action.name: Exile's Cry {@recharge}
entries: The sluagh lets out a wailing scream that can be heard up to 200 feet away. Any non-Undead creature that hears the sluagh must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} of the sluagh for 1 minute. While {@condition frightened} in this way, the creature is {@condition paralyzed}.
The effect ends for a creature if it takes any damage or if someone else uses an action to shake the creature out of its paralyzing fear.

monster.name: Unrequited
languages: the languages it knew in life

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The unrequited can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The unrequited has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Weakness to Jealousy
entries: Whenever the unrequited sees or hears two or more other creatures within 60 feet of them display open affection, it is overcome with jealousy. Until the end of its next turn, while it can see the offending creatures, the unrequited can't willingly move closer to them and it has disadvantage on attack rolls.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The unrequited makes two Lonely Caress attacks.

action.name: Lonely Caress
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 3d6 + 4}) psychic damage.

action.name: Charm
entries: One Humanoid the unrequited can see within 30 feet of it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or be magically {@condition charmed} for 1 day. The {@condition charmed} target regards the unrequited with total admiration, romantic or otherwise (whichever would be more appropriate for it). Although the target isn't under the unrequited's control, it takes the unrequited's requests or actions in the most favorable way it can, and it is a willing target for the unrequited's Death Kiss. If the target takes damage, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on a success. If the target successfully saves against the effect, or if the effect on it ends, the target is immune to this unrequited's Charm for the next 24 hours.
The unrequited can have only one target {@condition charmed} at a time. If it charms another, the effect on the previous target ends.

action.name: Death Kiss
entries: The unrequited kisses a willing creature or an {@condition incapacitated} creature. The target must make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw against this magic, taking 32 ({@damage 5d10 + 5}) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The target's hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.
A creature killed by this action can't be returned to life by any means short of a {@spell wish} spell for as long as the unrequited lives.

bonus.name: Illusory Appearance
entries: The unrequited covers itself with a magical illusion that makes it look like a Medium or Small Humanoid creature with an appearance and voice it chooses. The illusion ends if the unrequited takes a bonus action to end it or if it dies.
The changes wrought by this effect fail to hold up to physical inspection and any physical contact with the unrequited reveal it to be incorporeal.

monster.name: Bloodstarved Vampire
languages: the languages it knew in life

trait.name: Blood Frenzy
entries: The vampire has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all its hit points.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The vampire can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Undead Nature
entries: The vampire doesn't require air.

trait.name: Vampire Weaknesses
entries: The vampire has the following flaws:

trait.name: Forbiddance
entries: The vampire can't enter a residence without an invitation from one of the occupants.

trait.name: Harmed by Running Water
entries: The vampire takes 20 acid damage if it ends its turn in running water.

trait.name: Stake to the Heart
entries: If a piercing weapon made of wood is driven into the vampire's heart while the vampire is {@condition incapacitated} in its resting place, the vampire is {@condition paralyzed} until the stake is removed.

trait.name: Sunlight Hypersensitivity
entries: The vampire takes 20 radiant damage when it starts its turn in sunlight. While in sunlight, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

trait.name: Wasting
entries: The vampire regains no hit points from a long rest or from expending Hit Dice.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The vampire makes four Claw attacks, one of which it can replace with a Bite attack.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) slashing damage plus 5 ({@damage 2d4}) necrotic damage. Instead of dealing damage, the vampire can grapple the target (escape {@dc 15}).

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one willing creature, or a creature that is {@condition grappled} by the vampire, {@condition incapacitated}, or {@condition restrained}. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage plus 14 ({@damage 4d6}) necrotic damage. The target's hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken, and the vampire regains hit points equal to that amount. The reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

bonus.name: Bloodfeast
entries: As long as the vampire has damaged a creature with a Claw attack this turn, it feasts on the spilled blood, regaining 6 ({@dice 1d8 + 2}) hit points.

monster.name: Vampire
languages: the languages it knew in life

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the vampire fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Misty Escape
entries: When it drops to 0 hit points outside its resting place, the vampire transforms into a cloud of mist (as in the Change Shape action) instead of falling {@condition unconscious}, provided that it isn't in sunlight or running water. If it can't transform, it is destroyed.

While it has 0 hit points in mist form, it can't revert to its vampire form, and it must reach its resting place within 2 hours or be destroyed. Once in its resting place, it reverts to its vampire form. It is then {@condition paralyzed} until it regains at least 1 hit point. After spending 1 hour in its resting place with 0 hit points, it regains 1 hit point.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The vampire regains 20 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point and isn't in sunlight or running water. If the vampire takes radiant damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the vampire's next turn.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The vampire can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Undead Nature
entries: The vampire doesn't require air.

trait.name: Vampire Weaknesses
entries: The vampire has the following flaws:

trait.name: Forbiddance
entries: The vampire can't enter a residence without an invitation from one of the occupants.

trait.name: Harmed by Running Water
entries: The vampire takes 20 acid damage if it ends its turn in running water.

trait.name: Stake to the Heart
entries: If a piercing weapon made of wood is driven into the vampire's heart while the vampire is {@condition incapacitated} in its resting place, the vampire is {@condition paralyzed} until the stake is removed.

trait.name: Sunlight Hypersensitivity
entries: The vampire takes 20 radiant damage when it starts its turn in sunlight. While in sunlight, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

action.name: Multiattack (Vampire Form Only)
entries: The vampire makes two Claw attacks, one of which it can replace with a Bite attack.

action.name: Claw (Vampire Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) slashing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) necrotic damage. Instead of dealing damage, the vampire can grapple the target (escape {@dc 18}).

action.name: Bite (Bite or Vampire Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one willing creature, or a creature that is {@condition grappled} by the vampire, {@condition incapacitated}, or {@condition restrained}. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage plus 21 ({@damage 6d6}) necrotic damage. The target's hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken, and the vampire regains hit points equal to that amount. The reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.
A Humanoid slain in this way and then buried in the ground rises the following night as a vampire spawn under the vampire's control.

action.name: Charm
entries: The vampire targets one Humanoid it can see within 30 feet of it. If the target can see the vampire, the target must succeed on a {@dc 17} Wisdom saving throw against this magic or be {@condition charmed} by the vampire. The {@condition charmed} target regards the vampire as a trusted friend to be heeded and protected. Although the target isn't under the vampire's control, it takes the vampire's requests or actions in the most favorable way it can, and it is a willing target for the vampire's Bite attack.

Each time the vampire or the vampire's companions do anything harmful to the target, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success. Otherwise, the effect lasts 24 hours or until the vampire is destroyed, is on a different plane of existence than the target, or takes a bonus action to end the effect.

action.name: Change Shape
entries: If the vampire isn't in sunlight or running water, it can use its action to polymorph into a Tiny bat or a Medium cloud of mist, or back into its true form.

While in bat form, the vampire can't speak, its walking speed is 5 feet, and it has a flying speed of 30 feet. Its statistics, other than its size and speed, are unchanged. Anything it is wearing transforms with it, but nothing it is carrying does. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

While in mist form, the vampire can't take any actions, speak, or manipulate objects. It is weightless, has a flying speed of 20 feet, can hover, and can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. In addition, if air can pass through a space, the mist can do so without squeezing, and it can't pass through water. It has advantage on Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution saving throws, and it is immune to all nonmagical damage, except the damage it takes from sunlight.

action.name: Children of the Night (1/Day)
entries: The vampire magically calls {@dice 2d4} swarms of bats or rats, provided that the sun isn't up. While outdoors, the vampire can call {@dice 3d6} wolves instead. The called creatures arrive in {@dice 1d4} rounds, acting as allies of the vampire and obeying its spoken commands. The beasts remain for 1 hour, until the vampire dies, or until the vampire dismisses them as a bonus action.

legendary.name: Claw
entries: The vampire makes a Claw attack.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The vampire moves up to its speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

legendary.name: Bite (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The vampire makes a Bite attack.

monster.name: Vampire Spawn
languages: the languages it knew in life

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The vampire regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point. If the vampire takes radiant damage, this trait doesn't function until the start of its next turn.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The vampire can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Undead Nature
entries: The vampire doesn't require air.

trait.name: Vampire Weaknesses
entries: The vampire has the following flaws:

entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one willing creature, or a creature that is {@condition grappled} by the vampire, {@condition incapacitated}, or {@condition restrained}. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage plus 14 ({@damage 4d6}) necrotic damage. The target's hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken, and the vampire regains hit points equal to that amount. The reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

monster.name: Vampire Mistwalker
languages: the languages it knew in life

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the vampire fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Misty Escape
entries: When it drops to 0 hit points outside its resting place, the vampire transforms into a cloud of mist (as in the Change Shape action) instead of falling {@condition unconscious}, provided that it isn't in sunlight or running water. If it can't transform, it is destroyed.

While it has 0 hit points in mist form, it can't revert to its vampire form, and it must reach its resting place within 2 hours or be destroyed. Once in its resting place, it reverts to its vampire form. It is then {@condition paralyzed} until it regains at least 1 hit point. After spending 1 hour in its resting place with 0 hit points, it regains 1 hit point.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The vampire regains 20 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point and isn't in sunlight or running water. If the vampire takes radiant damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the vampire's next turn.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The vampire can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Undead Nature
entries: The vampire doesn't require air.

trait.name: Vampire Weaknesses
entries: The vampire has the following flaws:

trait.name: Forbiddance
entries: The vampire can't enter a residence without an invitation from one of the occupants.

trait.name: Harmed by Running Water
entries: The vampire takes 20 acid damage if it ends its turn in running water.

trait.name: Stake to the Heart
entries: If a piercing weapon made of wood is driven into the vampire's heart while the vampire is {@condition incapacitated} in its resting place, the vampire is {@condition paralyzed} until the stake is removed.

trait.name: Sunlight Hypersensitivity
entries: The vampire takes 20 radiant damage when it starts its turn in sunlight. While in sunlight, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

action.name: Multiattack (Vampire Form Only)
entries: The vampire makes two Claw attacks, one of which it can replace with a Bite attack.

action.name: Claw (Vampire Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) slashing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) necrotic damage. Instead of dealing damage, the vampire can grapple the target (escape {@dc 18}).

action.name: Bite (Bite or Vampire Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one willing creature, or a creature that is {@condition grappled} by the vampire, {@condition incapacitated}, or {@condition restrained}. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage plus 21 ({@damage 6d6}) necrotic damage. The target's hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken, and the vampire regains hit points equal to that amount. The reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.
A Humanoid slain in this way and then buried in the ground rises the following night as a vampire spawn under the vampire's control.

action.name: Charm
entries: The vampire targets one Humanoid it can see within 30 feet of it. If the target can see the vampire, the target must succeed on a {@dc 17} Wisdom saving throw against this magic or be {@condition charmed} by the vampire. The {@condition charmed} target regards the vampire as a trusted friend to be heeded and protected. Although the target isn't under the vampire's control, it takes the vampire's requests or actions in the most favorable way it can, and it is a willing target for the vampire's Bite attack.

Each time the vampire or the vampire's companions do anything harmful to the target, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success. Otherwise, the effect lasts 24 hours or until the vampire is destroyed, is on a different plane of existence than the target, or takes a bonus action to end the effect.

action.name: Children of the Night (1/Day)
entries: The vampire magically calls {@dice 2d4} swarms of bats or rats, provided that the sun isn't up. While outdoors, the vampire can call {@dice 3d6} wolves instead. The called creatures arrive in {@dice 1d4} rounds, acting as allies of the vampire and obeying its spoken commands. The beasts remain for 1 hour, until the vampire dies, or until the vampire dismisses them as a bonus action.

bonus.name: Change Shape
entries: If the vampire isn't in sunlight or running water, it can use its action to polymorph into a Tiny bat or a Medium cloud of mist, or back into its true form.

While in bat form, the vampire can't speak, its walking speed is 5 feet, and it has a flying speed of 30 feet. Its statistics, other than its size and speed, are unchanged. Anything it is wearing transforms with it, but nothing it is carrying does. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

While in mist form, the vampire can't take any actions, speak, or manipulate objects. It is weightless, has a flying speed of 20 feet, can hover, and can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. In addition, if air can pass through a space, the mist can do so without squeezing, and it can't pass through water. It has advantage on Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution saving throws, and it is immune to all nonmagical damage, except the damage it takes from sunlight.

bonus.name: Misty Step
entries: The vampire magically teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

legendary.name: Claw
entries: The vampire makes a Claw attack.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The vampire moves up to its speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

legendary.name: Bite (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The vampire makes a Bite attack.

monster.name: Warrior Vampire
languages: the languages it knew in life

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the vampire fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Misty Escape
entries: When it drops to 0 hit points outside its resting place, the vampire transforms into a cloud of mist (as in the Change Shape action) instead of falling {@condition unconscious}, provided that it isn't in sunlight or running water. If it can't transform, it is destroyed.

While it has 0 hit points in mist form, it can't revert to its vampire form, and it must reach its resting place within 2 hours or be destroyed. Once in its resting place, it reverts to its vampire form. It is then {@condition paralyzed} until it regains at least 1 hit point. After spending 1 hour in its resting place with 0 hit points, it regains 1 hit point.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The vampire regains 20 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point and isn't in sunlight or running water. If the vampire takes radiant damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the vampire's next turn.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The vampire can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Undead Nature
entries: The vampire doesn't require air.

trait.name: Vampire Weaknesses
entries: The vampire has the following flaws:

trait.name: Forbiddance
entries: The vampire can't enter a residence without an invitation from one of the occupants.

trait.name: Harmed by Running Water
entries: The vampire takes 20 acid damage if it ends its turn in running water.

trait.name: Stake to the Heart
entries: If a piercing weapon made of wood is driven into the vampire's heart while the vampire is {@condition incapacitated} in its resting place, the vampire is {@condition paralyzed} until the stake is removed.

trait.name: Sunlight Hypersensitivity
entries: The vampire takes 20 radiant damage when it starts its turn in sunlight. While in sunlight, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

action.name: Multiattack (Vampire Form Only)
entries: The vampire makes two Claw or Greatsword attacks, one of which it can replace with a Bite attack.

action.name: Claw (Vampire Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) slashing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) necrotic damage. Instead of dealing damage, the vampire can grapple the target (escape {@dc 18}).

action.name: Greatsword (Vampire Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) slashing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Bite (Bite or Vampire Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one willing creature, or a creature that is {@condition grappled} by the vampire, {@condition incapacitated}, or {@condition restrained}. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage plus 21 ({@damage 6d6}) necrotic damage. The target's hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken, and the vampire regains hit points equal to that amount. The reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.
A Humanoid slain in this way and then buried in the ground rises the following night as a vampire spawn under the vampire's control.

Although the target isn't under the vampire's control, it takes the vampire's requests or actions in the most favorable way it can, and it is a willing target for the vampire's Bite attack.

Each time the vampire or the vampire's companions do anything harmful to the target, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success. In addition, if air can pass through a space, the mist can do so without squeezing, and it can't pass through water. It has advantage on Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution saving throws, and it is immune to all nonmagical damage, except the damage it takes from sunlight.

The beasts remain for 1 hour, until the vampire dies, or until the vampire dismisses them as a bonus action.

entries: The vampire makes a Claw attack.

legendary.name: Greatsword
entries: The vampire makes a Greatsword attack.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The vampire moves up to its speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

legendary.name: Bite (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The vampire makes a Bite attack.

monster.name: Spellcaster Vampire
languages: the languages it knew in life
