The called creatures arrive in {@dice 1d4} rounds, acting as allies of the vampire and obeying its spoken commands. The beasts remain for 1 hour, until the vampire dies, or until the vampire dismisses them as a bonus action.

action.name: Misty Step
entries: The vampire magically teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

legendary.name: Claw
entries: The vampire makes a Claw attack.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The vampire moves up to its speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

legendary.name: Bite (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The vampire makes a Bite attack.

legendary.name: Cast a Spell (Costs 2 Actions
entries: The vampire uses Spellcasting.

trait.name: Advanced Darkvision
entries: The vasuthant can see in dim light and darkness, magical or nonmagical, as if it were bright light.

trait.name: Aura of Darkness
entries: Whenever the vasuthant enters a space within 30 feet of an nonmagical light source, that light source is extinguished.

trait.name: Flyby
entries: The vasuthant doesn't provoke opportunity attacks when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

trait.name: Life Drain
entries: Whenever the vasuthant deals necrotic damage to a creature, the target's hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to half the damage dealt. The vasuthant then regains hit points equal to half the reducation to the target's hit point maximum. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The vasuthant has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Shadow Form
entries: The vasuthant can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing. In addition, the vasuthant can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. The first time the vasuthant enters a creature's space for the first time on a turn, or whenever a creature enters the vasuthant's space for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, that creature takes 16 ({@damage 3d10}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The vasuthant makes two Tendril attacks then uses either Reel or Gravity Well, if available.

action.name: Tendril
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}The target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 18}). Until the grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained} and it takes 21 ({@damage 3d10 + 5}) necrotic damage at the start of each of its turns.

action.name: Reel
entries: The vasuthant pulls each creature {@condition grappled} by it up to 30 feet in a straight line towards it.

action.name: Gravity Well {@recharge 5}
entries: The vasuthant creates a well of crushing spacetime manipulation that fills a 20-foot-sphere centered on a point it can see within 120 feet of it. The sphere spreads around corners and its area is difficult terrain and is filled with magical darkness. A creature with darkvision can't see through this darkness. Non-magical light, as well as light created by spells of 3rd level or lower, can't illuminate the area. The area lasts for 1 minute, until it's targeted by a {@spell dispel magic} spell, or until the vasuthant dies.

Whenever a creature enters the area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, it must make a {@dc 18} Strength saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 14 ({@damage 4d6}) force damage plus 14 ({@damage 4d6}) necrotic damage and suffers the effects of the {@spell slow} spell until the start of the vasuthant's next turn. On a success, a creature takes half as much damage and is otherwise unaffected.

reaction.name: Reality Distortion (3/Day)
entries: In response to a creature within 30 feet of the vasuthant making an attack roll, ability check, or saving throw, the vasuthant forces that creature to roll an additional {@dice d20} and use either the lowest or highest result of all d20s rolled (its choice).

monster.name: Wight

resist.note: from nonmagical attacks that aren't silvered

languages: the languages it knew in life

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, the wight has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Undead Nature
entries: The wight doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The wight makes two Longsword or Longbow attacks. It can replace one attack with a Life Drain attack.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) slashing damage, or 8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) slashing damage if used with two hands.

action.name: Life Drain
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) necrotic damage and the wight then regains hit points equal to the damage dealt. The target must then succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

A Humanoid slain by this attack rises 1 minute later as a zombie under the wight's control, unless the Humanoid is restored to life or its body is destroyed. The wight can have no more than twelve zombies under its control at one time.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage.

monster.name: Wight Apostle

resist.note: from nonmagical attacks that aren't silvered

languages: the languages it knew in life

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The wight casts one of the following spells, using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 14}, {@hit 6} to hit with spell attacks):

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, the wight has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Undead Nature
entries: The wight doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The wight makes one Flail attack and one Life Drain attack. It can replace one attack with a use of Spellcasting.

action.name: Flail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) bludgeoning damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Life Drain
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 30 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) necrotic damage and the wight then chooses an allied Undead within 30 feet of it. That creature regains hit points equal to the damage dealt. The attack's target must then succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

A Humanoid slain by this attack rises 1 minute later as a zombie under the wight's control, unless the Humanoid is restored to life or its body is destroyed. The wight can have no more than twelve zombies under its control at one time.

monster.name: Wight Lord

resist.note: from nonmagical attacks that aren't silvered

languages: the languages it knew in life

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, the wight has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Turn Defiance
entries: The wight and any other Wights within 30 feet of it have advantage on saving throws against effects that turn undead.

trait.name: Undead Nature
entries: The wight doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The wight makes two Greatsword or Javelin attacks and one Life Drain attack.

action.name: Greatsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Javelin
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Life Drain
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) necrotic damage and the wight then regains hit points equal to the damage dealt. The target must then succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

A Humanoid slain by this attack rises 1 minute later as a zombie under the wight's control, unless the Humanoid is restored to life or its body is destroyed. The wight can have no more than twelve zombies under its control at one time.

bonus.name: Command Ally
entries: The wight targets one Undead ally it can see within 30 feet of it. If the target can see and hear the wight, the target can make one weapon attack as a reaction against a creature the wight chooses that it can see.

monster.name: Wraith Deathlord

resist.note: from nonmagical attacks that aren't silvered

languages: the languages it knew in life

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The wraith can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If wraith fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The wraith regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point. If the wraith takes radiant damage, this trait doesn't function until the start of its next turn.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, the wraith has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The wraith makes two Life Drain attacks.

action.name: Life Drain
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 30 ft., one target. {@h}22 ({@damage 4d8 + 4}) necrotic damage. The target must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest.

The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0 and its spirit immediately rises in its space as a specter. The specter takes its turn immediately after the wraith on the same initiative count and obeys the wraith's commands.

action.name: Curse of Weakness {@recharge 5}
entries: The wraith forces a creature that it can see within 60 feet of it to make a {@dc 16} Charisma saving throw. On a failure, the target becomes afflicted with a curse for 1 minute. A creature cursed in this way has disadvantage on Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution ability checks and saving throws and its attack rolls that use Strength or Dexterity deal half damage. A creature cursed in this way can repeat its saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. A {@spell remove curse} spell or similar magic also ends the curse.

bonus.name: Summon Specter {@recharge}
entries: The wraith magically summons {@dice 1d4} specters, which appears in an unoccupied space the wraith can see within 60 feet of itself. The specters take their turn immediately after the wraith on the same initiative count and obeys the wraith's commands. The specters disappears after 1 minute or when it or the wraith dies.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The wraith moves up to half its speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

legendary.name: Necrotic Ray
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 8} to hit, range 120 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) necrotic damage.

legendary.name: Lifestutter (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The wraith disrupts life in a 20-    foot-radius around it. Each non-Undead creature caught    in the area must make a {@dc 16} Constitution saving    throw. A creature takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) necrotic damage on a    failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Undead Fortitude
entries: If damage reduces the zombie to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the zombie drops to 1 hit point instead.

trait.name: Undead Nature
entries: The zombie doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Aura of the Undying
entries: As long as the zombie isn't {@condition incapacitated} or turned, it and other Zombies within 30 feet of it have advantage on Constitution saving throws.

trait.name: Undead Fortitude
entries: If damage reduces the zombie to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the zombie drops to 1 hit point instead.

trait.name: Undead Nature
entries: The zombie doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The zombie makes two Claw attacks, one of which it can replace with a Bite attack.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) slashing damage. Instead of dealing damage, the zombie can grapple the target (escape {@dc 13}).

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) piercing damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) necrotic damage. The zombie regains hit points equal to the necrotic damage dealt.

bonus.name: Snarl {@recharge 5}
entries: The zombie snarls towards a creature that it can see within 60 feet of it. Each other Zombie that hears the snarl and can see the target creature when the snarl occurs gains advantage on attack rolls made against that creature until the start of the zombie's next turn.

trait.name: Loathsome Limbs
entries: Whenever the zombie takes at least 5 bludgeoning or slashing damage at one time, roll a {@dice d20} to determine what part of its body is severed.

Until the zombie dies, a severed part acts on the zombie's initiative and has its own action and movement. A severed part has AC 8. Any damage it takes is subtracted from the zombie's hit points. If the zombie is reduced to 0 hit points, all parts of it die.

items.name: 1-8: Leg
entries: One arm is severed from the zombie if it has any legs left. A severed leg has none of the zombie's actions and has a speed of 10 feet. The zombie's speed is halved if it's missing a leg. If it loses both legs, it falls {@condition prone}. With only one arm, it can still crawl. With no arms or legs, its speed is 0 feet, and it can't benefit from bonuses to speed.

items.name: 9-16: Arm
entries: One arm is severed from the zombie if it has any arms left. A severed arm has a speed of 10 feet and can make one Claw attack on its turn. Each time the zombie loses an arm, its Multiattack loses a Claw attack.

items.name: 17-20: Head
entries: The zombie is decapitated. If its head is severed, the zombie loses its bite attack and its body is {@condition blinded} unless the head can see it. The severed head has a speed of 5 feet. It can make a Bite attack, but only against a target in its space.

trait.name: Undead Fortitude
entries: If damage reduces the zombie to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the zombie drops to 1 hit point instead.

trait.name: Undead Nature
entries: The zombie doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The zombie makes one Bite and two Claw attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) slashing damage.

trait.name: Stench
entries: Any creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of the zombie must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} until the start of its next turn. On a successful saving throw, the creature is immune to the zombie's Stench for 24 hours.

trait.name: Undead Fortitude
entries: If damage reduces the zombie to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the zombie drops to 1 hit point instead.

trait.name: Undead Nature
entries: The zombie doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The zombie makes two Slam attacks.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d12 + 4}) slashing damage and the zombie can push it up to 5 feet in any direction horizontal to it. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Avoidance
entries: If the demilich is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a saving throw to take only half damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the demilich fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Phylactery
entries: The demilich's soul is stored inside a phylactery, a Small or Tiny magic object created by it as a part of originally becoming a lich. Whenever the lich sends a creature's soul to the phylactery as a part of its Soul Drain action, the phylactery devours the soul over the course of 24 hours, fuelling the lich's undeath and transforming it back into a fully-fledged lich.

A soul trapped inside a demilich's phylactery can be freed by touching the phylactery and casting the {@spell dispel evil and good} spell or similar magic. A creature whose soul is devoured by a lich's phylactery can't be revived by any means short of a {@spell wish} spell.

When the demilich dies, if it's phylactery is intact, it gains a new body in {@dice 1d10} days, regaining all its hit points and becoming active again. The new body appears within 5 feet of the phylactery.
The phylactery has AC 20, 50 hit points, and immunity to all damage except radiant damage. It regains all its hit points at the end of each turn.

trait.name: Turn Immunity
entries: The demilich is immune to effects that turn Undead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The demilich uses Life Drain three times.

action.name: Life Drain
entries: The demilich targets one creature that it can see within 10 feet of it. The target must succeed on a {@dc 19} Constitution saving throw or take 21 ({@damage 6d6}) necrotic damage, and the demilich regains hit points equal to the damage dealt.

action.name: Soul Drain
entries: The demilich draws the soul from a dead creature within 10 feet of it, magically sending that creature's soul to its phylactery, if it's phylactery doesn't already contain a soul.

action.name: Howl {@recharge 5}
entries: The demilich emits a bloodcurdling howl. Each creature within 30 feet of the demilich that can hear the howl must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or drop to 0 hit points. On a successful save, the creature is instead {@condition frightened} until the end of its next turn.

legendary.name: Cloud of Dust
entries: The demilich magically swirls its dusty remains. Each creature within 10 feet of the demilich, including around a corner, must succeed on a {@dc 19} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition blinded} until the end of the demilich's next turn. A creature that succeeds on the saving throw is immune to this effect until the end of the demilich's next turn.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The demilich moves up to half its speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

legendary.name: Life Drain (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The demilich uses Life Drain.

legendary.name: Vile Curse (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The demilich targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must succeed on a {@dc 19} Wisdom saving throw or be magically cursed. Until the curse ends, the target has disadvantage on attack rolls and saving throws. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the curse on a success.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting (Psionics)
headerEntries: The aboleth casts one of the following spells, requiring no components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 16}):

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The aboleth can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the aboleth fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Mucous Cloud
entries: While underwater, the aboleth is surrounded by transformative mucus. A creature that touches the aboleth or that hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it must make a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the creature is diseased for {@dice 1d4} hours. The diseased creature can breathe only underwater. If a creature's saving throw is successful, the creature is immune to the aboleth's Mucous Cloud for the next 1 hour.

trait.name: Perfect Memory
entries: The aboleth remembers everything it and its ancestors have ever experienced in perfect detail and their memories can't be altered by magic such as the {@spell modify memory} spell.

trait.name: Probing Telepathy
entries: If a creature communicates telepathically with the aboleth, the aboleth learns the creature's greatest desires if the aboleth can see the creature.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The aboleth makes three Tentacle attacks.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 3d6 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Tentacle
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or become diseased. If a creature's saving throw is successful, the creature succeeds on all further saving throws against this disease for the next hour. The disease has no effect for 1 minute and can be removed by any magic that cures disease. After 1 minute, the diseased creature's skin becomes translucent and slimy, the creature can't regain hit points unless it is underwater, and the disease can be removed only by the {@spell heal} spell or similar magic. When the creature is outside a body of water, it takes 6 ({@damage 1d12}) acid damage every 10 minutes unless moisture is applied to the skin before 10 minutes have passed.

action.name: Enslave (3/Day)
entries: The aboleth targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw or be magically {@condition charmed} by the aboleth until the aboleth dies or until it is on a different plane of existence from the target. The {@condition charmed} target is under the aboleth's control and can't take reactions, and the aboleth and the target can communicate telepathically with each other over any distance.

legendary.name: Detect
entries: The aboleth makes a Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) check.

legendary.name: Tail
entries: The aboleth makes a Tail attack.

legendary.name: Psychic Drain (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The aboleth chooses a creature that it can see within 120 feet of itself. The target takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) psychic damage and the aboleth regains hit points equal to the damage dealt. An unwilling creature can avoid this damage with a successful {@dc 16} Intelligence saving throw.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting (Psionics)
headerEntries: The aboleth casts one of the following spells, requiring no components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 16}):

When the creature is outside a body of water, it takes 6 ({@damage 1d12}) acid damage every 10 minutes unless moisture is applied to the skin before 10 minutes have passed.

The target must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw or be magically {@condition charmed} by the aboleth until the aboleth dies or until it is on a different plane of existence from the target. The {@condition charmed} target is under the aboleth's control and can't take reactions, and the aboleth and the target can communicate telepathically with each other over any distance.

legendary.name: Detect
entries: The aboleth makes a Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) check.

legendary.name: Tail
entries: The aboleth makes a Tail attack.

legendary.name: Cast a Spell (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The aboleth uses Spellcasting.

legendary.name: Psychic Drain (Costs 2 Actions)

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting (Psionics)
headerEntries: The aboleth casts one of the following spells, requiring no components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 18}):

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The aboleth can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Creature Sense
entries: The aboleth is aware of the presence of creatures within 2 miles of it that have an Intelligence score of 4 or higher. It knows the distance and direction to each creature, as well as each creature's Intelligence score, but can't sense anything else about it. A creature protected by a {@spell mind blank} spell, a {@spell nondetection} spell, or similar magic can't be perceived in this manner.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the aboleth fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Mucous Cloud
entries: While underwater, the aboleth is surrounded by transformative mucus. A creature that touches the aboleth or that hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it must make a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the creature is diseased for {@dice 1d4} hours. The diseased creature can breathe only underwater. If a creature's saving throw is successful, the creature is immune to the aboleth's Mucous Cloud for the next 1 hour.

trait.name: Perfect Memory
entries: The aboleth remembers everything it and its ancestors have ever experienced in perfect detail and their memories can't be altered by magic such as the {@spell modify memory} spell.

trait.name: Probing Telepathy
entries: If a creature communicates telepathically with the aboleth, the aboleth learns the creature's greatest desires if the aboleth can see the creature.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The aboleth makes three Tentacle attacks.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}20 ({@damage 3d8 + 7}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Tentacle
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d8 + 7}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw or become diseased. If a creature's saving throw is successful, the creature succeeds on all further saving throws against this disease for the next hour. The disease has no effect for 1 minute and can be removed by any magic that cures disease. After 1 minute, the diseased creature's skin becomes translucent and slimy, the creature can't regain hit points unless it is underwater, and the disease can be removed only by the {@spell heal} spell or similar magic. When the creature is outside a body of water, it takes 6 ({@damage 1d12}) acid damage every 10 minutes unless moisture is applied to the skin before 10 minutes have passed.

action.name: Enslave (5/Day)
entries: The aboleth targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must succeed on a {@dc 18} Wisdom saving throw or be magically {@condition charmed} by the aboleth until the aboleth dies or until it is on a different plane of existence from the target. The {@condition charmed} target is under the aboleth's control and can't take reactions, and the aboleth and the target can communicate telepathically with each other over any distance.

legendary.name: Detect
entries: The aboleth makes a Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) check.

legendary.name: Psychic Drain
entries: The aboleth chooses a creature that it can see within 120 feet of itself. The target takes 10 ({@dice 3d6})    psychic damage and the aboleth regains hit points equal    to the damage dealt. An unwilling creature can avoid this    damage with a successful {@dc 18} Intelligence saving throw.

legendary.name: Tail
entries: The aboleth makes a Tail attack.

monster.name: Albator
languages: understands Common and Deep Speech but can't speak

trait.name: Keen Sight
entries: The albator has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Invisibility
entries: The albator is {@condition invisible}.

trait.name: Mindweight (1/Turn)
entries: When the albator deals damage to a creature with one or more levels of {@condition exhaustion}, that creature takes an extra 10 ({@damage 3d6}) psychic damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The albator makes two Talon attacks.

action.name: Talon
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) slashing damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) psychic damage.

bonus.name: Tormentous Tether
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}The albator wraps its spectral tail around the target, linking itself to them. While the link persists, the target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Wisdom at the start of each of its turns or gain one level of {@condition exhaustion}. Whenever a creature gains a level of {@condition exhaustion} in this way, the albator regains 8 ({@dice 2d6 + 1}) hit points.

The link lasts until the albator ends its turn more than 15 feet away from the linked target, until the albator becomes {@condition incapacitated} or dies, or until the albator links with another creature.

monster.name: Avolakia
languages: Avolakia plus two more languages but can only speak Avolakia unless it's in Humanoid Form

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The avolakia casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 18}, {@hit 10} to hit with spell attacks):

trait.name: Hypnotic Voice (Humanoid Form Only)
entries: If the avolakia speaks to a single Humanoid for at least 1 minute, it can attempt to hypnotize that creature. The target must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw or be compelled to follow one instruction issued by the avolakia of the avolakia's choice, as per the {@spell suggestion} spell. The creature must understand the avolakia to be affected.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The avolakia has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The avolakia regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn. If the avolakia takes acid or lightning damage, this trait doesn't function until the start of its next turn. The avolakia dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

trait.name: Slippery
entries: The avolakia has advantage on ability checks and saving throws made to avoid or escape a grapple or the {@condition restrained} condition.

trait.name: Stench
entries: Any creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of the avolakia must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} until the start of its next turn. On a successful saving throw, the creature is immune to the avolakia's Stench for 24 hours.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The avolakia makes four Claw attacks and one Bite attack.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}20 ({@damage 3d10 + 4}) piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage. If the target, it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or become afflicted with avolakia poison. When a creature first becomes afflicted and every 1 hour thereafter, their Wisdom score is reduced by {@dice 2d4}. The creature becomes {@condition blinded}, {@condition deafened}, and unaware of its surroundings if this reduces its Wisdom score to 0. While it's unaware of its surroundings in this way, any attack that hits the creature is a critical hit if the attacker is within 5 feet of the creature. These effects persist until it regains at least one point of Wisdom.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Change Shape
entries: The avolakia polymorphs into a Small or Medium Humanoid, or back into its true form. Its statistics, other than its size, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies. The avolakia's form is a perfect transformation, save for the foul-smelling slime that oozes from its pores.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The bakume casts one of the following spells, requiring no components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 15}):

trait.name: Dream Eater
entries: The bakume can spend 1 minute consuming either the dreams or the nightmares of an {@condition unconscious} creature within 5 feet of it. During this time, the bakume loses its Invisibility trait. Upon completion, the bakume regains 13 ({@dice 2d8 + 4}) hit points and the target is affected in one of the following ways based on whether its dreams or nightmares were devoured:

items.name: Dreams
entries: The target becomes cursed. While cursed in this way, the target is overcome with melancholy and it suffers disadvantage on ability checks and saving throws.

Additionally, when the creature finishes a long rest, it regains only half of its lost hit points and only a fourth of its total Hit Dice (if it's missing any). A {@spell remove curse} spell or similar magic ends the curse and its effects.

items.name: Nightmares
entries: The target becomes blessed for 7 days. During this time, it has advantage on saving throws and whenever it finishes a long rest, it gains temporary hit points equal to its level and it regains all of its spent Hit Dice, instead of only half.

trait.name: Dream Sight
entries: The bakume instantly knows the greatest fears and desires of any Humanoid creature it sees. A creature protected by a {@spell mind blank} spell or similar magic appears to have no fears or desires to the bakume.

trait.name: Invisible
entries: The bakume is {@condition invisible}.

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
entries: The bakume has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The bakume has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Unusual Nature
entries: The bakume doesn't require sleep.

action.name: Trunk
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Project Dreams
entries: The bakume sends out a wave of pleasant dream energy in a 30-foot-long, 5-foot-wide line. Each creature in the area gains 13 ({@dice 2d8 + 4}) temporary hit points, which last for 1 hour.

action.name: Project Nightmares
entries: The bakume sends a wave of nightmarish dream energy in a 30-foot-long, 5-foot-wide line. Each creature in the area must make a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw, taking 17 ({@damage 5d6}) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Sleep Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The bakume exhales a sleeping gas in a 20-foot cone. Each creature in the area must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or fall {@condition unconscious} for 8 hours. This effect ends for a creature if the creature takes damage or if someone uses an action to shake them away. If the creature remains asleep for the full duration, it gains the benefits of a long rest.

trait.name: Reactive
entries: The director can take one reaction on every turn in combat.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The director makes three Tentacle attacks. If it's mounted, it makes only two Tentacle attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 3d6}) piercing damage.

action.name: Tentacle
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 2d4 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Eye Rays
entries: The director shoots three of the following magical eye rays at random (reroll duplicates), choosing one to three targets it can see within 120 feet of it:

items.name: 1. Enervation Ray
entries: The target must make a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw, taking 18 ({@damage 4d8}) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

items.name: 2. Fire Ray
entries: The target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw or take 22 ({@damage 4d10}) fire damage.

items.name: 3. Force Ray
entries: The target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw or take 18 ({@damage 4d8}) force damage and be pushed 15 feet directly away from the director and knocked {@condition prone}.

items.name: 4. Freezing Ray
entries: The target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw or take 14 ({@damage 4d6}) cold damage and become {@condition restrained} until the end of its next turn.

items.name: 5. Hallucination Ray
entries: The targeted creature must succeed on a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw or begin seeing an illusion of a second director. The image lasts until the start of the director's next turn and until then it perfectly mimics the director's movements and actions, making it impossible to discern which is the illusion and which is real. While the illusion lasts, the affected creature has disadvantage on saving throws against the director's other Eye Rays and whenever it attempts to target the director with an attack, effect, or spell, other than an area effect, it must roll a {@dice d20}. On a 10 or lower, the attack, effect, or spell targets the illusion and has no effect. A creature that can see through illusions, such as a creature with truesight, is not affected in this way.

items.name: 6. Slowing Ray
entries: The targeted creature must succeed on a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the target's speed is halved for 1 minute. In addition, the creature can't take reactions, and it can take either an action or a bonus action on its turn, not both. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

reaction.name: Deflection Field
entries: The director grants itself and its mount (if it has one) a +3 bonus to AC and Dexterity saving throws against either one attack that would hit one of them or a Dexterity saving throw one or both of them makes. To do so, the director must not be {@condition blinded}.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The eye of the deep can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Low Pressure Weakness
entries: For each hour the eye of the deep spends above water or less than 100 feet below sea level, it must succeed on a {@dc 10} Constitution saving throw or gain one level of {@condition exhaustion}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The eye of the deep makes two Pincer attacks, one of which it can replace with a Bite attack or a use of Eye Rays.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 4d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Pincer
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) piercing damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 14}). The eye of the deep has two pincers, each of which can grapple only one target.

action.name: Eye Rays
entries: The eye of the deep shoots both of the following magical eye rays, choosing one to two targets it can see within 120 feet of it:

items.name: 1. Frost Ray
entries: The target must make a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw, taking 22 ({@damage 4d10}) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

items.name: 2. Paralyzing Ray
entries: The targeted creature must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition paralyzed} for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Project Illusion
entries: The eye of the deep combines its eye rays into a concentrated illusory projection that fills a 30-foot cube centered on a point that it can see within 120 feet of it. The illusion is purely visual; it isn't accompanied by sound, smell, or other sensory effects, but it otherwise looks as realistic as the eye of the deep chooses. The illusion lasts until the eye of the deep loses {@status concentration} (as if {@status concentration||concentrating} on a spell). While {@status concentration||concentrating} on Project Image, the eye of the deep can't use its Eye Rays.

The eye of the deep can use a bonus action to cause the image to move to any spot it can see within 120 feet of it. As the image changes location, the eye of the deep can alter its appearance so that its movements appear natural for the image.

Physical interaction with the image reveals it to be an illusion. A creature that uses its action to examine the image can determine that it is an illusion with a successful {@dc 17} Intelligence ({@skill Investigation}) check. If a creature discerns the illusion for what it is, the creature can see through the image.

bonus.name: Baleful Flash {@recharge 5}
entries: The eye of the deep generates a flash of terrible white light from its central eye that fills a 60-foot cone. Each creature in the area that can see the light must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition blinded} for 1 minute. A creature {@condition blinded} this way can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The eyedra can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Multiple Heads
entries: The eyedra has five heads. While it has more than one head, the eyedra has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition blinded}, {@condition charmed}, {@condition deafened}, {@condition frightened}, {@condition stunned}, and knocked {@condition unconscious}.
Whenever the eyedra takes 30 or more damage in a single turn, one of its heads dies.

At the end of its turn, it grows two heads for each of its heads that died since its last turn, unless it has taken fire damage since its last turn. The eyedra regains 15 hit points for each head regrown in this way.

Each of the eyedra's heads has a unique Eye Ray, chosen by the DM or chosen randomly from the {@table Random Eye Rays|ELDRITCH} table, rerolling any results the eyedra already has. When an eyedra loses a head, it loses that Eye Ray.

trait.name: Reactive Heads
entries: For each head the eyedra has beyond one, it gets an extra reaction that can be used only for opportunity attacks.

trait.name: Wakeful
entries: While the eyedra sleeps, at least one of its heads is awake.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The eyedra makes as many Slam attacks as it has heads.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 1d12 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Eye Rays
entries: The eyedra shoots three of its magical eye rays at random (reroll duplicates), choosing one to three targets it can see within 120 feet of it (see Multiple Heads).

action.name: Ocular Blast {@recharge 5}
entries: The eyedra fires a concentrated beam of force from its central eye in a 120-foot-long, 10-foot-wide line. Each creature caught in the area must make a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw, taking 35 ({@damage 10d6}) force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
A nonmagical object that isn't being worn or carried also takes the damage if it's in the area.

legendary.name: Eye Ray
entries: The eyedra uses one random Eye Ray.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the overseer fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The overseer can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The overseer makes four Tentacle attacks and one Bites attack.

action.name: Bites
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 4d6 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Tentacle
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) bludgeoning damage and the target is pulled up to 10 feet straight towards the overseer.

action.name: Enslave Beholder (5/Day)
entries: The overseer attempts to take control of another Beholder that it can see within 120 feet of it. The target must succeed on a {@dc 19} Wisdom saving throw or become magically {@condition charmed} by the overseer until the overseer dies. The {@condition charmed} target treats the overseer as its master and follows its commands dutifully.

action.name: Eye Rays
entries: The overseer shoots three of the following magical eye rays at random (reroll duplicates), choosing one to three targets it can see within 120 feet of it:

items.name: 1. Charm Ray
entries: If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 19} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition charmed} by the overseer for 1 hour, or until the overseer harms the creature.

items.name: 2. Dispelling Ray
entries: Any spell of 3rd level or lower on the target ends. For each spell of 4th level or higher on the target, the overseer makes a Charisma check. The DC equals 10 + the spell's level. On a successful check, the spell ends.

items.name: 3. Paralyzing Ray
entries: If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 19} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition paralyzed} for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

items.name: 4. Fear Ray
entries: If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

items.name: 5. Madness Ray
entries: If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw or suffer the effects of the {@spell enemies abound|XGE} spell for 1 minute. The target can repeat its saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

items.name: 6. Lightning Ray
entries: The target must make a {@dc 19} Dexterity saving throw, taking 22 ({@damage 4d10}) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
Then up to two different targets of the overseer's choice within 10 feet of the original target are subjected to the ray's effects.

items.name: 7. Slowing Ray
entries: If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 19} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the target's speed is halved for 1 minute. In addition, the creature can't take reactions, and it can take either an action or a bonus action on its turn, not both. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

items.name: 8. Enervation Ray
entries: If the target is a creature, it must make a {@dc 19} Constitution saving throw, taking 36 ({@damage 8d8}) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

items.name: 9. Hemorrhaging Ray
entries: If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 19} Constitution saving throw or lose 14 ({@dice 4d6}) hit points at the start of each of its turns due to dozens of bleeding wounds. Each time the target fails a saving throw against this Eye Ray thereafter, the damage dealt by the wound increases by 14 ({@dice 4d6}). Any creature can take an action to stanch the wounds with a successful {@dc 13} Wisdom ({@skill Medicine}) check. The wounds also closes if the target receives magical healing.

items.name: 10. Telekinetic Ray
entries: If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 19} Strength saving throw or the overseer moves it up to 30 feet in any direction. It is {@condition restrained} by the ray's telekinetic grip until the start of the overseer's next turn or until the overseer is {@condition incapacitated}. If the target is an object weighing 300 pounds or less that isn't being worn or carried, it is moved up to 30 feet in any direction. The overseer can also exert fine control on objects with this ray, such as manipulating a simple tool or opening a door or a container.

items.name: 11. Disintegration Ray
entries: If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 19} Dexterity saving throw or take 45 ({@damage 10d8}) force damage. If this damage reduces the creature to 0 hit points, its body becomes a pile of fine gray dust.

If the target is a Large or smaller nonmagical object or creation of magical force, it is disintegrated without a saving throw. If the target is a Huge or larger object or creation of magical force, this ray disintegrates a 10-foot cube of it.

items.name: 12. Death Ray
entries: If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 19} Dexterity saving throw or take 55 ({@damage 10d10}) necrotic damage. The target dies if the ray reduces it to 0 hit points.

legendary.name: Command Beholderkin
entries: The overseer chooses one allied Beholder within 120 feet of it. The target can immediately use its reaction, if available, to use one of its Eye Rays at random.

legendary.name: Eye Ray
entries: The overseer uses one random Eye Ray.

monster.name: Brightling
languages: understands Deep Speech but can't speak

trait.name: Blinding Light
entries: When a non-Aberration creature starts its turn within 30 feet of the brightling and is able to see it, it must succeed on a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition blinded} for 1 minute. A creature {@condition blinded} in this way can repeat its saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the creature remains {@condition blinded} for 24 hours and it can't remake its saving throw at the end of each of its turns. A {@spell remove curse} spell or similar magic ends the blindness early.

Unless surprised, a creature can avert its eyes to avoid the saving throw at the start of its turn. If the creature does so, it can't see the brightling until the start of its next turn, when it can avert its eyes again. If the creature looks at the brightling in the meantime, it must immediately make the save.

trait.name: Evasion
entries: If the brightling is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, the brightling instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

trait.name: Flyby
entries: The brightling doesn't provoke an opportunity attack when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The brightling is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The brightling can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The brightling has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Unusual Nature
entries: The brightling doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: Variable Illumination
entries: The brightling sheds bright light in a 5 to 30-foot radius and dim light for an additional number of feet equal to the chosen radius. The brightling can alter the radius as a bonus action.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The brightling makes two Touch attacks.

action.name: Touch
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d6 + 6}) radiant damage.

action.name: Ray of Light {@recharge 5}
entries: The brightling flies up to half its speed in a straight line. Each creature whose space it passes through during this movement must make a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw, taking 16 ({@damage 3d10}) radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. An affected creature who hasn't averted its gaze from the brightling must also make a saving throw against its Blinding Light.

monster.name: Swarm of Brightlings
languages: understands Deep Speech but can't speak

trait.name: Blinding Light
entries: When a non-Aberration creature starts its turn within 60 feet of the swarm and is able to see it, it must succeed on a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition blinded} for 1 minute. A creature {@condition blinded} in this way can repeat its saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the creature remains {@condition blinded} for 24 hours and it can't remake its saving throw at the end of each of its turns. A {@spell remove curse} spell or similar magic ends the blindness early.

Unless surprised, a creature can avert its eyes to avoid the saving throw at the start of its turn. If the creature does so, it can't see the swarm until the start of its next turn, when it can avert its eyes again. If the creature looks at the swarm in the meantime, it must immediately make the save.

trait.name: Evasion
entries: If the swarm is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, the swarm instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

trait.name: Flyby
entries: The swarm doesn't provoke an opportunity attack when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The swarm is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The swarm can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The swarm has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Swarm
entries: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny insect. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

trait.name: Unusual Nature
entries: The brightling doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: Variable Illumination
entries: The swarm sheds bright light in a 5 to 60-foot radius and dim light for an additional number of feet equal to the chosen radius. The swarm can alter the radius as a bonus action.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The brightling makes two Touches attacks.

action.name: Touch
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 0 ft., one creature. {@h}20 ({@damage 4d6 + 6}) radiant damage, or 13 ({@damage 2d6 + 6}) radiant damage if the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer.

action.name: Ray of Light {@recharge 5}
entries: The swarm flies up to half its speed in a straight line. Each creature whose space it passes through during this movement must make a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 33 ({@damage 6d10}) radiant damage, or 16 ({@damage 3d10}) radiant damage if the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer. On a success, a creature takes half as much damage. An affected creature who hasn't averted its gaze from the swarm must also make a saving throw against its Blinding Light.

trait.name: Poisonous Slime
entries: A non-Disir creature that touches the disir with exposed skin or that is hit by one of the disir's melee weapon attacks takes 2 ({@damage 1d4}) poison damage.

trait.name: Slippery
entries: The disir has advantage on ability checks and saving throws made to avoid or escape a grapple or the {@condition restrained} condition.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, the disir has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The disir makes two Piercer attacks.

action.name: Piercer
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Climber
entries: The disir has advantage on Strength ({@skill Athletics}) checks made to climb difficult surfaces.

trait.name: Poisonous Slime
entries: A non-Disir creature that touches the disir with exposed skin or that is hit by one of the disir's melee weapon attacks takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) poison damage.

trait.name: Slippery
entries: The disir has advantage on ability checks and saving throws made to avoid or escape a grapple or the {@condition restrained} condition.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, the disir has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The disir makes one Bite attack and two Piercer attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Piercer
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Climber
entries: The disir has advantage on Strength ({@skill Athletics}) checks made to climb difficult surfaces.

trait.name: Poisonous Slime
entries: A non-Disir creature that touches the disir with exposed skin or that is hit by one of the disir's melee weapon attacks takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) poison damage.

trait.name: Slippery
entries: The disir has advantage on ability checks and saving throws made to avoid or escape a grapple or the {@condition restrained} condition.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The disir makes either one Bite attack, two Piercer attacks, and one Tail attack or three Acid Spit attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Piercer
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Tail Spike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Acid Spit
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d6 + 2}) acid damage.

trait.name: Climber
entries: The disir has advantage on Strength ({@skill Athletics}) checks made to climb difficult surfaces.

trait.name: Poisonous Slime
entries: A non-Disir creature that touches the disir with exposed skin or that is hit by one of the disir's melee weapon attacks takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage.

trait.name: Slippery
entries: The disir has advantage on ability checks and saving throws made to avoid or escape a grapple or the {@condition restrained} condition.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, the disir has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The disir makes one Bite attack and two Piercer attacks, each of which it can replace with one use of Command Ally.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Piercer
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Command Ally
entries: The disir targets one ally it can see within 30 feet of it. If the target can see and hear the disir, the target can make one weapon attack as a reaction against a target of the disir's choosing.

action.name: Slime Vomit {@recharge 5}
entries: The disir vomits slime in a 30-foot-long, 10-foot-wide line. Each creature in the area must succeed on a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw or be covered in acid. Objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried are also coated with acid. The acid remains for 1 minute or until a creature uses its action to scrape or wash the acid off itself or another creature or object. A non-Disir creature or object covered in the acid takes 10 ({@damage 4d4}) acid damage at start of each of its turns.

Additionally, a surface coated with acid becomes difficult terrain. Whenever a creature walks onto a surface coated with acid or ends its turn there, it must succeed on a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw or fall {@condition prone} and also become coated with acid. Disir automatically succeed on this saving throw.

trait.name: Amorphous
entries: The dolor can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

trait.name: Aura of Suffering
entries: The dolor emits an aura of pain in a 30-foot-radius around itself. Whenever another creature starts its turn in the area, the dolor can magically force it to make a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) psychic damage and it has disadvantage on the next saving throw it makes before the start of its next turn. On a success, a creature takes half as much damage and is otherwise unaffected.

trait.name: Unusual Nature
entries: The dolor doesn't require, air, drink, or sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The dolor makes two Tentacle attacks and one Essence Grip attack.

action.name: Tentacle
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage plus 5 ({@damage 2d4}) psychic damage.

action.name: Essence Grip
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. {@h}The target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 15}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, can't speak, and the dolor can't use its Essence Grip on another creature.

For as long as the target is {@condition grappled}, it must make a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw at the start of each of its turns. On a failure, the target takes 14 ({@damage 4d6}) psychic damage and its Constitution score is reduced by {@dice 1d4}. The target dies if this reduces its Constitution to 0. Otherwise, the reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. On a success, the target takes half damage and its Constitution remains unaffected.

bonus.name: Shadow Stealth
entries: While in dim light or darkness, the dolor takes the Hide action.

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The fragment can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Mindwarping Presence
entries: Whenever a non-Fragment creature starts its turn within 20 feet of the fragment, that creature must make a {@dc 13} Intelligence saving throw, taking 7 ({@damage 2d6}) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the creature gains one level of {@condition exhaustion}.

trait.name: Unusual Nature
entries: The fragment requires no air, food, drink, or sleep.

action.name: Phase
entries: The fragment magically teleports up to 20 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting (Psionics)
headerEntries: The fragment casts one of the following spells, requiring no components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 15}):

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The fragment can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The fragment has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Unusual Nature
entries: The fragment requires no air, food, drink, or sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The fragment uses its Maddening Presence twice. It can replace one use of Maddening Presence with a use of Spellcasting.

action.name: Maddening Presence
entries: Each creature in the fragment's space must make a {@dc 15} Intelligence saving throw, taking 10 ({@damage 3d6}) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

bonus.name: Mindlure
entries: The fragment touches the mind of a creature that it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must make a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, the target takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) psychic damage and it must immediately use its reaction, if available, to move as far as its speed allows towards the fragment, ending its movement in the fragment's space if possible. On a success, the target takes half as much damage and is not forced to move.

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The fragment can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Unusual Nature
entries: The fragment requires no air, food, drink, or sleep.

action.name: Mind Sap
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 90 ft., one creature. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) psychic damage. The mind dreg regains hit points equal to half the damage dealt.

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The swarm can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Swarm
entries: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny mind dreg. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points by any means short of its Mind Sapping.

trait.name: Unusual Nature
entries: The swarm requires no air, food, drink, or sleep.

action.name: Mind Sapping
entries: {@atk ms,rs} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 0 ft. or reach 90 ft., one creature. {@h}13 ({@damage 4d4 + 3}) psychic damage, or 8 ({@damage 2d4 + 3}) psychic damage if the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer. The mind dreg regains hit points equal to half the damage dealt.

trait.name: Calm Emotions Susceptibility
entries: If targeted by calm emotions, the fragment must succeed on a Constitution saving throw against the caster's spell save DC or fall {@condition unconscious} for 1 minute or until it takes damage.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The fragment has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Reactive
entries: The fragment can take one reaction on every turn in combat.

trait.name: Unusual Nature
entries: The fragment doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The fragment makes two Maddening Touch attacks. It can use Fight or Flight immediately before or after this attack.

action.name: Maddening Touch
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) psychic damage and the target gains one point of Panic. A creature that's immune to psychic damage or the {@condition frightened} condition can't gain Panic. Whenever a creature with one or more Panic would make an attack roll, ability check, or saving throw, it must roll a {@dice d20}. If the result of the roll is equal to or less than the creature's current Panic, the attack roll, ability check, or saving throw automatically fails. If a creature reaches 10 or more Panic, it instantly drops to 0 hit points.

A creature loses all accrued Panic if it spends 1 minute without moving and {@status concentration||concentrating} on quashing its fear (as if {@status concentration||concentrating} on a spell) or if affected by a {@spell calm emotions} spell.

action.name: Fight or Flight
entries: The fragment either makes one Maddening Touch attack with advantage or it flies up to half its speed in a straight line without provoking opportunity attacks.

action.name: Panic Feast {@recharge 5}
entries: For each point of Panic on creatures within 60 feet of itself that it can see, the fragment regains 2 ({@dice 1d4}) hit points.

reaction.name: Panic Response
entries: In response to taking damage, the fragment uses Fight or Flight. The fragment must use this reaction whenever it triggers, if it can.

monster.name: Remnant
languages: understands the languages it knew in life but can't speak

trait.name: Flickering
entries: The fragment is permanently under the effects of the {@spell blink} spell.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The fragment has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Unusual Nature
entries: The fragment doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The fragment makes two Touch attacks. It can then use Mindshatter, if available.

action.name: Touch
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d8 + 2}) psychic damage, and the next time the target makes a saving throw within the next minute, it rolls a {@dice d4} and subtracts the number rolled from the result of its saving throw. Each time the target is hit by the Touch attack of any remnant beyond the first hit, the die size increases by one: the {@dice d4} becomes a {@dice d6}, the {@dice d6} becomes a {@dice d8}, and so on until the die becomes a {@dice d20}.

action.name: Mindshatter {@recharge 5}
entries: The fragment unravels the mind of a creature that it can see within 60 feet of it. The target must make a {@dc 12} Intelligence saving throw. On a failure, the target takes 28 ({@damage 8d6}) psychic damage and becomes {@condition stunned} until the end of the remnant's next turn. On a success, the target takes half as much damage and is not {@condition stunned}.

trait.name: Aberrant Ground
entries: The ground in a 10-foot-radius around the horror is doughlike difficult terrain. Each creature that starts its turn in the area must succeed on a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw or become {@condition restrained} until the start of its next turn.

trait.name: Erode Stone
entries: The horror can eat through 2-inch-thick, nonmagical stone in 1 round.

trait.name: Gibbering
entries: The horror babbles incoherently while it can see any creature and isn't {@condition incapacitated}. Each creature that starts its turn within 20 feet of the horror and can hear the gibbering must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, the creature can't take reactions until the start of its next turn and rolls a {@dice d8} to determine what it does during its turn. On a 1 to 4, the creature does nothing. On a 5 or 6, the creature takes no action or bonus action and uses all its movement to move in a randomly determined direction. On a 7 or 8, the creature makes a melee attack against a randomly determined creature within its reach or does nothing if it can't make such an attack.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The horror regains 15 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point. If the horror takes fire damage, this trait doesn't function until the start of its next turn.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The horror can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Unusual Nature
entries: The horror doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The horror makes two Pseudopod attacks and one Bite attack. It then uses Blinding Spittle.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}20 ({@damage 5d6 + 3}) piercing damage. If the target is Medium or smaller, it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If the target is killed by this damage, it is absorbed into the horror.

action.name: Pseudopod
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage, and the target is pulled up to 10 feet in a straight line towards the horror.

action.name: Blinding Spittle
entries: The horror spits a chemical glob at a point it can see within 20 feet of it. The glob explodes in a blinding flash of light on impact. Each creature within 5 feet of the flash must succeed on a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw or be {@condition blinded} until the end of the horror's next turn.

monster.name: Glitch
languages: understands all languages but speaks only gibberish

trait.name: Distorted Touch
entries: Whenever the glitch comes into contact with a creature, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 12} Charisma saving throw or become cursed with spacetime distortion. If a creature's saving throw is successful, the creature is immune to the glitch's Distorted Touch for the next 1 minute. A creature cursed this way experiences bouts of hallucinating the Far Realm and frequently becomes disassociated with the flow of time. Whenever a creature cursed this way attempts a long rest, it must succeed on a {@dc 12} Wisdom saving throw or gain no benefits from the rest and then gain one level of {@condition exhaustion}.

Additionally, each hour, the cursed creature must roll a {@dice d10}. On a 10, the creature gains the benefits of the {@spell haste} spell for 1 hour. On a 1, the creature suffers the effects of the {@spell slow} spell for the same duration.
The curse can be ended only by a {@spell greater restoration} spell or similar magic.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The glitch has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Unusual Nature
entries: The glitch doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The glitch makes two Touch attacks.

action.name: Touch
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d8 + 2}) psychic damage and the glitch regains hit points equal to half the damage dealt.

bonus.name: Glitched Step
entries: The glitch instantly moves up to its speed in a straight line without provoking opportunity attacks. While moving in this way, the glitch can move through other creatures and objects. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object and is immediately pushed to the nearest unoccupied space.

bonus.name: Temporal Anomaly (Recharges after a Long Rest)
entries: Time briefly freezes in a 120-foot-radius around the glitch until the end of its next turn.. Creatures in the area become {@condition incapacitated} and can't move by any means. Additionally, gravity ceases for all creatures and objects in the area, causing them to remain frozen in place if airborne.

monster.name: Glitch Mattershaper
languages: understands all languages but speaks only gibberish

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The glitch casts one of the following spells, requiring no components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 17}):

trait.name: Distorted Touch
entries: Whenever the glitch comes into contact with a creature, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 17} Charisma saving throw or become cursed with a matter-eroding distortion. If a creature's saving throw is successful, the creature is immune to the glitch's Distorted Touch for the next 1 minute. Whenever a creature cursed this way finishes a long rest, it must succeed on a {@dc 17} Strength, Dexterity, or Constitution saving throw (its choice) or the corresponding ability score is reduced by {@dice 1d4}. The target dies if this reduces any of its ability scores to 0. Otherwise, the reduction lasts until the curse is lifted, whereupon the target's ability scores gradually return to normal over {@dice 1d4} days.
The curse can be ended only by a {@spell greater restoration} spell or similar magic.

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The glitch can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The glitch has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Random Reshaper
entries: Whenever the glitch transforms a creature or object with one of its actions or spells, the form the target takes is determined randomly. If a target would transform into a creature, it can turn into a creature of any type. If a target would transform into an object, it turns into an object of the same size.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The glitch regains 25 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point.

trait.name: Rejection of Steel
entries: Any nonmagical weapon or ammunition that hits the glitch is destroyed after dealing damage.

trait.name: Unusual Nature
entries: The glitch doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The glitch makes two Touch attacks.

action.name: Touch
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}31 ({@damage 6d8 + 4}) necrotic damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw or suffer disadvantage on all attack rolls and ability checks it makes before the start of the glitch's next turn. If the target is a Large or smaller nonmagical object, the glitch can forgo the damage to magically transform the target into another random object. Alternatively the object is Huge or larger, the glitch transforms a 10-foot cube of the target object into another random object instead.

bonus.name: Matter Step
entries: The glitch chooses a Medium or larger object that it can see within 30 feet of itself. The glitch teleports to a space occupied by the target object that it chooses.

bonus.name: Create Servant {@recharge 5}
entries: The glitch targets a Huge or smaller nonmagical object that it can see within 120 feet of it. The target transforms into a creature as per the {@spell true polymorph} spell, except the creature must be CR 5 or lower and the creature remains permanently loyal to the glitch.

monster.name: Glitch Spacebreaker
languages: understands all languages but speaks only gibberish

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The glitch casts one of the following spells, requiring no components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 13}):

trait.name: Distorted Touch
entries: Whenever the glitch comes into contact with a creature, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 13} Charisma saving throw or become cursed with spatial distortion. If a creature's saving throw is successful, the creature is immune to the glitch's Distorted Touch for the next 1 minute. A creature cursed this way becomes disassociated from physical space and it must roll a {@dice d10} at the start of each of its turns. On a 1, the creature vanishes from its current plane of existence and appears in a harmless demiplane. While there, the creature is {@condition incapacitated}. At the start of its next turn, it reappears in the space it left or in the nearest unoccupied space if that space is occupied. It then rolls another {@dice d10}.
The curse can be ended only by a {@spell greater restoration} spell or similar magic.

trait.name: Gravitational Anomaly
entries: The glitch can walk on air as if it were solid ground.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The glitch has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Teleportation Control
