entries: Whenever a non-Glitch creature within 120 feet of the glitch teleports, it must succeed on a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw or its target destination changes to one chosen by the glitch. The glitch understands the limitations of the teleportation it takes control of and must abide by them.

trait.name: Unusual Nature
entries: The glitch doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The glitch makes two Touch attacks.

action.name: Touch
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) force damage and the target is teleported to an unoccupied space within 30 feet of itself that the glitch can see.

action.name: Spatial Shift {@recharge 5}
entries: The glitch creates two 20-foot cubes centered on points that it can see within 120 feet of itself. The cubes can't overlap. Each creature and object in each of the cube teleports to its equivalent position within the other cube. An unwilling creature must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw to resist this effect. If a creature or object is teleported into a space occupied by a creature or another object, both take 14 ({@damage 4d6}) force damage.
Teleporting part of a structure may destabilize connected structures at the DM's discretion.

If an object or structure would fall or collapse, creatures below might be buried; a creature beneath a falling object or collapsing structure must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 17 ({@damage 5d6}) bludgeoning damage, is knocked {@condition prone}, and is trapped in the rubble. A trapped creature is {@condition restrained}, requiring a successful {@dc 20} Strength ({@skill Athletics}) check as an action to escape. Another creature within 5 feet of the buried creature can use its action to clear rubble and grant advantage on the check. If three creatures use their actions in this way, the check is an automatic success. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and doesn't fall {@condition prone} or become trapped.

bonus.name: Glitched Step
entries: The glitch instantly moves up to its speed in a straight line without provoking opportunity attacks. While moving in this way, the glitch can move through other creatures and objects. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object and is immediately pushed to the nearest unoccupied space.

monster.name: Glitch Timebutcher
languages: understands all languages but speaks only gibberish

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The glitch casts one of the following spells, requiring no components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 13}):

trait.name: Dilation
entries: At the start of each of the glitch's turns, it rolls a 6. On a 1, its speed is halved until the start of its next turn. On a 6, its speed is doubled until the start of its next turn.

trait.name: Distorted Touch
entries: Whenever the glitch comes into contact with a creature, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 13} Charisma saving throw or become cursed with temporal distortion. If a creature's saving throw is successful, the creature is immune to the glitch's Distorted Touch for the next 1 minute. A creature cursed this way experiences bouts of hallucinating the Far Realm and frequently becomes disassociated with the flow of time. Whenever a creature cursed this way attempts a long rest, it must succeed on a {@dc 12} Wisdom saving throw or gain no benefits from the rest and then gain one level of {@condition exhaustion}.

Additionally, each hour, the cursed creature must roll a {@dice d10}. On a 10, the creature gains the benefits of the {@spell haste} spell for 1 hour. On a 1, the creature suffers the effects of the {@spell slow} spell for the same duration.
The curse can be ended only by a {@spell greater restoration} spell or similar magic.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The glitch has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Time Kill
entries: A creature killed by the glitch is frozen in time at the exact point of its death. The creature's corpse can't be moved and damaged by any means, time doesn't pass for it, and it can't be returned to life by any means short of a {@spell wish} spell. This effect can be ended on a corpse with a {@spell greater restoration} spell. When the effect ends, the corpse rapidly ages an amount equal to the difference of time between when it died and when the effect ended.

trait.name: Timestamp
entries: At the start of each of its turns, the glitch notes its current hit points and current location. The noted hit points and location each become timestamped.

trait.name: Unusual Nature
entries: The glitch doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The glitch makes two Touch attacks.

action.name: Touch
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}21 ({@damage 4d8 + 3}) necrotic damage and the target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Charisma saving throw or become {@dice 1d8} years older. If this effect brings a creature to an age equal to or greater than its species' average maximum lifespan, it must succeed on a {@dc 11} Constitution saving throw or die from old age. A greater restoration can restore a creature's age to normal.

action.name: Temporal Shunt {@recharge 5}
entries: The glitch forces a creature that it can see within 120 feet of it to make a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, the target takes 36 ({@damage 8d8}) force damage and is thrown to another point in time. The target vanishes, reappearing at the start of the glitch's next turn in the space it left or the nearest unoccupied space if that space is occupied. The target doesn't perceive the passage of time. On a success, the target takes half as much damage and is otherwise unaffected. A creature killed by this damage is erased from time. Every memory of their existence is removed and any evidence to their existence is rationalized as a mistake or unexplainable phenomenon.

bonus.name: Glitched Step
entries: The glitch instantly moves up to its speed in a straight line without provoking opportunity attacks. While moving in this way, the glitch can move through other creatures and objects. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object and is immediately pushed to the nearest unoccupied space.

reaction.name: Reverse
entries: In response to being dealt damage, the glitch teleports to its timestamped location (see Timestamp) or the nearest unoccupied space if that space is occupied. It then gains temporary hit points equal to the difference between its current hit points and its timestamped hit points, which last until the start of its next turn.

monster.name: Helicrux
languages: understands all languages but doesn't speak

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The helicrux casts one of the following spells, requiring no components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 17}):

1e: {@spell maelstrom|XGE} (the  maelstrom is made from inky shadows)

trait.name: Amorphous
entries: The helicrux can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the helicrux fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The helicrux has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The helicrux's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Unusual Nature
entries: The helicrux doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The helicrux makes two Claw or Psychic Bolt attacks and two Tendril attacks. It can replace both Tendril attacks with a use of Steal Soul or Spellcasting.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) slashing damage plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) psychic damage.

action.name: Tendril
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) necrotic damage and the target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or be thrown up to 20 feet and knocked {@condition prone}. If a thrown target strikes a solid surface, the target takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) bludgeoning damage for every 10 feet it was thrown. If the target is thrown at another creature, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw or take the same damage and be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Psychic Bolt
entries: {@atk ms,rs} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 120 ft., one creature. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d6 + 5}) psychic damage.

action.name: Steal Soul
entries: The helicrux begins to take the soul from a creature within 5 feet of it. The target must be {@condition incapacitated}, dying, or be dead and have been dead no longer than 5 minutes. At the start of the helicrux's next turn, if it's still within 5 feet of the target, it steals the creature's soul, killing the creature if it's still alive The helicrux can have up to five souls stolen at a time. A creature whose soul is stolen in this fashion can't be returned to life by any means short of a {@spell wish} spell. The soul can be freed by killing the helicrux. The helicrux can't use this action on a Construct or Undead.

The helicrux can remove one or more souls from its person as an action on a subsequent turn, fashioning them into magical stones. The stones are Tiny objects with AC 17, 5 hit points, and immunity to all damage except force. Destroying the stone or casting the {@spell dispel evil and good} spell on it releases the soul trapped within to the afterlife.

bonus.name: Mindbending Humming
entries: The helicrux begins a magical humming sound. While the humming lasts, all other creatures within 120 feet of the helicrux that can hear the humming can't see, hear, or smell the helicrux by any means, effectively rendering it permanently hidden. Such a creature rationalizes anything done by the helicrux as some kind of supernatural hallucination. A creature immune to the {@condition charmed} condition is unaffected by the humming. The helicrux can stop humming at any time. The humming ends if the helicrux is {@condition incapacitated} or it uses Steal Soul.

bonus.name: Shadow Jaunt
entries: The helicrux teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space it can see. Both the space it teleports from and the space it teleports to must be in dim light or darkness.

legendary.name: Psychic Bolt
entries: The helicrux makes a Psychic Bolt attack.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The helicrux moves up to half its speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

legendary.name: Mindsnap (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The helicrux sends out a wave of mind-breaking energy in a 30-foot-radius around it.
Each creature of its choice within the area must make a {@dc 17} Intelligence saving throw, taking 11 ({@damage 2d10}) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The kaorti casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 13}, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks):

trait.name: Material Weakness
entries: Unless it wears resin armor or is within a kaorti cyst, a kaorti on the Material Plane must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution each hour or gain one level of {@condition exhaustion}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The kaorti makes one Bite attack and one Claws attack.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d4 + 2}) slashing damage.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The cystmother casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 16}, {@hit 8} to hit with spell attacks):

trait.name: Cystmother's Caress
entries: Provided they can see the cystmother, other allied Kaorti within 30 feet of the cystmother have advantage on saving throws.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the cystmother fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Material Weakness
entries: Unless it wears resin armor or is within a kaorti cyst, a cystmother on the Material Plane must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution each hour or gain one level of {@condition exhaustion}.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The cystmother regains 20 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point. This trait doesn't function if the cystmother isn't inside a kaorti cyst.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The cystmother can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The cystmother makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks. It can replace its Bite attack with a use of ACid Bile, Spellcasting, or Cystic Spawning, if available.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d10 + 5}) piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) acid damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d6 + 5}) slashing damage.

action.name: Acid Bile
entries: The cystmother sprays a mixture of acidic bile and sticky resin in a 30-foot-long, 5-foot-wide line. Each creature in the area must succeed on a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw or become covered in acid until a creature uses its action to scrape or wash the acid off itself or another creature. A creature covered in acid takes 10 ({@damage 4d4}) acid damage at the start of each of its turns.

action.name: Cystic Spawning {@recharge 5}
entries: The cystmother creates an infantile kaorti cyst in an unoccupied space that it can see within 60 feet of it. The cyst is a Small object with AC 16, 30 hit points, and immunity to piercing and psychic damage. When reduced to 0 hit points, the cyst collapses into harmless slime and is destroyed. Until it's destroyed, the cyst emits a constant, droning hum from the Far Realm that fills a 30-foot-radius sphere around it. Whenever a creature other than an Aberration enters the area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, if it's able to hear the cyst, it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition deafened} until the start of its next turn. A creature {@condition deafened} in this way can still hear the droning, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks, and it must spend 2 feet of movement for every 1-foot it moves.

legendary.name: Claw
entries: The cystmother makes a Claw attack.

legendary.name: Command Ally
entries: The cystmother targets one ally it can see within 30 feet of it. If the target can see and hear the cystmother, the target can make one weapon attack as a reaction against a target of the cystmother's choosing.

legendary.name: Dissonant Whispers
entries: The cystmother uses Spellcasting to cast the {@spell dissonant whispers} spell.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The kaorti casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 13}, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks):

trait.name: Material Weakness
entries: Unless it wears resin armor or is within a kaorti cyst, a kaorti on the Material Plane must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution each hour or gain one level of {@condition exhaustion}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The kaorti makes one Bite attack and two Ribbon Blade attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Ribbon Blade
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) slashing damage. If the target is a creature other than an Undead or a Construct, it must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or lose 2 ({@dice 1d4}) hit points at the start of each of its turns due to a bleeding wound. Each time the kaorti hits the wounded target with this attack, the damage dealt by the wound increases by 2 ({@dice 1d4}). Any creature can take an action to stanch the wound with a successful {@dc 10} Wisdom ({@skill Medicine}) check. The wound also closes if the target receives magical healing.

bonus.name: Second Wind (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: The kaorti regains 8 ({@dice 1d10 + 3}) hit points.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The kaorti casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 15}, {@hit 7} to hit with spell attacks):

trait.name: Material Weakness
entries: Unless it wears resin armor or is within a kaorti cyst, a kaorti on the Material Plane must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution each hour or gain one level of {@condition exhaustion}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The kaorti makes either one Bite attack and one Claws attacks or three Arcane Burst attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d4 + 2}) slashing damage.

action.name: Arcane Burst
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 7} to hit, range 90 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) force damage.

action.name: Eldritch Eruption {@recharge 5}
entries: The kaortic creates an explosion of alien light from the Far Realm that fills a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on a point that it can see within 120 feet of it. Each creature in the area must make a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 14 ({@damage 4d6}) psychic damage plus 14 ({@damage 4d6}) radiant damage and it is {@condition blinded} for 1 minute. A creature {@condition blinded} in this way can repeat its saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the creature suffers a random bout of Long-Term Madness (see page 259 of the Dungeon Master's Guide). On a success, a creature takes half as much damage and is not {@condition blinded}.

reaction.name: Resinous Shield
entries: The kaorti adds 3 to the AC of itself or an allied Kaorti within 60 feet of it against an attack that would hit. To do so, the kaorti must see the attacker and the target.

trait.name: Awareness
entries: The kaortic hulk has advantage on initiative rolls and can't be surprised as long as it isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Climber
entries: The kaortic hulk has advantage on Strength ({@skill Athletics}) checks made to climb difficult surfaces.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The kaortic hulk has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Smell Reliance
entries: If it can't smell, the kaortic hulk is {@condition blinded} and {@condition deafened}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The kaortic hulk makes one Bite attack and one Claws attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 2d4 + 3}) slashing damage.

reaction.name: Readiness
entries: When a creature the kaortic hulk can see within 60 feet of itself ends its turn, the kaortic hulk makes one Claw attack. It can move up to half its speed without provoking opportunity attacks immediately before or after the attack.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The kaortic hulk casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 13}):

trait.name: Awareness
entries: The kaortic hulk has advantage on initiative rolls and can't be surprised as long as it isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Climber
entries: The kaortic hulk has advantage on Strength ({@skill Athletics}) checks made to climb difficult surfaces.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The kaortic hulk has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Smell Reliance
entries: If it can't smell, the kaortic hulk is {@condition blinded} and {@condition deafened}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The kaortic hulk makes one Bite attack, one Claws attacks, and one Tail attack. It can't make its Bite and Tail attacks against the same target.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}21 ({@damage 3d10 + 5}) piercing damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 16}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the kaortic hulk can't bite another target.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d4 + 5}) slashing damage.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

reaction.name: Readiness
entries: When a creature the kaortic hulk can see within 60 feet of itself ends its turn, the kaortic hulk makes one Claw attack. It can move up to half its speed without provoking opportunity attacks immediately before or after the attack.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The marauder has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The marauder's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Magnetic Body
entries: Any weapon made of metal that hits the marauder is magnetically attracted to it. After dealing damage, the weapon's wielder must make a {@dc 12} Strength saving throw or lose their grip on the weapon as it becomes magnetically adhered to the marauder's body until the marauder uses a bonus action on its turn to release all objects adhered to it.
A creature can use its action while within 5 feet of the marauder to make a {@dc 16} Strength ({@skill Athletics}) check, freeing an adhered object on a success.

trait.name: Tunneller
entries: The marauder can burrow through solid rock at half its burrowing speed and leaves a 12 foot-wide, 10-foot-high tunnel in its wake.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The marauder makes two Claw attacks and one Bite attack. It can replace its Bite attack with a use of Metallic Uprising, if available.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d12 + 4}) slashing damage plus 14 ({@damage 4d6}) lightning damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) slashing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) lightning damage.

action.name: Metallic Uprising {@recharge 5}
entries: The marauder unleashes a wave of electromagnetic energy in a 30-foot-radius around it. Each metal object within the area that is not being worn or carried is automatically affected. Any creature that is wearing metal armor must succeed on a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw or be affected. Any creature that is holding a metal object must make a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw or that object is affected.
An affected target is pushed 30 feet into the air and held aloft and {@condition restrained} there until the end of the marauder's next turn.

bonus.name: Magnetic Manipulation
entries: The marauder points to a metal object that it can see within 30 feet of it that weighs no more than 100 lbs. If the object is not being worn or carried, it is affected. If the object is being worn, the creature wearing it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw or be affected. If the object is being carried, the creature carrying it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw or the object is affected.
An affected target is pulled up to 30 feet straight towards it, or pushed up to 30 feet straight away from it (the marauder's choice).

monster.name: Lurking Strangler
languages: understands Deep Speech and Common but can't speak

trait.name: Featherweight
entries: When the lurking strangler falls, its rate of descent is 60 feet per round. When it lands, it takes no falling damage and can land on its feet.

trait.name: Keen Sight
entries: The lurking strangler has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The lurking strangler makes two Slam attacks.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Strangulate
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}If the target is Large or smaller, the lurking strangler attaches to the target and pulls itself into the target's space, wrapping itself around their neck and strangling them. While attached, the lurking strangler moves with the target and has advantage on attack rolls against it. At the start of each of the target's turns while the lurking strangler is strangling it, it must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or gain one level of {@condition exhaustion}. Exhaustion gained this way is lost after 1 minute of rest.

A creature can try to use an action to detach the lurking strangler and force it to move into the nearest unoccupied space, doing so with a successful {@dc 14} Strength check. The creature who the lurking strangler is attached to has disadvantage on this check. On its turn, the lurking strangler can detach itself from the target by using 5 feet of movement. When it dies, the lurking strangler detaches from any creature it is attached to.

action.name: Eye Rays
entries: The lurking strangler shoots both of the following magical eye rays, choosing one to two targets it can see within 120 feet of it:

items.name: 1. Fear Ray
entries: The targeted creature must succeed on a {@dc 12} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

items.name: 2. Sleep Ray
entries: The targeted creature must succeed on a {@dc 12} Wisdom saving throw or fall asleep and remain {@condition unconscious} for 1 minute. The target awakens if it takes damage or another creature takes an action to wake it. This ray has no effect on Constructs and Undead.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting (Psionics)
headerEntries: The mind flayer casts one of the following spells, requiring no components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 15}):

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The mind flayer has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Tentacles
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d10 + 4}) psychic damage. If the target is Medium or smaller, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 11}) and must succeed on a {@dc 15} Intelligence saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until this grapple ends.

action.name: Extract Brain
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one {@condition incapacitated} Humanoid {@condition grappled} by the mind flayer. {@h}The target takes 55 ({@damage 10d10}) piercing damage. If this damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, the mind flayer kills the target by extracting and devouring its brain.

action.name: Mind Blast {@recharge 5}
entries: The mind flayer magically emits psychic energy in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 15} Intelligence saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 22 ({@damage 4d8 + 4}) psychic damage and it can't take reactions for 1 minute. Moreover, on its turn, it must choose whether it gets a move, an action, or a bonus action; it only gets one of the three. A creature can repeat its saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. On a success, a creature takes half as much damage and is otherwise unaffected.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting (Psionics)
headerEntries: The mind flayer casts one of the following spells, requiring no components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 15}):

trait.name: Magic Resistance

A creature can repeat its saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. On a success, a creature takes half as much damage and is otherwise unaffected.

headerEntries: The mind flayer casts one of the following spells, requiring no components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 15}):

headerEntries: The mind flayer casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 15}, {@hit 7} to hit with spell attacks):

entries: The mind flayer has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.
