A creature can repeat its saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. On a success, a creature takes half as much damage and is otherwise unaffected.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting (Psionics)
headerEntries: The mind flayer casts one of the following spells, requiring no components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 17}):

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the mind flayer fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The mind flayer has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The mind flayer makes two Eldritch Bolt attacks.

action.name: Tentacles
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}27 ({@damage 4d10 + 5}) psychic damage. If the target is Medium or smaller, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 12}) and must succeed on a {@dc 17} Intelligence saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until this grapple ends.

action.name: Extract Brain
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one {@condition incapacitated} Humanoid {@condition grappled} by the mind flayer. {@h}The target takes 55 ({@damage 10d10}) piercing damage. If this damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, the mind flayer kills the target by extracting and devouring its brain.

action.name: Eldritch Bolt
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 90 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d10 + 5}) force damage.

action.name: Unleash Void {@recharge 5}
entries: The mind flayer opens a rift into the Far Realm, centered on a point the mind flayer can see within 60 feet of itself, and a tentacle lashes across creatures near the rift. Each creature other than Mind Flayers within 30 feet of the rift must make a {@dc 17} Intelligence saving throw, after which the tentacle disappears and the rift closes. On a failed save, a creature 14 ({@damage 4d6}) psychic damage from the tentacle and is {@condition stunned} until the start of the mind flayer's next turn. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't {@condition stunned}. Regardless, each target then takes 14 ({@damage 4d6}) cold damage from the icy grip of the rift.

bonus.name: Warp Reality
entries: The mind flayer adds 4 to its AC against one attack that would hit it. To do so, the mind flayer must see the attacker. Then the mind flayer, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, magically teleports up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

legendary.name: Brain Leech
entries: The mind flayer chooses any number of {@condition incapacitated} creatures that it can see within 120 feet of itself. Each chosen target takes 12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) psychic damage and the mind flayer regains hit points equal to the psychic damage rolled.

legendary.name: Eldritch Bolt
entries: The mind flayer makes an Eldritch Bolt attack.

legendary.name: Cast a Spell (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The mind flayer uses Spellcasting.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting (Psionics)
headerEntries: The mind flayer casts one of the following spells, requiring no components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 15}):

trait.name: Awareness
entries: The mind flayer has advantage on initiative rolls and can't be surprised as long as it isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The mind flayer has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Tentacles
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d10 + 5}) psychic damage. If the target is Medium or smaller, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 13}) and must succeed on a {@dc 16} Intelligence saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until this grapple ends.

action.name: Extract Brain
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one {@condition incapacitated} Humanoid {@condition grappled} by the mind flayer. {@h}The target takes 55 ({@damage 10d10}) piercing damage. If this damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, the mind flayer kills the target by extracting and devouring its brain.

action.name: Mind Whip {@recharge}
entries: The mind flayer lashes out with psychic energy, targeting any number of creatures it can see within 60 feet of itself. Each target must make a {@dc 16} Intelligence saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 32 ({@damage 6d8 + 5}) psychic damage and is {@condition stunned} until the start of the mind flayer's next turn. On a success, a creature takes half as much damage and is not {@condition stunned}.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting (Psionics)
headerEntries: The mind flayer casts one of the following spells, requiring no components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 17}):

trait.name: Creature Sense
entries: The ulitharid is aware of the presence of creatures within 2 miles of it that have an Intelligence score of 4 or higher. It knows the distance and direction to each creature, as well as each creature's Intelligence score, but can't sense anything else about it. A creature protected by a {@spell mind blank} spell, a {@spell nondetection} spell, or similar magic can't be perceived in this manner.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The ulitharid has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Psionic Hub
entries: If an elder brain establishes a Psychic Link with the ulitharid, the elder brain can form a psychic link with any other creature the ulitharid can detect using its Creature Sense. Any such link ends if the creature falls outside the telepathy ranges of both the ulitharid and the elder brain. The ulitharid can maintain its psychic link with the elder brain regardless of the distance between them, so long as they are both on the same plane of existence. If the ulitharid is more than 5 miles away from the elder brain, it can end the psychic link at any time (no action required).

action.name: Tentacles
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. {@h}27 ({@damage 4d10 + 5}) psychic damage. If the target is Large or smaller, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 14}) and must succeed on a {@dc 17} Intelligence saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until this grapple ends.

action.name: Extract Brain
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one {@condition incapacitated} Humanoid {@condition grappled} by the mind flayer. {@h}The target takes 55 ({@damage 10d10}) piercing damage. If this damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, the mind flayer kills the target by extracting and devouring its brain.

action.name: Mind Blast {@recharge 5}
entries: The mind flayer magically emits psychic energy in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 15} Intelligence saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 31 ({@damage 4d12 + 5}) psychic damage and it can't take reactions for 1 minute. Moreover, on its turn, it must choose whether it gets a move, an action, or a bonus action; it only gets one of the three. A creature can repeat its saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. On a success, a creature takes half as much damage and is otherwise unaffected.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting (Psionics)
headerEntries: The elder brain casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 18}):

trait.name: Brine Pool Dependency
entries: While outside of its brine pool, it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw every minute or gain one level of {@condition exhaustion}. Any levels of {@condition exhaustion} caused by this trait go away after the elder brain spends 10 minutes resting in its brine pool.

trait.name: Creature Sense
entries: The elder brain is aware of creatures within 5 miles of it that have an Intelligence score of 4 or higher. It knows the distance and direction to each creature, as well as each one's Intelligence score, but can't sense anything else about it. A creature protected by a {@spell mind blank} spell, a {@spell nondetection} spell, or similar magic can't be perceived in this manner.

trait.name: Intellect Fortress
entries: Other Mind Flayers within 120 feet of the elder brain have resistance to psychic damage, as well as advantage on Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the elder brain fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The elder brain has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Telepathic Hub
entries: The elder brain can use its telepathy to initiate and maintain telepathic conversations with up to ten creatures at a time. The elder brain can let those creatures telepathically hear each other while connected in this way.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The elder brain makes two Tentacle attacks.

action.name: Tentacle
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 30 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d8 + 2}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Huge or smaller creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 15}) and takes 9 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) psychic damage at the start of each of its turns until the grapple ends. The elder brain can have up to four targets {@condition grappled} at a time.

action.name: Mind Blast {@recharge 5}
entries: The elder brain magically emits psychic energy in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 18} Intelligence saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 38 ({@damage 6d10 + 5}) psychic damage and it is {@condition stunned} until the end of the elder brain's next turn. On a success, a creature takes half as much damage and it's not {@condition stunned}.

bonus.name: Psychic Link
entries: The elder brain targets one {@condition incapacitated} creature it senses with its Creature Sense trait and establishes a psychic link with the target. Until the link ends, the elder brain can perceive everything the target senses. The target becomes aware that something is linked to its mind once it is no longer {@condition incapacitated}, and the elder brain can terminate the link at any time (no action required). The target can use an action on its turn to attempt to break the link, doing so with a successful {@dc 18} Charisma saving throw, which deals 10 ({@damage 3d6}) psychic damage to the target, regardless of the result of its saving throw. The link also ends if the target and the elder brain are more than 5 miles apart. The elder brain can form psychic links with up to ten creatures at a time.

bonus.name: Sense Thoughts
entries: The elder brain targets a creature with which it has a psychic link. The elder brain gains insight into the target's emotional state and foremost thoughts (including worries, loves, and hates).

legendary.name: Break Concentration
entries: The elder brain targets one creature within 120 feet of itself with which it has a Psychic Link.

The elder brain forcibly breaks the creature's {@status concentration} (if it's {@status concentration||concentrating} on anything). If the target was {@status concentration||concentrating} on a spell, it takes 2 ({@damage 1d4}) psychic damage per level of the spell.

legendary.name: Psychic Pulse
entries: The elder brain targets one creature within 120 feet of it with which it has a Psychic Link. The target and enemies of the elder brain within 30 feet of target take 10 ({@damage 3d6}) psychic damage.

legendary.name: Sever Psychic Link
entries: The elder brain targets one creature within 120 feet of it with which it has a Psychic Link. The elder brain ends the link, causing the creature to take 10 ({@damage 3d6}) psychic damage and have disadvantage on all ability checks, attack rolls, and saving throws until the end of the creature's next turn.

legendary.name: Tentacle
entries: The elder brain makes a Tentacle attack.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting (Psionics)
headerEntries: The mind ringer casts one of the following spells, requiring no components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 15}):

trait.name: Ambusher
entries: In the first round of a combat, the mind ringer has advantage on attack rolls against any creature it surprised.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The mind flayer has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Sneak Attack (1/Turn)
entries: The mind ringer deals an extra 14 ({@damage 4d6}) damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of the mind ringer that isn't incapacitated and the mind ringer doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The mind ringer makes either two Tentacles attacks and one Slam attacks or three Slam attacks.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit 8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Tentacles (Doppelganger Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d4 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Consume Memories
entries: The mind ringer touches a creature or the corpse of a creature that has been dead no longer than 1 hour. The mind ringer gains all of the target's memories and learns to perfectly mimic its voice. An unwilling creature can avoid this effect with a successful {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw, unless it's {@condition incapacitated}. Once the mind ringer has a creature's memories and voice, it has advantage on any Charisma ({@skill Deception}) or Charisma ({@skill Performance}) checks it makes to pass itself off as that creature.

action.name: Read Thoughts
entries: The mind ringer magically reads the surface thoughts of one creature within 60 feet of it. The effect can penetrate barriers, but 3 feet of wood or dirt, 2 feet of stone, 2 inches of metal, or a thin sheet of lead blocks it. While the target is in range, the mind ringer can continue reading its thoughts, as long as the mind ringer's {@status concentration} isn't broken (as if {@status concentration||concentrating} on a spell). While reading the target's mind, the mind ringer has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Insight}) and Charisma ({@skill Deception}, {@skill Intimidation}, and {@skill Persuasion}) checks against the target.

action.name: Mesmerizing Gaze {@recharge 5}
entries: The mind ringer stares into the eyes of a creature within 30 feet of it. If the target can see the mind ringer's eyes, it must make a {@dc 15} Intelligence saving throw. On a failure, a creature becomes {@condition charmed} by the mind ringer until the end of the mind ringer's next turn. A creature {@condition charmed} in this way is {@condition stunned}. On a success, a creature is not {@condition stunned}.

When the mind ringer uses this feature, it can choose whether or not to deal damage to the target. If it does, the target takes 36 ({@damage 8d8}) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

bonus.name: Cunning
entries: The mind ringer takes the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action.

bonus.name: Shapechanger
entries: The mind ringer polymorphs into a Small or Medium Humanoid it has seen, or back into its true form. Its statistics, other than its size, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

monster.name: Mooncalf
languages: understands Deep Speech but can't speak

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The mooncalf casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 16}):

trait.name: Creature Sense
entries: The mooncalf is aware of the presence of creatures within 1 mile of it that aren't Constructs or Undead. It knows the approximate distance and direction to each creature, but can't sense anything else about it. A creature protected by a {@spell mind blank} spell, a {@spell nondetection} spell, or similar magic can't be perceived in this manner.

trait.name: Keen Sight
entries: The mooncalf has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The mooncalf has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Unusual Nature
entries: The mooncalf doesn't require air or sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The mooncalf makes three Tentacle or Tongue Lash attacks and one Beak attack.

action.name: Beak
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d10 + 6}) piercing damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature {@condition grappled} by the mooncalf, that creature is swallowed, and the grapple ends. While swallowed, the creature is {@condition blinded} and {@condition restrained}, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the mooncalf, and it takes 21 ({@damage 6d6}) acid damage at the start of each of the mooncalf's turns. If the mooncalf takes 30 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the kraken must succeed on a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall {@condition prone} in a space within 10 feet of the mooncalf. If the mooncalf dies, a swallowed creature is no longer {@condition restrained} by it and can escape from the corpse using 10 feet of movement, exiting {@condition prone}.

action.name: Tentacle
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 30 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d8 + 6}) bludgeoning damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 18}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}. The mooncalf has two tentacles, each of which can grapple one target.

action.name: Tongue Lash
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d6 + 6}) slashing damage.

action.name: Bestial Madness (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: The mooncalf extends its will into the minds of each Beast within 60 feet of it. Each Beast in the area that can see the mooncalf must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition charmed} by the mooncalf for 1 hour. A Beast {@condition charmed} this way becomes psychotically violent, attacking anything within sight unless telepathically instructed otherwise by the mooncalf. A {@spell calm emotions} spell or a {@spell remove curse} spell cast on an affected Beast ends the condition early.

trait.name: Keen Sight
entries: The nothic has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The nothic has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The nothic makes two Claw attacks.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Rotting Gaze
entries: The nothic targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must make a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw against this magic, taking 10 ({@damage 3d6}) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

bonus.name: Weird Insight
entries: The nothic targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must contest its Charisma ({@skill Deception}) check against the nothic's Wisdom ({@skill Insight}) check. If the nothic wins, it magically learns one fact or secret about the target. The target automatically wins if it is immune to being {@condition charmed}.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The nothic casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 12}):

trait.name: Keen Sight
entries: The nothic has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The nothic has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The nothic makes two Claw attacks.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Rotting Gaze
entries: The nothic targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must make a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw against this magic, taking 10 ({@damage 3d6}) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

bonus.name: Weird Insight
entries: The nothic targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must contest its Charisma ({@skill Deception}) check against the nothic's Wisdom ({@skill Insight}) check. If the nothic wins, it magically learns one fact or secret about the target. The target automatically wins if it is immune to being {@condition charmed}.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The nothic casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 19}, {@hit 11} to hit with spell attacks):

trait.name: Keen Sight
entries: The nothic has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the nothic fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The nothic has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Rotting Gaze
entries: When a creature starts its turn within 30 feet of the nothic and is able to see the nothic's eye, the nothic can magically force it to make a {@dc 19} Constitution saving throw, unless the nothic is {@condition blinded} or {@condition incapacitated}. A creature takes 21 ({@damage 6d6}) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

Unless surprised, a creature can avert its eyes to avoid the saving throw at the start of its turn. If the creature does so, it can't see the nothic until the start of its next turn, when it can avert its eyes again. If the creature looks at the nothic in the meantime, it must immediately make the save.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The nothic makes three Arcane Burst or Claw attacks.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Arcane Burst
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 11} to hit, range 120 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d10 + 6}) psychic damage.

action.name: Weird Insight
entries: The nothic targets one creature it can see within 60 feet of it. The target must contest its Charisma ({@skill Deception}) check against the nothic's Wisdom ({@skill Insight}) check. If the nothic wins, it magically learns everything the target knows about itself, such as its name, beliefs, loyalties, and secrets. The target automatically wins if it is immune to being {@condition charmed}.

action.name: Maddening Abyss {@recharge}
entries: The nothic hurls a crackling orb of negative energy to a point within 60 feet of it. When it reaches its destination, the orb implodes into a swirling black hole. Each creature within a 30-foot-radius of the point must make a {@dc 19} Strength saving throw. A creature takes 36 ({@damage 8d8}) force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

A creature that fails its saving throw is sucked into the black hole and is banished to a harmful demiplane. While there, the creature is {@condition incapacitated} and it takes 18 ({@damage 4d8}) necrotic damage at the start of each of its turns. Any creature that dies within the demiplane is utterly annihilated and can't be resurrected by any means short of a {@spell true resurrection} spell. A creature in the demiplane can make a {@dc 19} Charisma saving throw at the end of each of its turns. On a success, a creature is able to escape the demiplane and reappears in the space it left or the nearest unoccupied if that space is occupied.

bonus.name: Beckon Hither
entries: The nothic beckons towards a creature that it can see within 120 feet of it and that can see the nothic. The target must succeed on a {@dc 19} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition charmed} by the nothic until the start of the nothic's next turn. While {@condition charmed} in this way, the target is {@condition incapacitated} and it must use its turn to approach the nothic by the most direct route. It doesn't avoid opportunity attacks, but before moving into damaging terrain, such as lava or a pit, and whenever it takes damage from a source other than the nothic, a target can repeat the saving throw.
A target that successfully saves is immune to this nothic's Beckon Hither for the next 24 hours.

legendary.name: Arcane Burst
entries: The nothic makes an Arcane Burst attack.

legendary.name: Teleport
entries: The nothic magically teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

legendary.name: Abnegating Claw (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The nothic makes a Claw attack. On a hit, the target takes an extra 13 ({@damage 2d12}) necrotic damage and it becomes cursed. A creature cursed in this way suffers a-5 penalty to attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws. A cursed target can make a {@dc 14} Charisma saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the curse on itself on a success. A {@spell remove curse} spell also ends the curse early.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The phaerimm casts one of the following spells, requiring no components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 17}):

trait.name: Arcane Sense
entries: The phaerimm can sense the presence of magic within 30 feet of it. When it senses magic in this way, the phaerimm sees a faint aura that shows the location of the magic and the creature, object, or area it's affecting, as well as its school of magic, if any.
This sense can penetrate most barriers, but is blocked by a thin sheet of lead.

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The phaerimm is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The phaerimm has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Phaerimm Mind
entries: The phaerimm can concentrate on two different spells simultaneously. If forced to make a Constitution saving throw in order to maintain {@status concentration}, it makes one saving throw for both spells. If its {@status concentration} ends, it ends for both spells.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The phaerimm makes four Claw attacks, one Bite attack, and one Stinger attack. Alternatively, the phaerimm makes two Claw attacks and uses Spellcasting.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Stinger
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. A creature {@condition poisoned} in this way floats 5 feet into the air and remains {@condition paralyzed} there. An affected creature can repeat its saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Implant Eggs (Recharges after 1 Year)
entries: The phaerimm makes a Stinger attack against an {@condition incapacitated} creature. On a hit, the phaerimm implants an egg into the target. A host can carry only one phaerimm egg to term at a time. Over 90 days, the egg moves to the chest cavity, gestates, and forms a phaerimm larva. In the 24-hour period before giving birth, the host starts to feel unwell, its speed is halved, and it has disadvantage on attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws. At birth, the larva chews its way through vital organs and out of the host's chest in 1 round, killing the host in the process. If the host dies before the larva is born, the larva dies after 24 hours.

The egg can be destroyed by any effect that cures a disease or via a surgery that takes 8 hours and requires a surgeon to succeed on a {@dc 20} Wisdom ({@skill Medicine}) check. If the check fails, the creature with the egg must succeed on a death saving throw or die.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The phaerimm casts one of the following spells, requiring no components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 19}):

trait.name: Arcane Sense
entries: The phaerimm can sense the presence of magic within 30 feet of it. When it senses magic in this way, the phaerimm sees a faint aura that shows the location of the magic and the creature, object, or area it's affecting, as well as its school of magic, if any.
This sense can penetrate most barriers, but is blocked by a thin sheet of lead.

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The phaerimm is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the phaerimm fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The phaerimm has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Phaerimm Mind
entries: The phaerimm can concentrate on two different spells simultaneously. If forced to make a Constitution saving throw in order to maintain {@status concentration}, it makes one saving throw for both spells. If its {@status concentration} ends, it ends for both spells.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The phaerimm makes four Claw attacks, one Bite attack, and one Stinger attack. Alternatively, the phaerimm makes two Claw attacks and uses Spellcasting.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d8 + 6}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d6 + 6}) slashing damage.

action.name: Stinger
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d6 + 6}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. A creature {@condition poisoned} in this way floats 5 feet into the air and remains {@condition paralyzed} there. An affected creature can repeat its saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Implant Eggs (Recharges after 1 Year)
entries: The phaerimm makes a Stinger attack against an {@condition incapacitated} creature. On a hit, the phaerimm implants an egg into the target. A host can carry only one phaerimm egg to term at a time. Over 90 days, the egg moves to the chest cavity, gestates, and forms a phaerimm larva. In the 24-hour period before giving birth, the host starts to feel unwell, its speed is halved, and it has disadvantage on attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws. At birth, the larva chews its way through vital organs and out of the host's chest in 1 round, killing the host in the process. If the host dies before the larva is born, the larva dies after 24 hours.

The egg can be destroyed by any effect that cures a disease or via a surgery that takes 8 hours and requires a surgeon to succeed on a {@dc 20} Wisdom ({@skill Medicine}) check. If the check fails, the creature with the egg must succeed on a death saving throw or die.

reaction.name: Spellfeast {@recharge 5}
entries: The phaerimm interrupts a creature that it can see that is casting a spell. If the spell is 3rd level or lower, it fails and has no effect. If the spell is 4th level or higher, the phaerimm makes a Charisma check ({@dc 10} + the spell's level). On a success, the spell fails and has no effect. If the phareimm makes a spell fail in this way, it regains hit points equal to five times the level of the spell.

legendary.name: Bite
entries: The phaerimm makes a Bite attack.

legendary.name: Cast a Spell (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The phaerimm uses Spellcasting to cast an at will spell.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The phaerimm casts one of the following spells, requiring no components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 13}):

trait.name: Arcane Sense
entries: The phaerimm can sense the presence of magic within 30 feet of it. When it senses magic in this way, the phaerimm sees a faint aura that shows the location of the magic and the creature, object, or area it's affecting, as well as its school of magic, if any.
This sense can penetrate most barriers, but is blocked by a thin sheet of lead.

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The phaerimm is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The phaerimm has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Phaerimm Mind
entries: The phaerimm can concentrate on two different spells simultaneously. If forced to make a Constitution saving throw in order to maintain {@status concentration}, it makes one saving throw for both spells. If its {@status concentration} ends, it ends for both spells.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The phaerimm makes four Claw attacks and one Stinger attack. Alternatively, the phaerimm makes two Claw attacks and uses Spellcasting.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) slashing damage.

action.name: Stinger
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. A creature {@condition poisoned} in this way floats 5 feet into the air and remains {@condition paralyzed} there. An affected creature can repeat its saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting (Psionics)
headerEntries: The proprietor casts one of the following spells, requiring no components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 20}):
will: {@spell plane shift} (must travel either to or from its lair)

trait.name: Amorphous
entries: The proprietor can move through a space as narrow as 5 feet wide without squeezing.

trait.name: Elastic Body
entries: The proprietor can spend 5 feet of movement to automatically escape from restraints, such as manacles, the {@condition restrained} condition, or a creature that has it {@condition grappled}.

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The proprietor is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the proprietor fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The proprietor has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Rejuvenation
entries: If the proprietor is destroyed while outside of its lair, it gains a new body in {@dice 3d10} weeks, regaining all its hit points and becoming active again. The new body appears in its lair.

trait.name: Scuttling Dash
entries: Whenever the proprietor first moves on its turn, if all of its hands are free, it can drop onto its hands and feet. If it does, its speed is doubled until the end of the start of its next turn. During this time, it can't make Fist attacks or use Fling or Rapid Reorganisation.

trait.name: Unusual Nature
entries: The proprietor doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The proprietor makes two Fist attacks, each of which it can replace with one use of Fling.

action.name: Fist
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 30 ft., one target. {@h}If the target is a Huge or smaller creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 22}). Until the grapple ends, the creature is {@condition restrained}. The proprietor has four Fists, each of which can grapple one target.

action.name: Fling
entries: One Huge or smaller object held or creature {@condition grappled} by the proprietor is thrown up to 60 feet in a random direction and knocked {@condition prone}. If a thrown target strikes a solid surface, the target takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) bludgeoning damage for every 10 feet it was thrown. If the target is thrown at another creature, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 22} Dexterity saving throw or take the same damage and be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Rapid Reorganisation {@recharge 5}
entries: For each free hand the proprietor has, it can choose up to two Huge or smaller creatures and/or objects within 30 feet of itself. For each chosen target, the proprietor moves that target to another unoccupied space within 30 feet of itself. A creature can avoid this with a successful {@dc 22} Dexterity saving throw. The proprietor can't attempt to move the same target more than once with the same use of this action.

Additionally, for each full hand the proprietor has, it can either use Fling on one or more of them or move whatever it's holding in that hand to an unoccupied space within 30 feet of itself and let go of whatever object or creature it's holding.

If an object would fall on top of a creature as a result of this action, the creature onto whom the object would fall must succeed on a {@dc 17} Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 1d6} bludgeoning damage for every 10 feet the object fell.

legendary.name: Command Bigby's Hand
entries: The proprietor immediately gains a bonus action that it uses to command one of its {@spell bigby's hand} spells.

legendary.name: Crush
entries: The proprietor deals 29 ({@damage 4d10 + 7}) bludgeoning damage to any number of creatures it has {@condition grappled}.

legendary.name: Fist
entries: The proprietor makes a Fist attack.

monster.name: Rukanyr
languages: understands Deep Speech and Kaorti but can't speak

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The rukanyr has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Reflexive Sunder
entries: Whenever a creature hits the rukanyr with an attack using a melee weapon, the attacker must make a {@dc 12} Dexterity saving throw or they're disarmed of the weapon used in the attack. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the weapon becomes trapped between the rukanyr's chitinous plates and, if the weapon is nonmagical, it is destroyed. Otherwise, the weapon remains stuck there. A creature can attempt to remove the weapon with a successful {@dc 17} Strength saving throw.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The rukanyr regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: The rukanyr deals double damage to objects and structures.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The rukanyr can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Sure-Footed
entries: The rukanyr has advantage on Strength and Dexterity ability checks and saving throws made against effects that would knock it {@condition prone}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The rukanyr makes two Pincer attacks, three Bite attacks, and one Tail Club attack.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must make a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw, taking 5 ({@damage 2d4}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Pincer
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d4 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Tail Club
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d10 + 5}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 17} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Sundering Roar {@recharge}
entries: The rukanyr emits a devastating roar from one of its mouths that fills a 60-foot cone. Each creature in the area must make a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw. A creature made of inorganic material such as stone, crystal, or metal has disadvantage on this saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 42 ({@damage 12d6}) thunder damage and becomes {@condition deafened} for 1 minute. A {@condition deafened} creature can repeat its saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. On a success, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't {@condition deafened}.

If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the roar affects a creature's items too. Each nonmagical item that the creature is wearing, carrying, or has on its person that's made of inorganic material such as stone, crystal, or metal is destroyed. Additionally, if the creature is made of inorganic material, it drops to 0 hit points.

monster.name: Shapemaster
languages: understands all languages but can only speak Deep Speech

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The shapemaster casts one of the following spells, requiring no components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 22}, {@hit 14} to hit with spell attacks):

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The shapemaster is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
entries: The shapemaster has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the shapemaster fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The shapemaster has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The shapemaster's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The shapemaster regains 25 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point.

trait.name: Transcendent Speaker
entries: Whenever the shapemaster speaks, any creature with an Intelligence or Wisdom score of 18 or higher can understand any spoken words it hears.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The shapemaster makes four Fist attacks and then uses Manipulate Shapes or Spellcasting.

action.name: Fist
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d8 + 7}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, the shapemaster can choose to grapple the target (escape {@dc 22}) instead of dealing damage.

action.name: Manipulate Shapes
entries: The shapemaster creates one of the following effects. Once the shapemaster uses a shape, it can't use the same shape again until its next turn.

action.name: Cone of Unmaking
entries: The shapemaster unleashes a blast of negative energy in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in the area must make a {@dc 22} Constitution saving throw, taking 45 ({@damage 10d8}) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The target is disintegrated if this damage leaves it with 0 hit points. A disintegrated creature and everything it is wearing and carrying, except magic items, are reduced to a pile of fine gray dust. The creature can be restored to life only by means of a true resurrection or a {@spell wish} spell.

action.name: Cube of Containment
entries: The shapemaster uses Spellcasting to cast the {@spell forcecage} spell, except the spell lasts until the start of the shapemaster's next turn.

action.name: Cylinder of Ascension
entries: The shapemaster uses Spellcasting to cast {@spell reverse gravity}, except the spell doesn't require {@status concentration}, the target area is a 20-foot-radius, 30-    foot-high cylinder, and the spell ends at the start of the shapemaster's next turn.

action.name: Line of Enigmas
entries: The shapemaster create a 10-foot-wide, 30-foot-long line centered on a point that it can see within 120 feet of itself and orientated how it chooses.

The affected area becomes lightly obscured and difficult terrain. Whenever a creature other than the shapemaster enters the area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, it must succeed on a {@dc 22} Intelligence saving throw or become {@condition charmed} by the area for as long as it remains. While {@condition charmed} in this way, a creature's speed is 0 and it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks. An affected creature can repeat its saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. The area vanishes after 1 minute or until the shapemaster uses this feature again.

action.name: Point of Creation
entries: The shapemaster uses Spellcasting to cast a random one of the following spells at 4th level: {@spell summon beast|TCE}, {@spell summon construct|TCE}, or summon    elemental. The spell doesn't require {@status concentration} and its duration changes to 1 minute. The summoned creature gains the benefits of the shapemaster's Magic Weapons.

action.name: Sphere of Transcendence
entries: The shapemaster fills a 20-foot-    radius sphere centered on a point that it can see within 120 feet of itself with overwhelming knowledge. Each creature in the area must make a {@dc 22} Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 36 ({@damage 8d8}) psychic damage and it suffers from a random bout of short-term madness (see page 259 of the Dungeon Master's Guide), which lasts until the end of its next turn. On a success, a creature briefly becomes enlightened and it gains the benefits of the {@spell foresight} spell until the end of its next turn and is otherwise unaffected.

legendary.name: Fist
entries: The shapemaster makes a Fist attack.

legendary.name: Manipulate Shapes
entries: The shapemaster uses Manipulate Shapes.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The sharn casts one of the following spells, requiring no components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 16}, {@hit 8} to hit with spell attacks):

trait.name: Amorphous
entries: The sharn can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

trait.name: Evasion
entries: If the sharn is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, the sharn instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

trait.name: Hastened
entries: The sharn has an additional action on each of its turns. That action can be used only to take the Attack action (one weapon attack only), Dash, Disengage, Hide, or Use an Object action.

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The sharn is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The sharn's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The sharn regains 15 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point. If the sharn takes damage from a spell of 3rd-level or higher, this trait doesn't function until the start of its next turn.

trait.name: Three Heads
entries: The sharn has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks and on saving throws against being {@condition blinded}, {@condition charmed}, {@condition deafened}, {@condition frightened}, {@condition stunned}, and knocked {@condition unconscious}.

trait.name: Slippery
entries: The sharn has advantage on ability checks and saving throws made to avoid or escape a grapple or the {@condition restrained} condition.

trait.name: Unusual Nature
entries: The sharn doesn't require air, drink, or sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The sharn makes three Bite attacks and three Claw attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) piercing damage plus 2 ({@damage 1d4}) force damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d4 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Hex Portals
entries: The sharn summons up to three 10-foot-diameter hexagonal portals at points it can see within 60 feet of itself. These portals are two-dimensional glowing hexagons filled with opaque blue mist that hover in place. The portal is only visible from one side (the sharn's choice), which is the side that functions as a portal.

The sharn can see through each of its portals and, using 10 feet of movement, teleport to the nearest unoccupied space within 5 feet of any one of them. Additionally, whenever the sharn makes a weapon attack or casts a spell, it can have its attack or spell originate in the space of one of its portals.

A portal vanishes if the sharn is ever more than 120 feet away from it or if affected by the {@spell dispel magic} spell. An {@spell antimagic field} spell suppresses the portal. The sharn can have up to three portals at a time. Creating more causes a different portal of the sharn's choosing to vanish.

bonus.name: Move Hex Portals
entries: The sharn moves any of its Hex Portals up to 30 feet to a point that it can see. As a part of this movement, the sharn can rotate a portal up to 180 degrees.

monster.name: Sionid
languages: understands Deep Speech but can't speak

trait.name: Keen Sight
entries: The sionid has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Luring Gaze
entries: When a creature starts its turn within 30 feet of the sionid and is able to see the sionid's eyes, the sionid can magically force it to make a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw, unless the sionid is {@condition blinded} or {@condition incapacitated}. On a failure, the creature becomes {@condition charmed} by the sionid for 1 minute.

While {@condition charmed} in this way, the target is {@condition incapacitated} and can't see anything other than the sionid. If the {@condition charmed} target is more than 5 feet away from the sionid, the target must move on its turn toward the sionid by the most direct route. It doesn't avoid opportunity attacks, but before moving into damaging terrain, such as lava or a pit, and whenever it takes damage from a source other than the sionid, a target can repeat the saving throw. A creature can also repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns. If a creature's saving throw is successful, the effect ends on it.

Unless surprised, a creature can avert its eyes to avoid the saving throw at the start of its turn. If the creature does so, it can't see the sionid until the start of its next turn, when it can avert its eyes again. If the creature looks at the sionid in the meantime, it must immediately make the save.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The sionid has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The sionid's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Reactive
entries: The sionid can take up to two reactions per round but only one per turn.

trait.name: Unusual Nature
entries: The sionid doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The sionid makes one Four-Fingered Claw attack and one Six-Fingered Claw attack.

action.name: Four-Fingered Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) slashing damage plus 2 ({@damage 1d4}) psychic damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw or, until the end of the sionid's next turn, the target's speed is halved and it has disadvantage on the next saving throw it makes in that time.

action.name: Impale
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one object or a creature that is {@condition incapacitated}, {@condition prone}, or {@condition restrained}. {@h}29 ({@damage 4d12 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Six-Fingered Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) slashing damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) poison damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. A creature {@condition poisoned} in this way takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage at the start of each of its turns. A creature can repeat its saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the condition on itself a success.

bonus.name: Grasping Dash
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}If the target is Medium or larger, the sionid pulls itself up to 10 feet in a straight line towards the target. If the target is Small or Tiny, the sionid pulls the target up to 10 feet straight towards itself.

reaction.name: Deadly Reach
entries: In response to a creature entering a space within 15 feet of it, the sionid makes one Four-Fingered Claw or Six-Fingered Claw attack against that creature.

monster.name: Sionid Darkseer
languages: understands Deep Speech but can't speak

trait.name: Eyebitten Sight
entries: The sionid is permanently under the effects of the {@spell eyebite} spell ({@dc 19}), except if a creature succeeds on its saving throw against the spell, the sionid can target that creature with the spell again after 1 hour.

trait.name: Keen Sight
entries: The sionid has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Luring Gaze
entries: When a creature starts its turn within 30 feet of the sionid and is able to see the sionid's eyes, the sionid can magically force it to make a {@dc 19} Wisdom saving throw, unless the sionid is {@condition blinded} or {@condition incapacitated}. On a failure, the creature becomes {@condition charmed} by the sionid for 1 minute.

While {@condition charmed} in this way, the target is {@condition incapacitated} and can't see anything other than the sionid. If the {@condition charmed} target is more than 5 feet away from the sionid, the target must move on its turn toward the sionid by the most direct route. It doesn't avoid opportunity attacks, but before moving into damaging terrain, such as lava or a pit, and whenever it takes damage from a source other than the sionid, a target can repeat the saving throw. A creature can also repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns. If a creature's saving throw is successful, the effect ends on it.

Unless surprised, a creature can avert its eyes to avoid the saving throw at the start of its turn. If the creature does so, it can't see the sionid until the start of its next turn, when it can avert its eyes again. If the creature looks at the sionid in the meantime, it must immediately make the save.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The sionid has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The sionid's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Reactive
entries: The sionid can take up to two reactions per round but only one per turn.

trait.name: Unusual Nature
entries: The sionid doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The sionid makes two Four-Fingered Claw attacks and two Six-Fingered Claw attacks. It can replace two attacks with an Impale attack.

action.name: Four-Fingered Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) slashing damage plus 5 ({@damage 2d4}) psychic damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 19} Wisdom saving throw or, until the end of the sionid's next turn, the target's speed is halved and it has disadvantage on the next saving throw it makes in that time.

action.name: Impale
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one object or a creature that is {@condition incapacitated}, {@condition prone}, or {@condition restrained}. {@h}30 ({@damage 4d12 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Six-Fingered Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) slashing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 19} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. A creature {@condition poisoned} in this way takes 14 ({@damage 4d6}) poison damage at the start of each of its turns. A creature can repeat its saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the condition on itself a success.

bonus.name: Eyebite
entries: The sionid activates the effects of the {@spell eyebite} spell (see Eyebitten Gaze).

bonus.name: Grasping Dash
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}If the target is Medium or larger, the sionid pulls itself up to 15 feet in a straight line towards the target. If the target is Small or Tiny, the sionid pulls the target up to 15 feet straight towards itself.

reaction.name: Deadly Reach
entries: In response to a creature entering a space within 15 feet of it, the sionid makes one Four-Fingered Claw or Six-Fingered Claw attack against that creature.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The skybleeder casts one of the following spells, requiring no components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 15}):

trait.name: Acid Rain
entries: The skybleeder constantly weeps a slimy red acid into spaces beneath it. At the start of each of its turns, the skybleeder deals 7 ({@damage 2d6}) acid damage to all objects directly below it.

Additionally, whenever a creature enters a space directly beneath the skybleeder for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, if there are no other creatures or objects between that creature and the skybleeder, that creature takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) acid damage.

trait.name: Keen Sight
entries: The skybleeder has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The skybleeder regains 20 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point. If the skybleeder takes fire damage, this trait doesn't function until the start of its next turn.

trait.name: Unnatural Mist
entries: As long as it isn't {@condition incapacitated}, the skybleeder constantly surrounds itself with an unnatural white mist that fills a 60-foot-radius and moves with it. The mist grants the skybleeder and creatures allied to it half cover and advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The skybleeder makes two Claw attacks, two Tentacle attacks, and uses Spellcasting.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d8 + 6}) slashing damage.

action.name: Tentacle
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d4 + 6}) bludgeoning damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) acid damage, and the target is pulled to the nearest unoccupied space beneath the skybleeder and is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 18}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}. The skybleeder has ten tentacles, each of which can grapple one target.

monster.name: Thrull
languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

trait.name: Echolocation
entries: The thrull can't use its blindsight while {@condition deafened}.

trait.name: Mind Prism
entries: Any time the thrull is targeted by an enchantment spell, the thrull is unaffected, and the effect is reflected back at the caster as though it originated from the thrull, turning the caster into the target.

trait.name: Psychic Absorption
entries: Whenever the thrull is subjected to psychic damage, it takes no damage and instead regains a number of hit points equal to the psychic damage dealt.

trait.name: Unusual Nature
entries: The thrull doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The thrull makes two Psionic Tendril attacks.

action.name: Psionic Tendrils
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) psychic damage.

action.name: Mindstutter (1/Day)
entries: The thrull unleashes a wave of brainfrying psychic energy in a 20-foot-radius around it. Each creature caught in the area must make a {@dc 13} Intelligence saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) psychic damage and is {@condition stunned} until the end of the thrull's next turn. On a success, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't {@condition stunned}.

monster.name: Thrull Pained One
languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

trait.name: Echolocation
entries: The thrull can't use its blindsight while {@condition deafened}.

trait.name: Mind Prism

trait.name: Psychic Absorption

trait.name: Rising Agony
entries: Whenever the thrull deals psychic damage to a creature, that creature gains a point of agony. A creature with agony suffers a penalty to attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws equal to the amount of agony they have. Additionally, they take 3 ({@damage 1d6}) psychic damage at the start of each of their turns for each agony they have. This damage does not cause the creature to gain more agony. After a creature takes this damage, they lose one agony.

trait.name: Unusual Nature
entries: The thrull doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The thrull makes three Psionic Pulse attacks.

action.name: Psionic Pulse
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 15 ft., one creature. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) psychic damage.

action.name: Spread the Pain {@recharge 5}
entries: Each creature within 60 feet of the thrull takes 14 ({@damage 4d6}) psychic damage. A creature can avoid this damage with a successful {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw.

monster.name: Thrull Stalker
languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

trait.name: Echolocation
entries: The thrull can't use its blindsight while {@condition deafened}.

trait.name: Evasion
entries: If the thrull is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, the thrull instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

trait.name: Mind Prism
entries: Any time the thrull is targeted by an enchantment spell, the thrull is unaffected, and the effect is reflected back at the caster as though it originated from the thrull, turning the caster into the target.

trait.name: Psychic Absorption
entries: Whenever the thrull is subjected to psychic damage, it takes no damage and instead regains a number of hit points equal to the psychic damage dealt.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The thrull can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Unusual Nature
entries: The thrull doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The thrull makes two Claw attacks. If both attacks hit a Large or smaller target, the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 13}).

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) slashing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) psychic damage.

bonus.name: Psionic Lasso
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 6} to hit, range 90 ft., one creature. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) psychic damage, and the target is pulled up to 20 feet in a straight line directly toward the thrull.

bonus.name: Snatcher's Step (1/Day)
entries: The thrull chooses a space within 500 feet of it that it can see, visualize, or note with distance and direction, such as "200 feet east." The thrull magically teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, to the chosen space, or the nearest unoccupied space if that space is occupied. The thrull can bring one Large or smaller creature along with it as it teleports. The chosen creature must either be a willing creature within 5 feet of it when it teleports or an unwilling creature {@condition grappled} by it when it teleports.
An unwilling creature can resist the teleportation with a successful {@dc 14} Charisma saving throw. However, if it fails its saving throw, it takes 21 ({@damage 6d6}) psychic damage as it teleports.

monster.name: Thrull Tormentor
languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

trait.name: Echolocation
entries: The thrull can't use its blindsight while {@condition deafened}.

trait.name: Mind Prism

trait.name: Nightmare Aura
entries: The thrull exudes an aura of horrific psychic influence in a 20-foot radius around it. Whenever a creature starts its turn in the area, the thrull can magically force it to make a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw, provided the thrull isn't {@condition incapacitated}. A creature takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Psychic Absorption
entries: Whenever the thrull is subjected to psychic damage, it takes no damage and instead regains a number of hit points equal to the psychic damage dealt.

trait.name: Unusual Nature

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d10 + 5}) bludgeoning damage. Hit or Miss: The impact sends out a psychic shockwave in a 15-foot cone, originating from a point in the target's space. Each creature caught in the area must make a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw, with advantage if the original attack missed. A creature takes 5 ({@damage 2d4}) force damage plus 5 ({@damage 2d4}) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Mind Grasp
entries: The thrull reaches out and grips the psyche of a creature that it can see within 60 feet of it. The thrull makes a Strength ({@skill Athletics}) check contested by the target's Intelligence check. If the thrull succeeds, the target becomes {@condition charmed} by the thrull. A creature {@condition charmed} this way is {@condition paralyzed}. The {@condition charmed} target can make a {@dc 16} Intelligence saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the Mind Grasp of all thrull tormentors for 1 hour.

trait.name: Exponential Growth
entries: If the time mite's hit point maximum increases to 30 or higher, it transforms into a {@creature time mite grub|ELDRITCH} and regains 8 ({@dice 2d4 + 3}) hit points.

trait.name: Reflective Carapace
entries: Any time the time mite is targeted by a {@spell magic missile} spell, a line spell, or a spell that requires a ranged attack roll, roll a {@dice d6}. On a 1 to 5, the mite is unaffected. On a 6, the mite is unaffected, and the effect is reflected back at the caster as though it originated from the mite, turning the caster into the target.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}The target becomes 10 ({@dice 3d6}) years older and the time mite's hit point maximum and current hit points increase by an amount equal to the years the creature is made older. If this effect brings a creature to an age equal to or greater than its species' average maximum lifespan, it must succeed on a {@dc 10} Constitution saving throw or die from old age. A greater restoration can restore a creature's age to normal.

trait.name: Devolving Rejuvenation
entries: A destroyed time mite gains a new body in {@dice 3d6} days, transforming into a {@creature time mite larva|ELDRITCH}, regaining all its hit points, and becoming active again. The new body appears within 5 feet of its original body.

monster.name: Urquirsh
languages: understands Deep Speech and Kaorti but can't speak

trait.name: Aversion to Lightning
entries: If the urquirsh takes lightning damage, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks until the end of its next turn.

trait.name: Death Burst
entries: When the urquirsh dies, the internal rift inside its body collapses, sending out a wave of sickening otherworldly magic. Each creature within20 feet of it must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. A creature {@condition poisoned} in this way can repeat its saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

trait.name: Dextrous Climber
entries: The urquirsh uses Dexterity ({@skill Acrobatics}), rather than Strength ({@skill Athletics}), to climb difficult surfaces.

trait.name: Internal Rift
entries: While it's in an area that blocks extraplanar travel, the urquirsh's speed is halved, it has disadvantage on attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws, and it can't use its Acid Bomb or Vile Spray actions.

trait.name: Stench
entries: Any creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of the urquirsh must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} until the start of its next turn. On a successful saving throw, the creature is immune to the Stench of all urquirsh for 24 hours.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The urquirsh makes three Claw attacks.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) slashing damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) acid damage.

action.name: Acid Bomb {@recharge 5}
entries: The urquirsh launches a globe of concentrated acid extracted from its planar rift to a point that it can see within 90 feet of it, which explodes at the target destination in a 20-foot-radius. Each creature in the area must make a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw, taking 21 ({@damage 6d6}) acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

bonus.name: Vile Spray {@recharge 5}
entries: The urquirsh sprays a vile otherworldly ooze, coating everything in a 20-foot-radius around the urquirsh and quickly hardening into a resin-like substance. Each creature in the area other than the urquirsh must succeed on a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw or become {@condition restrained} by the vile resin. As an action, a {@condition restrained} target can make a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw, freeing itself from the resin on a success. The resin coating a creature or object can also be attacked and destroyed (AC 13; 10 hit points; immunity to bludgeoning, poison, and psychic damage).

entries: The vivisector is permanently {@condition deafened}.

entries: The vivisector can't regain hit points by any means short of consuming organs.
