entries: If the vivisector is flying and dives at least 30 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a melee weapon attack, the attack deals an extra 7 ({@damage 2d6}) damage to the target.

trait.name: Evasion
entries: If the vivisector is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, the vivisector instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

trait.name: Flyby
entries: The vivisector doesn't provoke an opportunity attack when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

trait.name: Improved Critical
entries: The vivisector scores a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20.

trait.name: Organ Dependency
entries: The vivisector can't regain hit points by any means short of its Harvest Organs action.

trait.name: Unusual Nature
entries: The vivisector doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The vivisector makes two Claw attacks and one Stinger attack.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Stinger
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. While {@condition poisoned} in this way, a creature's speed is halved and it takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) poison damage at the start of each of its turns.

action.name: Harvest Organs
entries: The vivisector begins sucking out the internal organs from a creature within 5 feet of it. The target must be a creature with organs that is {@condition incapacitated} or dying, or is dead and has been dead no longer than 10 minutes. At the start of the vivisector's next turn, if it's still within 5 feet of the target and it isn't {@condition incapacitated}, it devors all of the creature's organs. If the creature is living, it instantly dies. The vivisector then regains hit points equal to half the hit point maximum of the creature whose organs it has consumed.

bonus.name: Vanish {@recharge 5}
entries: The vivisector becomes {@condition invisible} until the start of its next turn.

trait.name: Ambusher
entries: In the first round of a combat, the hook horror has advantage on attack rolls against any creature it surprised.

trait.name: Echolocation
entries: The hook horror can't use its blindsight while {@condition deafened}.

trait.name: Keen Hearing
entries: The hook horror has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on hearing.

trait.name: Poor Eyesight
entries: The hook horror has disadvantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Strong Climber
entries: The horror horror has advantage on Strength ({@skill Athletics}) checks made to climb difficult surfaces.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The hook horror makes two Hook attacks.

action.name: Beak
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}26 ({@damage 4d10 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Hook
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit (scores a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20), reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) piercing damage and the target is pulled up to 5 feet in a direction the hook horror chooses, provided the target remains within the hook horror's reach. Critical {@h}The target is knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Natural Explorer
entries: Choose any two of the following terrains: arctic, coast, desert, forest, grassland, mountain, swamp, or the Underdark. The explorer gains advantage on Intelligence and Wisdom ability checks related to the chosen terrains.
While traveling for an hour or more in one of their favored terrains, the explorer gains the following benefits:

items: Difficult terrain doesn't slow the explorer, or their group's travel.
The explorer can't become lost, except by magical means.
Even when they are engaged in another activity while traveling (such as foraging, navigating, or tracking), the explorer remains alert to danger.
If they are traveling alone, the explorer can move stealthily at a normal pace.
When they forage, the explorer finds twice as much food as they normally would.
While tracking other creatures, the explorer also learns their exact number, their sizes, and how long ago they passed through the area.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The explorer makes three Scimitar attacks.

action.name: Scimitar
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Light Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage and the target must make a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) poison damage and is {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat its saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success. On a success, a creature suffers half damage and is not {@condition poisoned}.

bonus.name: Lightfooted
entries: The explorer takes the Dash or Disengage action.

trait.name: Brute
entries: A melee weapon deals one extra die of its damage when the slaver hits with it (included in the attack).

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The slaver has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the slaver's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The slaver makes three Glaive or Javelin attacks. It can replace one attack with a Man Catcher or Reinforced Net attack.

action.name: Glaive
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d10 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Javelin
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Man Catcher
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. {@h}The target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 14}). Until this grapple ends, the creature has disadvantage on attack rolls, the creature takes 10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) piercing damage whenever it attempts to break the grapple, and the slaver can't constrict another target.

action.name: Reinforced Net
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 10/20 ft., one creature. {@h}If the target is Large or smaller, it is {@condition restrained} until it is freed. The net has no effect on creatures that are formless, or creatures that are Huge or larger. A creature can use its action to make a {@dc 15} Strength check, freeing itself or another creature within its reach on a success. Dealing 15 slashing damage to the net (AC 12) also frees the creature without harming it, ending the effect and destroying the net.

bonus.name: Aggressive
entries: The slaver moves up to its speed toward an enemy that it can see.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The guard makes two Longsword attacks.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) slashing damage.

action.name: Light Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 3} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d8 + 1}) piercing damage.

bonus.name: Reposition
entries: The guard issues orders to one ally it can see wtihin 30 feet of it. If the target can see or hear the guard, it can spend its reaction to move up to its speed. This movement doesn't provoke opportunity attacks.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The mageknight casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 15}):

trait.name: Force-Empowered Weapons
entries: The mageknight's weapon attacks are magical. When the knight hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra {@damage 1d10} force damage (included in the attack).

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The mageknight has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: War Caster
entries: The mageknight has advantage on Constitution saving throws that it makes to maintain its {@status concentration} when it takes damage.
Additionally, the mageknight can perform the somatic components of spells even when it has weapons or a shield in one or both hands.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The mageknight makes three Pike or Force Ray attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of Spellcasting.

action.name: Pike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) piercing damage plus 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage.

action.name: Force Ray
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 120 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) force damage.

reaction.name: Force Lance
entries: In response to a creature entering its reach, the mageknight makes one melee attack against that creature. On a hit, the target takes an extra 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage and is pushed 10 feet away from the mageknight.

trait.name: Amorphous
entries: The ooze can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

trait.name: Aversion to Fire
entries: If the ooze takes fire damage, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks until the end of its next turn.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The ooze can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Unusual Nature
entries: The ooze doesn't require sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The ooze makes two Psuedopod attacks.

action.name: Psuedopod
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) acid damage.

bonus.name: Change Shape
entries: The ooze transforms into a Medium or Small corporeal creature or object with which it is familiar. Other than its size and speed, its statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed, but it can create nonmagical replicas of any equipment it is familiar with. The ooze reverts to its true form if it dies.

reaction.name: Unsettling Visage
entries: In response to a creature making an attack roll against it, the ooze briefly alters its form in a way that is distressing to the creature. Unless the attacker is immune to the {@condition frightened} condition, it suffers disadvantage on the triggered attack.

trait.name: Accursed Touch
entries: The strix's weapon attacks are magical. When the strix hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra {@damage 1d6} necrotic damage (included in the attack).

trait.name: Flyby
entries: The strix doesn't provoke an opportunity attack when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Sight
entries: The strix has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The strix makes one Beak attack and one Talons attack. It then uses Death Feathers.

action.name: Beak
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Talons
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 2d4 + 3}) piercing damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Death Feathers
entries: The strix releases a wave of black energy from its feathers in a 30-foot-radius around it that drains the willpower of those around it. Each creature caught in the area must make a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw, taking 7 ({@damage 2d6}) necrotic damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one. A creature that fails its saving throw by 5 or more falls {@condition prone}.

bonus.name: Baleful Gaze {@recharge 5}
entries: The strix gazes into the eyes of a creature that it can see within 60 feet of it. As long as that creature can see the strix's eyes, it must succeed on a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw or become cursed by the strix. A creature cursed in this way has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as ability checks and saving throws that use Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma.
The curse persists until the strix dies, but a {@spell remove curse} spell or similar magic cast on the target ends the curse early.

legendaryGroup.name: Lich
lairActions: On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), the lich can take a lair action to cause one of the following magical effects; the lich can't use the same effect two rounds in a row:

entries: The lich regains one expended use of any of the spells granted to it by its Spellcasting action of 8th level or lower, chosen at random.

The lich targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. A crackling cord of negative energy tethers the lich to the target. Whenever the lich takes damage, the target must make a DC 20 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the lich takes half the damage (rounded down), and the target takes the remaining damage. This tether lasts until initiative count 20 on the next round or until the lich or the target is no longer in the lich's lair.

The lich calls forth the spirits of creatures that died in its lair. These apparitions materialize and attack one creature that the lich can see within 60 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 20 Constitution saving throw, taking 52 (15d6) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a success. The apparitions then disappear.

regionalEffects: The region containing a lich's lair is warped by the lich's magic, which creates one or more of the following effects:

entries: Nonmagical plants within 10 miles of the lich's lair wither and die over 1d4 days.
Allies of the lich within 1 mile of its lair have advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened, and against features that turn Undead.
Whenever a non-Undead creature within 1 mile of the lich's lair would regain hit points, it regain half that many hit points instead.

regionalEffects: If the lich's phylactery is destroyed, these effects fade over the course of 10 days.

legendaryGroup.name: Demilich
lairActions: On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), the demilich takes a lair action to cause one of the following effects; the demilich can't use the same effect two rounds in a row:

entries: The tomb trembles violently for a moment. Each creature on the floor of the tomb must succeed on a DC 19 Dexterity saving throw or be knocked prone.

The demilich targets one creature it can see within 60 feet of it. The effects of the {@spell antimagic field} spell fills the space of the target, moving with it until initiative count 20 on the next round.
The demilich targets any number of creatures it can see within 30 feet of it. None of the chosen targets target can regain hit points until initiative count 20 on the next round.

regionalEffects: A demilich's tomb might have any or all of the following effects in place:

entries: The first time a non-Evil creature enters the lair, the creature takes 16 (3d10) necrotic damage.
Allies of the demilich in the tomb have advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened, and against features that turn Undead.

The tomb is warded against the magical travel of creatures the demilich hasn't authorized. Such creatures can't teleport into or out of the tomb's area or use planar travel to enter or leave it. Effects that allow teleportation or planar travel work within the tomb as long as they aren't used to leave or enter the tomb's area.

regionalEffects: If the demilich's phylactery is destroyed, these effects fade over the course of 10 days.

legendaryGroup.name: Hierossa
lairActions: On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), the hierossa can take a lair action to cause one of the following magical effects; the hierossa can't use the same effect two rounds in a row:

entries: The hierossa regains one expended use of any of the spells granted to it by its Spellcasting action of 8th level or lower, chosen at random.

The hierossa secretly creates a {@spell glyph of warding} on any surface it can see in its lair. If the glyph is a Spell Glyph, it contains any spell of 5th-level or lower that's on the cleric spell list. The glyph vanishes on initiative count 20 of the next round.
The hierossa gains the benefits of the {@spell sanctuary} spell until initiative count 20 of the next round (spell save DC 20).

regionalEffects: The region containing a hierossa's lair is warped by the hierossa's magic, which creates one or more of the following effects:

entries: The area of the hierossa's lair is affected by the {@spell hallow} spell (it choses the affected creature types and secondary effect).
Allies of the hierossa within 1 mile of its lair have advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened, and against features that turn Undead.
Whenever a creature that worships a deity or faith opposed to the hierossa's deity within 1 mile of the hierossa's lair would regain hit points, it regain half that many hit points instead.

regionalEffects: If the hierossa's phylactery is destroyed, these effects fade over the course of 10 days.

legendaryGroup.name: Thraze
lairActions: On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), the thraze can take a lair action to cause one of the following magical effects; the thraze can't use the same effect two rounds in a row:

entries: The thraze uses its Summon Blights legendary action.

Until initiative count 20 of the next round, the thraze's lair becomes filled with the effects of the {@spell spike growth} spell. The thraze and any Plants or Undead allied to it are immune to the spell's effects.

The thraze becomes surrounded by thorns until initiative count 20 of the next round. During this time, the thraze has half cover and whenever a creature touches the thraze or hits it with a melee attack, that creature takes 10 (3d6) slashing damage.

regionalEffects: The region containing a thraze's lair is warped by the thraze's magic, which creates one or more of the following effects:

entries: Nonmagical plants within 30 miles of the lich's lair wither and die over 1d4 days.
Allies of the thraze within 1 mile of its lair have advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened, and against features that turn Undead.
Non-Insect Beasts with an Intelligence score of 6 or less that aren't allied to the thraze refuse to step within 10 miles of its lair unless compelled otherwise.

regionalEffects: If the thraze's phylactery tree is destroyed, these effects fade over the course of 10 days.

legendaryGroup.name: Mummy Lord
lairActions: On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), the mummy lord takes a lair action to cause one of the following effects; the mummy lord can't use the same effect two rounds in a row:

entries: Each Undead creature in the lair can pinpoint the location of each living creature within 120 feet of it until initiative count 20 on the next round.
Each Undead in the lair has advantage on saving throws until initiative count 20 on the next round.

Until initiative count 20 on the next round, any non-Undead creature that tries to cast a spell of 4th level or lower in the mummy lord's lair is wracked with pain. The creature can choose another action, but if it tries to cast the spell, it must make a DC 16 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, it takes 1d6 necrotic damage per level of the spell, and the spell has no effect and is wasted.

regionalEffects: A mummy lord's temple or tomb is warped in any of the following ways by the creature's dark presence:

entries: Food instantly molders and water instantly evaporates when brought into the lair. Other non magical drinks are spoiled - wine turning to vinegar, for instance.

Divination spells cast within the lair by creatures other than the mummy lord have a 25 percent chance to provide misleading results, as determined by the DM. If a divination spell already has a chance to fail or become unreliable when cast multiple times, that chance increases by 25 percent.

A creature that takes treasure from the lair is cursed until the treasure is returned. The cursed target has disadvantage on all saving throws. The curse lasts until removed by a remove curse spell or other magic.

regionalEffects: If the mummy lord is destroyed, these regional effects end immediately.

legendaryGroup.name: Vampire
lairActions: On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), the vampire takes a lair action to cause one of the following effects; the vampire can't use the same effect two rounds in a row:

entries: Until initiative count 20 of the next round, the vampire can pass through solid walls, doors, ceilings, and floors as if they weren't there.

The vampire targets one Medium or smaller creature that casts a shadow. The target's shadow must be visible to the vampire and within 30 feet of him. If the target fails a DC 17 Charisma saving throw, its shadow detaches from it and becomes a shadow that obeys the vampire's commands, acting on initiative count 20. A remove curse spell cast on the target restores its natural shadow, but only if its undead shadow has been destroyed.

The vampire targets any number of doors and windows that it can see, causing each one to either open or close as it wishes. Closed doors can be magically locked (functioning as per the arcane lock spell) until the vampire chooses to end the effect, or until it uses this lair action again.

regionalEffects: The region surrounding a vampire's lair is warped by the creature's unnatural presence, creating any of the following effects:

entries: There's a noticeable increase in the populations of bats, rats, and wolves in the region.
Plants within 500 feet of the lair wither, and their stems and branches become twisted and thorny.
Shadows cast within 500 feet of the lair seem abnormally gaunt and sometimes move as though alive.
A creeping fog clings to the ground within 500 feet of the vampire's lair. The fog occasionally takes eerie forms, such as grasping claws and writhing serpents.

regionalEffects: If the vampire is destroyed, these effects end after 2d6 days.

legendaryGroup.name: Aboleth
lairActions: On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), the lich can take a lair action to cause one of the following magical effects; the lich can't use the same effect two rounds in a row:

entries: The aboleth uses Spellcasting to cast the {@spell phantasmal force} spell (no components required) on any number of creatures it can see within 60 feet of it. While maintaining concentration on this effect, the aboleth can't take other lair actions. If a target succeeds on the saving throw or if the effect ends for it, the target is immune to the aboleth's phantasmal force lair action for the next 24 hours, although such a creature can choose to be affected.

Pools of water within 90 feet of the aboleth surge outward in a grasping tide. Any creature on the ground within 20 feet of such a pool must succeed on a DC 16 Strength saving throw or be pulled up to 20 feet into the water and knocked prone.

Water in the aboleth's lair magically becomes a conduit for the creature's rage. The aboleth can target any number of creatures it can see in such water within 90 feet of it. A target must succeed on a DC 16 Wisdom saving throw or take 7 (2d6) psychic damage. The aboleth can't use this lair action again until it has used a different one.

regionalEffects: The region containing an aboleth's lair is warped by the creature's presence, which creates one or more of the following effects:

entries: Underground surfaces within 1 mile of the aboleth's lair are slimy and wet and are difficult terrain.
Water sources within 1 mile of the lair are supernaturally fouled. Enemies of the aboleth that drink such water vomit it within minutes.

As an action, the aboleth can create an illusory image of itself within 1 mile of the lair. The copy can appear at any location the aboleth has seen before or in any location a creature charmed by the aboleth can currently see. Once created, the image lasts for as long as the aboleth maintains concentration, as if concentrating on a spell. Although the image is intangible, it looks, sounds, and can move like the aboleth. The aboleth can sense, speak, and use telepathy from the image's position as if present at that position. If the image takes any damage, it disappears.

regionalEffects: If the aboleth dies, the first two effects fade over the course of 3d10 days.

legendaryGroup.name: Helicrux
lairActions: When fighting inside its lair, an helicrux can invoke the ambient magic to take lair actions. On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), the helicrux takes a lair action to cause one of the following effects; the helicrux can't use the same effect two rounds in a row:

entries: The helicrux uses Spellcasting to cast the {@spell mirror image} spell. If the helicrux is using its Mindbending Humming bonus action, each duplicate created by the spell also produces the humming to the same effect.

The helicrux causes a crystalline amber in its lair to shatter, releasing a specter in its space. The {@creature specter} takes its turn immediately after the lair action on initiative count 20 of each round and fights to protect the helicrux. The helicrux can use an action to transform a specter created by this lair action back into crystal amber. If reduced to 0 hit points, it vanishes and its soul is freed.

The helicrux chooses a point within 120 feet of it that it can see, creating a 20-foot-radius pool of inky shadows centered at the chosen point, which lasts until initiative count 20 of the next round. Each creature standing on solid ground within the area must succeed on a DC 17 Dexterity saving throw or become restrained until the shadow disappears. The ground in the area is difficult terrain for the duration.

regionalEffects: The region containing an helicrux's lair is warped by the creature's presence, which creates one or more of the following effects:

entries: Creatures within 1 mile of the helicrux's lair grow increasingly paranoid, feeling as though something is watching them.

Within the helicrux's lair, all ambient noise, such as chirping birds, whistling winds, rainfall, or running water, are reduced to the point where only a creature with a passive Wisdom (Perception) of 20 or higher can hear them. Conversely, the radius of the helicrux's Mindbending Humming is doubled.
If cast within 1 mile of the helicrux's lair, the area affected by the {@spell silence} spell or similar magic is halved.

regionalEffects: If the helicrux dies, these effects fade immediately.

legendaryGroup.name: Elder Brain
lairActions: On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), an elder brain can take one of the following lair actions; the elder brain can't take the same lair action two rounds in a row:

entries: The elder brain uses Spellcasting to cast the {@spell wall of force} spell.

The elder brain targets one creature it can sense within 120 feet of it and anchors it by sheer force of will. The target must make a DC 18 Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, its speed is reduced to 0 and it can't teleport until intiative count 20 of the next round.

The elder brain targets one friendly creature it can sense within 120 feet of it. The target has a flash of inspiration and gains advantage on one attack roll, ability check, or saving throw it makes before the end of its next turn.

regionalEffects: The territory within 5 miles of an elder brain is altered by the creature's psionic presence, which creates one or more of the following effects:

entries: Creatures within 5 miles of an elder brain feel as if they are being followed, even when they're not.

Any creature with which the elder brain has formed a psychic link hears faint, incomprehensible whispers in the deepest recesses of its mind. This psychic detritus consists of the elder brain's stray thoughts commingled with those of other creatures to which it is linked.

The elder brain can overhear any telepathic conversation within 5 miles of it. The creature that initiated the telepathic conversation makes a DC 18 Wisdom saving throw when telepathic contact is first established. If the save is successful, the creature is aware that something is eavesdropping. The nature of the eavesdropper isn't revealed.

regionalEffects: If the elder brain dies, these effects immediately end.

legendaryGroup.name: Shapemaster
lairActions: On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), the shapemaster takes a lair action to cause one of the following effects; the shapemaster can't use the same effect two rounds in a row:

entries: The shapermaster psychically imposes a riddle into the mind of a creature that it can see within 60 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 22 Intelligence saving throw or become stunned until intiative count 20 of the next round as it ponders the inscrutable riddle. A creature with an Intelligence score of 3 or lower is unaffected.

The shapemaster contorts the terrain and air currents within its lair. Until initiative count 20 of the next round, the shapemaster's lair is difficult terrain for all creatures except the shapemaster.

A random shape appears in a space within 60 feet of the shapemaster. One random Manipulate Shapes effect emanates from the chosen point as if the shapemaster occupied that space. The shape then disappears.

regionalEffects: The region containing a shapemaster's lair is warped by its magic, which creates one or more of the following effects:

entries: Whenever a creature hostile to the shapemaster casts a spell or creates an effect that affects an area while within 1 mile of the shapemaster's lair, the area of that spell or effect is halved in all dimensions. This effect can't reduce a dimension of a spell's affected area to less than 5 feet.

Rock formations, flora, and other natural phenomenon take on unnatural shapes within 5 miles of the shapemaster's lair. For example, a rock may form into a perfect circle or cube, while a tree might grow in a mathematically perfect spiral or sprout branches that fit neatly within some invisible cylinder.

A random shape appears in a space within 60 feet of the shapemaster. One random Manipulate Shapes effect emanates from the chosen point as if the shapemaster occupied that space. The shape then disappears.

regionalEffects: If the shapemaster dies, these effects fade over the course of 1d10 days.

legendaryGroup.name: Proprietor
lairActions: On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), the proprietor takes a lair action to cause one of the following effects; the proprietor can't use the same effect two rounds in a row:

entries: Until initiative count 20 of the next round, the proprietor can see everywhere in its lair simultaneously. During this time, no creature in the proprietor's lair can be hidden or heavily obscured from the proprietor, no matter where it is within the lair.

The proprietor changes the architecture of its lair in a manner mimicking the {@spell bones of the earth} or {@spell wall of stone} spells. The created structures are engraved in a manner of the proprietor's choosing. These changes last until initiative count 20 of the next round, whereupon they revert to normal unless the proprietor concentrates to maintain them (as if concentrating on the spells as normal). If the proprietor concentrates on these changes for 1 minute, they become permanent.

An arm, identical to one of the proprietor's arms, emerges from a solid surface within the lair. The proprietor can immediately make one Fist attack from the arm's space. The proprietor's blindsight functions from the arm's space. The arm remains until initiative count 20 of the next round, whereupon it vanishes, whereupon it harmless recedes back into the wall.

regionalEffects: A proprietor's lair is created to somewhat mimic the Material Plane, with a number of (often accidental) distinctions.

entries: Within the lair, the architecture frequently shifts to represent vague interpretations of the memories of living creatures within the lair.
Whenever a creature sleeps within the lair, their dreams are often intruded upon by the eyes of the proprietor, as it observes them and their dreams while they sleep.
Non-Aberrations within the lair don't age, nor do they require food or drink to survive (though they still feel hunger and thirst).

The proprietor's lair is somewhat uncomfortable for most non-Aberrations in a manner determined at random by the DM. For example, the lair might always be too hot, too cold, or its air pressure may be too low. Whenever a non-Aberration creature in the lair finishes a long rest, if it has one or more levels of exhaustion, its level of exhaustion doesn't decrease unless it succeeds on a DC 10 Constitution saving throw.

table.caption: Random Eye Rays
rows: Banishing Ray. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Charisma saving throw or be banished to a harmless demiplane for 1 minute. While there, the target is incapacitated. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success, at which point the target reappears in the space it left or in the nearest unoccupied space if that space is occupied.
Charm Ray. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw or be charmed by the beholder for 1 hour, or until the beholder harms the creature.

Confusion Ray. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw, or it can't take reactions until the end of its next turn. On its turn, the target can't move, and it uses its action to make a melee or ranged attack against a randomly determined creature within range. If the target can't attack, it does nothing on its turn.
Death Ray. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw or take 55 (10d10) necrotic damage. The target dies if the ray reduces it to 0 hit points.

Disintegration Ray. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw or take 45 ({@damage 10d8}) force damage. If this damage reduces the creature to 0 hit points, its body becomes a pile of fine gray dust. If the target is a Large or smaller nonmagical object or creation of magical force, it is disintegrated without a saving throw. If the target is a Huge or larger object or creation of magical force, this ray disintegrates a 10-foot cube of it.
Enervation Ray. If the target is a creature, it must make a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw, taking 36 ({@damage 8d8}) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

Fear Ray. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw or be frightened for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.
Force Ray. The target must succeed on a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw or take 27 ({@damage 6d8}) force damage and be pushed 15 feet directly away from the beholder and knocked prone.
Freezing Ray. The target must succeed on a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw or take 18 ({@damage 4d8}) cold damage and become restrained until the end of its next turn.

Hallucination Ray. The targeted creature must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw or begin seeing an illusion of a second director. The image lasts until the start of the director's next turn and until then it perfectly mimics the director's movements and actions, making it impossible to discern which is the illusion and which is real. While the illusion lasts, the affected creature has disadvantage on saving throws against the director's other Eye Rays and whenever it attempts to target the director with an attack, effect, or spell, other than an area effect, it must roll a d20. On a 10 or lower, the attack, effect, or spell targets the illusion and has no effect. A creature can that see through illusions, such as a creature with truesight, is not affected in this way.

Immolation Ray. The target must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or burst into flames; until someone takes an action to douse the fire, the creature takes 11 ({@damage 2d10}) fire damage at the start of each of its turns.

Lightning Ray. The target must make a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw, taking 22 ({@damage 4d10}) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Then up to two different targets of the beholder's choice within 10 feet of the original target are subjected to the ray's effects.

Paralyzing Ray. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or be paralyzed for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

Petrification Ray. If the target is a creature, it must make a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature begins to turn to stone and is restrained. It must repeat the saving throw at the end of its next turn. On a success, the effect ends. On a failure, the creature is petrified until freed by the greater restoration spell or other magic.

Polymorph Ray. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw or be polymorphed into a Beast of challenge rating 1 or lower of the beholder's choice for 1 minute, as per the polymorph spell.

Sleep Ray. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw or fall asleep and remain unconscious for 1 minute. The target awakens if it takes damage or another creature takes an action to wake it. This ray has no effect on constructs and undead.

Slowing Ray. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the target's speed is halved for 1 minute. In addition, the creature can't take reactions, and it can take either an action or a bonus action on its turn, not both. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

Shrink Ray. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution or suffer the effects of the Reduce effect of the {@spell enlarge/reduce} spell for 1 minute, except the damage of its attacks is reduced by 7 ({@damage 3d4}). The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

Sleep Ray. The target must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw or fall asleep and remain unconscious for 1 minute. The target awakens if it takes damage or another creature takes an action to wake it. This ray has no effect on Constructs and Undead.

Telekinetic Ray. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw or the beholder moves it up to 30 feet in any direction. It is restrained by the ray's telekinetic grip until the start of the beholder's next turn or until the beholder is incapacitated. If the target is an object weighing 300 pounds or less that isn't being worn or carried, it is moved up to 30 feet in any direction. The beholder can also exert fine control on objects with this ray, such as manipulating a simple tool or opening a door or a container.
table.name: Random Eye Rays
